properties.Description: Boat Ramp 1 - Off Beaumont Road on the right side of the Ngongotaha Stream outlet. The ramp can have sand build up.

properties.Title: 2.Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Rotorua
properties.Description: Boat Ramp 2 - Off Reemee Street on the left side of Ngongotaha Stream outlet.

properties.Title: 3.Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Rotorua
properties.Description: Boat ramp 3 - Hamurana Boat Ramp

properties.Title: 4.Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Rotorua
properties.Description: Boat Ramp 4 - Hamuarana Stream mouth ramp

properties.Title: 5.Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Rotorua
properties.Description: Willow Ave boat ramp. Hannahs Bay, with plenty of parking and a large picnic area.

properties.Title: 6.Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Rotorua
properties.Description: Boat Ramp 6 - Sulphur Point boat ramp. Good launching for larger boats.

properties.Title: 1.Off Okahu Road
properties.subtitle: Waiau River
properties.Description: Access point 1 is off SH38, then from Okahu Road, the headwaters may be accessed by walking track into the Wairoa Stream, and from SH38 via Whites Clearing into the Parahaki Stream. Whites Clearing is private land so permission required, contact Ahurei Adventures phone 07 366 3941.OPEN SEASON:All YearFISHING METHODS:Fly, SpinDAILY BAG LIMIT: 2

properties.Title: 2.Culvert 41
properties.subtitle: Waiau River
properties.Description: Access point 2 is from Parahaki to Te Waiotukapiti, where the river can be accessed from a walking track or route which provides access to the river in many places.OPEN SEASON:All YearFISHING METHODS:Fly, SpinDAILY BAG LIMIT: 2

properties.Title: 3.Putere Road end
properties.subtitle: Waiau River
properties.Description: Access point 3 is at the end of Putere Road, where the Mangahopai Stream can be followed down to the river. Once in the river bed anglers can fish both up and downstream. Remain in the river bed due to the adjoining private land.

properties.Title: 4.Waireka Road bridge
properties.subtitle: Waiau River
properties.Description: Access point 4 - Park at the Waireka Road bridge. Access is from the bridge up and down stream.

properties.Title: 5.Otoi Domain
properties.subtitle: Waiau River
properties.Description: Access point 5 is a short distance past the Waireka bridge. Turn into the Otoi Domain and follow the rough vehicle track to the river. Park at the Otoi Domain where camping is permitted.

properties.Title: 6.Ruapapa Road
properties.subtitle: Waiau River
properties.Description: Access point 6 is via Ruapapa Road at Mangaone Stream bridge. The true right side of the Mangaone Stream down to the Waiau River is marginal strip and it's possible to access the Waiau River by walking down the Stream.

properties.Title: 7.Patunamu Road
properties.subtitle: Waiau River
properties.Description: Access point 7 - The Waiau River can be accessed in a number of places from Patunamu Road which runs adjacent to it for several kilometres.

properties.Title: 8.Raupapa Road
properties.subtitle: Waiau River
properties.Description: Access point 8 - Raupapa Road runs near the river which can be accessed in various places.

properties.Title: 9. Ruapapa Road bridge
properties.subtitle: Waiau River
properties.Description: Access point 9 is beside Ruapapa Road bridge at the confluence with Waikaretaheke River. It's wider and slower but still holds reasonable numbers of trout. Downstream to the Wairoa River most access is via private property, permission required.

properties.Title: 10.Lake Rotonuiaha
properties.subtitle: Putere Lakes
properties.Description: Access point 10 to Lake Rotonuiaha is from off Waireka Road. Permission required from land owners. Phone John Broad on 06 8388894. The Putere Road side of Rotonuiaha is private land owned by the Putere marae - permission also required.OPEN SEASON:All YearFISHING METHODS:Fly, SpinDAILY BAG LIMIT: 2

properties.Title: 10.Lake Rotoroa
properties.subtitle: Wairoa Fishery
properties.Description: Access point 10 is public access on marginal strip around much of the western side of Lake Rotoroa and the lake can be accessed on this strip.OPEN SEASON:All YearFISHING METHODS:Fly, SpinDAILY BAG LIMIT: 2

properties.Title: 11.Lake Road
properties.subtitle: Waikaretaheke River
properties.Description: Access point 11 is off SH38 (Lake Road) downstream of Piripaua. A marked access point is the start of an angler access route along the river bank. Best suited to spin fishing. Heavy fast water.

properties.Title: 12.Parkhurst
properties.subtitle: Waikaretaheke River
properties.Description: Access point 12 at 'Parkhurst ' is a marked access point to the river along an esplanade strip on the river edge. A sign at the upstream end indicates the end of public access. Suited to fly and spin fishing.

properties.Title: 13.Lake Road
properties.subtitle: Waikaretaheke River
properties.Description: Access point 13 is off SH38 (Lake Road) at gravel pit lay-by area. A marked access point is the start of an angler access route along the river bank. Suitable for fly and spin fishing.OPEN SEASON:All YearFISHING METHODS:Fly, SpinDAILY BAG LIMIT: 2

properties.Title: 14.Waihi Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Waikaretaheke River
properties.Description: Access point 14 is alongside the Waihi Road Bridge. The river can be accessed here.OPEN SEASON:All YearFISHING METHODS:Fly, SpinDAILY BAG LIMIT: 2

properties.Title: 15.Wairoa River
properties.subtitle: Wairoa River
properties.Description: Access point 15 is beside the Wairoa River begins below the Te Reinga Falls at the confluence of the Ruakituri and Hangaroa Rivers. It is a wide slow river carrying a high water volume.OPEN SEASON:All YearFISHING METHODS:Fly, SpinDAILY BAG LIMIT: 2

properties.Title: 16.Waimaha Station
properties.subtitle: Hangaroa River
properties.Description: Access point 16 is from the Waimaha Road Bridge. Anglers wishing to cross the Waimaha Station to the river must obtain permission from Waimaha Station management, Phone 06 867 0234.OPEN SEASON:All YearFISHING METHODS:Fly, SpinDAILY BAG LIMIT: 2

properties.Title: 17.At Tahunga
properties.subtitle: Hangaroa River
properties.Description: Access point 17 is from the Pehiri Road bridge. Access both up and down stream. Marginal strips extend both up and downstream along the river banks in most of this area.OPEN SEASON:All YearFISHING METHODS:Fly, SpinDAILY BAG LIMIT: 2

properties.Title: 18.Pehiri Road
properties.subtitle: Hangaroa River
properties.Description: Access point 18 is from Pehiri Road both up and down stream.OPEN SEASON:All YearFISHING METHODS:Fly, SpinDAILY BAG LIMIT: 2

properties.Title: 19.Tiniroto Road
properties.subtitle: Hangaroa River
properties.Description: Access point 19 is via Tiniroto Road and follows the river for some distance with access possible from the road side.OPEN SEASON:All YearFISHING METHODS:Fly, SpinDAILY BAG LIMIT: 2

properties.Title: 20.Ruakaka Road
properties.subtitle: Hangaroa River
properties.Description: Access point 20 is off Ruakaka Road at Donneraille Park providing picnicking and camping with the river readily accessible for fishing. Plenty of safe parking.OPEN SEASON:All YearFISHING METHODS:Fly, SpinDAILY BAG LIMIT: 2

properties.Title: 21.Ruakaka Road
properties.subtitle: Hangaroa River
properties.Description: Access point 21 is where Ruakaka Road crosses the river again and provides another access point.OPEN SEASON:All YearFISHING METHODS:Fly, SpinDAILY BAG LIMIT: 2

properties.Title: 22.Te Reinga
properties.subtitle: Hangaroa River
properties.Description: Access point 22 via Te Reinga to the river here, near where the Hangaroa and the Ruakituri River converge. This is slow water and lower quality fishing.OPEN SEASON:All YearFISHING METHODS:Fly, SpinDAILY BAG LIMIT: 2

properties.Title: 23.Kents Lake
properties.subtitle: Tiniroto Lakes
properties.Description: Access point 23 - For many years only one of the Tiniroto Lakes has held trout. This is 'Kents Lake', access off Ruakaka Road at Tiniroto. It's best fished from a small boat – two row boats are available to use. With issues with the lake water quality over summer, stocking of this lake may still occur if conditions are viable.

properties.Title: 24.Kotare Road
properties.subtitle: Mangapoike River
properties.Description: Access point 24 is off Kotare Road from Tinoroto Road.OPEN SEASON:All YearFISHING METHODS:Fly, SpinDAILY BAG LIMIT: 2

properties.Title: 25.Mangapoike Road
properties.subtitle: Mangapoike Stream
properties.Description: Access point 25 is at the Mangapoike Road Bridge to access the Mangapoike Stream that feeds the Mangapoike River.OPEN SEASON:All YearFISHING METHODS:Fly, SpinDAILY BAG LIMIT: 2

properties.Title: 26.Paparatu Road
properties.subtitle: Mangapoike River
properties.Description: Access point 26 is from the Gisborne side, off Paparatu Road off Waingake Road.OPEN SEASON:All YearFISHING METHODS:Fly, SpinDAILY BAG LIMIT: 2

properties.Title: 1.Te Reinga Falls
properties.subtitle: Ruakituri River
properties.Description: Access point 1 - Ruakituri Road comes off the Gisborne to Wairoa inland route (SH36). There is river access both above and below the Te Reinga Falls. Below the falls the combined waters of the Hangaroa River and Ruakituri River become the Wairoa River.OPEN SEASON:1 Oct - 30 JunFISHING METHODS:FlyDAILY BAG LIMIT: 2

properties.Title: 2.Pihanga
properties.subtitle: Ruakituri River
properties.Description: Access point 2 - Pihanga is a collection of farm buildings about 10km from Te Reinga. The river can be accessed from the road, as well as from a dry weather vehicle track leading to the river.OPEN SEASON:1 Oct - 30 JunFISHING METHODS:FlyDAILY BAG LIMIT: 2

properties.Title: 3.Ruakituri Bridge (Boothman bridge).
properties.subtitle: Ruakituri River
properties.Description: Access point 3 - Just past the Ruakituri School a bridge crosses the river enabling easy access to the river.OPEN SEASON:1 Oct - 30 JunFISHING METHODS:FlyDAILY BAG LIMIT: 2

properties.Title: 4.Erepiti Bridge
properties.subtitle: Ruakituri River
properties.Description: Access point 4 - Along Ruakituri Road, Erepiti Road leads off at the end of the seal, in about 1km crosses the Erepiti Bridge. The river may be accessed both up and downstream at this point.Upstream leads into the Erepiti Gorge Scenic Reserve with access up the river during times of low flow.OPEN SEASON:1 Oct - 30 JunFISHING METHODS:FlyDAILY BAG LIMIT: 2

properties.Title: 5.Erepiti Gorge and Reserve
properties.subtitle: Ruakituri River
properties.Description: Access point 5 - Anglers fishing the gorge should exercise extreme caution. Accessing the river in this area involves a large number of river crossings and the river can rise rapidly during rain. Anglers should avoid the gorge when the weather is forecast to deteriorate.OPEN SEASON:1 Oct - 30 JunFISHING METHODS:FlyDAILY BAG LIMIT: 2

properties.Title: 6.Smiths Bridge
properties.subtitle: Ruakituri River
properties.Description: Access point 6 - Smiths Bridge is located about 1km along Ngapakira Road off Papuni Road. and crosses the Ruakituri River. No public access on the true right, which is private property. However, the bridge allows easy access to the true left bank of the river.OPEN SEASON:1 Oct - 30 JunFISHING METHODS:FlyDAILY BAG LIMIT: 2

properties.Title: 7.Willow Flat
properties.subtitle: Ruakituri River
properties.Description: Access point 7 - About 1. 5km further on from Ngapakira Road a dirt track gives vehicle access to the Ruakituri Road. This is Puhoro Station, where camping is permitted by landowners by the river.OPEN SEASON:1 Oct - 30 JunFISHING METHODS:FlyDAILY BAG LIMIT: 2

properties.Title: 8.Ruakituri Reserve
properties.subtitle: Ruakituri River
properties.Description: Access point 8 - Further upstream from Willow Flat, the Ruakituri Reserve lies across the river. There is easy access to the river from the road in this area.OPEN SEASON:1 Oct - 30 JunFISHING METHODS:FlyDAILY BAG LIMIT: 2

properties.Title: 9.Papuni Station
properties.subtitle: Ruakituri River
properties.Description: Access point 9 - The Makokomuka Stream marks the boundary between Puhoro Station and Papuni Station. A Ford across the stream (Papuni Ford) provides a landmark for easy recognition of this boundary.OPEN SEASON:1 Oct - 30 JunFISHING METHODS:FlyDAILY BAG LIMIT: 2

properties.Title: 10.Waitangi Falls
properties.subtitle: Ruakituri River
properties.Description: Access point 10 - The river above Waitangi Falls is within Te Urewera. Access is via the walking track from the Lockwood at the end of Papuni Road.OPEN SEASON:1 Oct - 30 JunFISHING METHODS:FlyDAILY BAG LIMIT: 2

properties.Title: 11.Anini Stream
properties.subtitle: Ruakituri River/Anini Stream
properties.Description: Access point 11 - The Anini Stream flows into the Ruakituri River well above the Waitangi Falls. It can be accessed either travelling upstream above Waitangi Falls [no tracks] or 5-6hr walk via Rua's Track from Waimaha Station.OPEN SEASON:1 Oct - 30 JunFISHING METHODS:FlyDAILY BAG LIMIT: 2

properties.Title: 12.Waipaoa Stream
properties.subtitle: Ruakituri River/Waipaoa Stream
properties.Description: Access point 12 - It is possible to access the Waipaoa Stream through the Ruakituri Reserve on the true right of the river. The stream is made up of a boulder stream bed with bush clad banks.OPEN SEASON:1 Oct - 30 JunFISHING METHODS:FlyDAILY BAG LIMIT: 2

properties.Title: 1.Tautika Road
properties.subtitle: Rangitaiki River
properties.Description: Access point 1 is off Kiorenui Road approximately 10 Km from Murupara into the Kaingaroa Forest. Following Tautika Road to the Rangitaiki River enables access both up and downstream.

properties.Title: 2.Ngahuinga Road
properties.subtitle: Rangitaiki River
properties.Description: Access point 2 - This road comes off Kiorenui Road about 1 km south of Tautika Road and gives access to the Rangitaiki River both up and downstream.

properties.Title: 1.Lake McLaren
properties.subtitle: Tauranga Fishery
properties.Description: Access point 1 from SH29, sign posted at the McLaren Road turn off. Set in a tranquil park, Lake McLaren, a hydro lake, is in the upper Wairoa catchment and on the eastern side of the Kaimai ranges. The lake is formed from the damming of the Opuaki and Mangapapa streams and flows into the Ruahihi canal.

properties.Title: 2.Ruahihi Canal
properties.subtitle: Tauranga Fishery
properties.Description: Access point 2 is from McLaren's falls road off SH29 or from Ruahihi Road. Gates are frequently closed but foot access is available. The canal, which flows from Lake McLaren is popular and known for its summer evening rise.

properties.Title: 1.Hine Rae Historic Reserve
properties.subtitle: Waioeka River
properties.Description: Access point 1 is the reserve area 8 km from Opotiki off State Highway 2. A track leads to the river which is a wide shingle river bed suitable for spin fishing.

properties.Title: 2.Culvert 41
properties.subtitle: Waioeka River
properties.Description: Access point 2 is off a loop road layby area which gives access to a side track on to the river.

properties.Title: 3.Aro Aro Bridge
properties.subtitle: Waioeka River
properties.Description: Access point 3 is on the upstream side of Aro Aro Bridge, follow a track down to the Aro Aro Stream, then further down under the SH2 road bridge to the river.

properties.Title: 4.Pine Trees
properties.subtitle: Waioeka River
properties.Description: Access point 4 - Park on the road side just past angler access sign. Follow a short track or route to the river. The river is accessed down the bank.

properties.Title: 5.Rest Area
properties.subtitle: Waioeka River
properties.Description: Access point 5 - Look for the rest area on the river side of the road. From the Angler Access sign, drive to the river side down a gravel access track through native bush. This is an attractive family picnic area and suits spin fishing.

properties.Title: 6.4WD track
properties.subtitle: Waioeka River
properties.Description: Access point 6 - An Angler Access sign marks the start of a short track to the river, which is most suitable for high clearance vehicles. The river here has a mostly shingle bed, suitable for fly or spin fishing.

properties.Title: 7.Side Track
properties.subtitle: Waioeka River
properties.Description: Access point 7 - An Angler Access sign marks the start of this track. Gives vehicle access to the river, where some boulder areas are now appearing. Good for spin or fly fishing.

properties.Title: 8.Owhiritoa Stream
properties.subtitle: Waioeka River
properties.Description: Access point 8 - Park at the layby at the Mangapumarumaru Stream confluence and take the short track down to the river. Faster water with rapids and pools, suits nymphing and spin fishing.

properties.Title: 9.Macrocarpa Tree
properties.subtitle: Waioeka River
properties.Description: Access point 9 - Look out for an old macrocarpa tree in a grassy area towards the river. Take a vehicle access track and park near the tree, and to the right of the grassy area look for a track down a small gully to the river.

properties.Title: 10.Gravel Pit
properties.subtitle: Waioeka River
properties.Description: Access point 10 is upstream of Grahams Bridge, a large gravel pit area gives good access to the river. Suits fly or spin fishing.

properties.Title: 11.Tauranga Bridge (stream)
properties.subtitle: Waioeka River
properties.Description: Access point 11 - The Tauranga Bridge (stream) carpark. Good access up and downstream from the bridge.NOTE; Upstream of the bridge the season is 1 Oct - 30 June. Downstream of the bridge season is 1 Oct - 30 Sept.

properties.Title: 12.Culvert 98
properties.subtitle: Waioeka River
properties.Description: Access point 12 - Opposite culvert 98 the river can be accessed by climbing down bank reinforcing rocks to the river bed.

properties.Title: 13.Flow Gauge (Culvert 2)
properties.subtitle: Waioeka River
properties.Description: Access point 13 - Look for the river flow gauge tower. A short distance further upstream locate culvert 2. Park on the road side and then walk back downstream about 10m and look for a steep 'zig zag' track down to the river.

properties.Title: 14.Kahikatea Tree, (Culvert 35)
properties.subtitle: Waioeka River
properties.Description: Access point 14 - Look for a Kahikatea tree on the side of the road, and an access track which starts near it, leading to the river.

properties.Title: 15.Waiata Bridge
properties.subtitle: Waioeka River
properties.Description: Access point 15 - The river can be accessed from near the Waiata Bridge. Good parking at a rest area.

properties.Title: 16.Fishermans Bend
properties.subtitle: Waioeka River
properties.Description: Access point 16 - Look for the F&G Angler Access sign, and take a 4WD vehicle track to the river. Suits spin or fly fishing.

properties.Title: 17.Culvert 60
properties.subtitle: Waioeka River
properties.Description: Access point 17 - Park on the roadside near culvert 60, and take the track down to the river. Narrow, deep, swift water. Suits a heavy nymph.

properties.Title: 18.Culvert 70
properties.subtitle: Waioeka River
properties.Description: Access point 18 - Opposite culvert 70 a good benched track leads down to the river.OPEN SEASON:All YearSIZE LIMIT: NoneFISHING METHODS:Fly/Spin/NymphDAILY BAG LIMIT: 2

properties.Title: 19.Culvert 83
properties.subtitle: Waioeka River
properties.Description: Access point 19 - Park near culvert 83 and starting at the culvert, take a steep track down through bush to the river.

properties.Title: 20.Omaukora Stream
properties.subtitle: Waioeka River
properties.Description: Access point 20 - Park safely on the downstream side of the bridge and take the track to the river, which is just next to the bridge.

properties.Title: 21.Wairata
properties.subtitle: Waioeka River
properties.Description: Access point 21 - Cross the bridge on Wairata Road. Just after the bridge on the right a short track leads to the confluence of the Waioeka River and Opato Stream.

properties.Title: 22.Redpath Road
properties.subtitle: Waioeka River
properties.Description: Access point 22 - The Waioeka River can be easily accessed from various points along Redpath Road which runs alongside it. There are also several picnic spots, so this is also a location suitable for families.

properties.Title: 23.Redpath Road end
properties.subtitle: Waioeka River
properties.Description: Access point 23 - This gives access to the upper river, through farmland and into the DOC land. Access across private property to the river is at the discretion of the land owners, the Redpaths. Please call ahead for permission, phone 07 315 7763. Please leave all gates as you find them, and respect the privilege of access through their property. Nikau Hut (DOC) is situated about 3 hours walk up river from the road end. Check with DOC for track conditions as slips in the past have affected parts of the DOC walking track.

properties.Title: 24.The Monument
properties.subtitle: Opato Stream
properties.Description: Access point 24 - At the Monument Rest Area, steps lead to the stream. There is good access upstream from this point.

properties.Title: 25.Upstream of Monument
properties.subtitle: Opato Stream
properties.Description: Access point 25 - About 250m upstream from the Monument, park in the off road area where the old road line cuts behind a small hill. Follow the old road behind the hill and in the corner of the road line, locate a track which leads downhill to the stream.

properties.Title: 26.Lone Matai Tree
properties.subtitle: Opato Stream
properties.Description: Access point 26 - Park safely in a layby downstream of an old lone Matai tree. The track starts about 100m downstream, at the rear of a grassy area, behind a roadside barrier. Take this track through the bush to the stream.

properties.Title: 27.Gibsons Bridge
properties.subtitle: Opato Stream
properties.Description: Access point 27 - From the carpark, just upstream of the bridge, take the track down to the stream. There is good access both up and downstream from this point.

properties.Title: 28.Manganuku Bridge and rest area/camp ground
properties.subtitle: Opato Stream
properties.Description: Access point 28 - Park in the DOC picnic area/camping ground. This gives access to the Opato Stream and to the Manganuku Stream.

properties.Title: 29.Upper Opato Stream
properties.subtitle: Opato Stream
properties.Description: Access point 29 - The Opato Stream can be accessed in various places upstream of the Manganuku Stream confluence. This area is best fished in early season while water levels are usually higher and does not hold high numbers of fish, but can be worth a look by those looking for a small stream experience.

properties.Title: 30.Koranga Road end
properties.subtitle: Koranga Stream
properties.Description: Access Point 30 - From the Koranga Road end, a public walking track follows the stream down to the Koranga Forks, where there is a DOC hut situated. This is about a 2–3hr walk. The Koranga Stream can be accessed from this track in many places. At the Koranga Forks anglers can access the Kahanui Stream, or go downstream which is the Waioeka River.

properties.Title: 1.Lake Maraetai
properties.subtitle: Waikato River and Hydro Lakes
properties.Description: Access point 1 - A good boat ramp with plenty of parking is available in Mangakino, and the lake offers a variety of water to fish, from secluded arms, to the inflow of the Mangakino River.OPEN SEASON:All YearSIZE LIMIT: No LimitFISHING METHODS:Fly/Spin/BaitDAILY BAG LIMIT: None

properties.Title: 1.Lake Maraetai Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Waikato River and Hydro Lakes
properties.Description: Access point 1 - A good boat ramp with plenty of parking is available in Mangakino, and the lake offers a variety of water to fish, from secluded arms, to the inflow of the Mangakino River.

properties.Title: 2.Lake Maraetai – 'Twin Lakes
properties.subtitle: Waikato River and Hydro Lakes
properties.Description: Access point 2 - This is an arm of Lake Maraetai, intersected by SH32 which offers a small lake experience.

properties.Title: 3.Mangakino River
properties.subtitle: Waikato River and Hydro Lakes
properties.Description: Access point 3 - The river is accessible upstream from the lake for some distance in a small boat and offers good fishing especially summer through into autumn.OPEN SEASON:All YearSIZE LIMIT: No LimitFISHING METHODS:Fly/Spin/BaitDAILY BAG LIMIT: None

properties.Title: 4.Lake Whakamaru
properties.subtitle: Waikato River and Hydro Lakes
properties.Description: Access point 4 - Pokuru Road. The road provides access to the lake shore in several places.

properties.Title: 5.Lake Whakamaru
properties.subtitle: Waikato River and Hydro Lakes
properties.Description: Access point 5 - A camping area is situated off SH32, this is operated by the South Waikato District Council, and a small boat ramp is situated on the end side of the camp.

properties.Title: 5.Lake Whakamaru Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Waikato River and Hydro Lakes
properties.Description: Access point 5 - A camping area is situated off SH32, this is operated by the South Waikato District Council, and a small boat ramp is situated on the end side of the camp.

properties.Title: 6.Lake Whakamaru
properties.subtitle: Waikato River and Hydro Lakes
properties.Description: Access point 6 - SH30 – Dunham's Point reserve. This provides a camping area, toilets, picnic area, and a small boat launching area.

properties.Title: 7.Lake Whakamaru
properties.subtitle: Waikato River and Hydro Lakes
properties.Description: Access point 7 - Ongarahu Stream. This stream mouth can be productive in summer in cool water inflows in the lake, best access is by boat.

properties.Title: 8.Mangaharakeke Stream mouth
properties.subtitle: Waikato River and Hydro Lakes
properties.Description: Access point 8 - This stream mouth can fish very well in summer and autumn. Small boats can be launched from a track near the highway bridge off SH30.

properties.Title: 9.Atiamuri Dam tailwater
properties.subtitle: Waikato River and Hydro Lakes
properties.Description: Access point 9 - Turn off SH1 into Atiamuri Power Station Road and take the Waikato River trail to the left. A short walk along the trail gives access through a reserve to the river about 150m downstream of the tail race. The river can be accessed downstream to the SH1 bridge.

properties.Title: 10.Lake Atiamuri
properties.subtitle: Waikato River and Hydro Lakes
properties.Description: Access point 10 - Drive through the village to a boat ramp, jetty and parking and picnic area.

properties.Title: 11.Lake Ohakuri Dam tailwater
properties.subtitle: Waikato River and Hydro Lakes
properties.Description: Access point 11 - To access the dam tailwater take the road below the dam on the true left, and park by the bridge with a locked gate on it. Walk across the bridge and find 2 access tracks on the true right bank.

properties.Title: 12.Lake Ohakuri
properties.subtitle: Waikato River and Hydro Lakes
properties.Description: Access point 12 - A boat ramp and parking area is situated on the true left of the dam, accessed off Ohakuri Road.

properties.Title: 13.Lake Ohakuri Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Waikato River and Hydro Lakes
properties.Description: Access point 13 - Whirinaki Arm reserve. Boat ramp, toilets, carpark and parking area. The road bridge is a short distance downstream and is low and prevents most boats travelling under it.

properties.Title: 14.Lake Ohakuri Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Waikato River and Hydro Lakes
properties.Description: Access point 14 - Whirinaki Arm. A small boat ramp, jetty and parking area below Whirinaki Valley Road. From here, boats can access the main body of Lake Ohakuri going downstream.

properties.Title: 15.Tutukau Road bridge
properties.subtitle: Waikato River and Hydro Lakes
properties.Description: Access point 15 - A boat ramp and jetty gives access to the river both upstream and downstream. This is an alternative ramp to access Lake Ohakuri with plenty of good areas on the river in between.

properties.Title: 16.Deep Creek (Torepatutahi Stream)
properties.subtitle: Waikato River and Hydro Lakes
properties.Description: Access point 16 - Access off Vaile Road to a river side reserve which has a good boat ramp. Good fishing at the Deep Creek stream mouth especially in summer.

properties.Title: 17.Ohaaki Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Waikato River and Hydro Lakes
properties.Description: Access point 17 - On the true left of river upstream of the bridge is a small boat launching area.

properties.Title: 18.River Road
properties.subtitle: Waikato River and Hydro Lakes
properties.Description: Access point 18 - Boat ramp and parking. Gives access to the upper river.

properties.Title: 19.Pueto Stream
properties.subtitle: Waikato River and Hydro Lakes
properties.Description: Access point 19 - Look for the F&G Angler Access sign on Broadlands Road and take a 500m track to the stream mouth. There are some side-tracks which access the stream between the road and the mouth in various places.

properties.Title: 20.Upper Waikato River
properties.subtitle: Waikato River and Hydro Lakes
properties.Description: Access point 20 - There is no angler access below the Aratiatia Dam due to swift and dangerous flows. However, further downstream there is access to the Waikato River from the Reserve along Nga Awa Purua Road.

properties.Title: 3.Ngamuwahine River
properties.subtitle: Tauranga Area Fishery
properties.Description: Access point 3 is from the unsealed Ngamuwahine Road, off SH29 into the Kaimai Mamaku forest park.

properties.Title: 4.Omanawa Stream
properties.subtitle: Tauranga Area Fishery
properties.Description: Access point 4 is from either Omanawa or Belk Roads from SH29 via private property, to the Omanawa Stream. The stream runs North and enters the Wairoa River below the Ruahihi power station.

properties.Title: 5.Wairoa River
properties.subtitle: Tauranga Area Fishery
properties.Description: Access point 5 is from SH29, to the Wairoa River. The lower reaches are tidal and can be accessed by boat from the SH2 bridge boat ramp.

properties.Title: 6.Ohourere (Minden) Stream
properties.subtitle: Tauranga Area Fishery
properties.Description: Access point 6 is off Crawford Road, from Wairoa Rd and SH2 near Bethlehem and through private property.

properties.Title: 8.Waimapu Stream
properties.subtitle: Tauranga Area Fishery
properties.Description: Access point 8 - is off Oropi (from SH29) and Heriford Roads though private property (seek landowner permission),to the Waimapu Stream.

properties.Title: 10.Kaituna River
properties.subtitle: Tauranga Area Fishery
properties.Description: Access point 10 to the Kaituna River flows from Lake Rotoiti near Rotorua, through bush clad gorge, into farm land before entering the sea near Maketu. Access lower reaches from Rangiuru Road or Kaituna River Road East.

properties.Title: 11.Waiari Stream
properties.subtitle: Tauranga Area Fishery
properties.Description: Access point 11 to Waiari Stream is from Te Matai and No 1 roads off SH2 just east of TePuke, and through private property (seek landowner permission).

properties.Title: 1.Hatchery Release
properties.subtitle: Lake Rotoehu
properties.Description: Hatchery Release is at Kennedys Bay (Ngamimiro Bay) off the Pongakawa Road near the boat ramp.

properties.Title: 1.Paradise Valley Road
properties.subtitle: Ngongotaha Stream
properties.Description: Access Points 1 - Above SH5 fishing access is mostly off Paradise Valley Road and via the Fish & Game access points clearly marked with signage. Some of the upper reaches run through private property and anglers should seek the permission of landowners before crossing properties.

properties.Title: 2a.Brookdale Drive
properties.subtitle: Ngongotaha Stream
properties.Description: Access Point 2a - Off Western Road, access can be gained via council reserve off Brookdale Drive. There is 1km of easy access from this point.

properties.Title: 2b.Elliot Park
properties.subtitle: Ngongotaha Stream
properties.Description: Access Point 2b - Below SH5 access can be gained via council reserve off Brookdale Drive, or from the Elliot Park reserve from Western Road where 4km of meandering stream flows through re-planted native bush, much of which has good access.

properties.Title: 3.Ngongotaha Village
properties.subtitle: Ngongotaha Stream
properties.Description: Access Point 3 - Easy access can be gained to Utuhina Stream through Ngongotaha village and by access downstream of the old rail bridge on the true right bank only.

properties.Title: 4.Taui Street
properties.subtitle: Ngongotaha Stream
properties.Description: Access Point 4 - Walking access to the stream mouth can be gained either from Taui Street or Beaumonts Road. Some private lakefront property exists so anglers are advised to walk along the lake edge.

properties.Title: 5.Waiteti Stream
properties.subtitle: Waiteti Stream / Lake Rotorua
properties.Description: Access Point 5 - There is good access via council reserve on the true right bank of the stream at this location.

properties.Title: 6.Utuhina Stream
properties.subtitle: Utuhina Stream
properties.Description: Access Point 6 - There is a large network of Rotorua District Council reserve on the stream and access is signposted.

properties.Title: 7.Awahou Stream mouth
properties.subtitle: Awahou Stream / Lake Rotorua
properties.Description: Access Point 7 - Access to the Awahou Stream mouth via Gloucester Road is through private property and anglers are asked to respect this. Parking area at the end of the road. Please obey the speed limits.

properties.Title: 8.Hamurana Stream mouth
properties.subtitle: Hamurana Stream / Lake Rotorua
properties.Description: Access Point 8 - The stream is open below the Hamurana Road bridge all season and fishing peaks during the warmest period when the lake water temperature encourages trout to find cooler flows.

properties.Title: 1.Trolling Run
properties.subtitle: Lake Rotorua
properties.Description: Trolling Run 1 - Off the Ngongotaha Stream exit into the lake. Troll at between 2.5m and 5m. Easy access from 2 nearby boat ramps.

properties.Title: 2.Trolling
properties.subtitle: Lake Rotorua
properties.Description: Trolling Run 2 - Off the Awahou Stream exit into the lake. Trolling at between 5m and 10m on a curved run.

properties.Title: 3.Trolling Run
properties.subtitle: Lake Rotorua
properties.Description: Trolling Run 3 - Off the Hamuarana Stream in a straight run along the shallows 2 to 2.5m mark.

properties.Title: 4.Trolling Run
properties.subtitle: Lake Rotorua
properties.Description: Trolling Run 4 - The Pins. Various depths from 7 to 10m.

properties.Title: 5.Trolling Run
properties.subtitle: Lake Rotorua
properties.Description: Trolling Run 5 - Short run off Ohau Channel right along the drop off.

properties.Title: 6.Trolling
properties.subtitle: Lake Rotorua
properties.Description: Trolling Run 6 - Airport trolling run. Fish the drop-off about 2.5m

properties.Title: 7.Trolling
properties.subtitle: Lake Rotorua
properties.Description: Trolling Run 7 - Start off Sulphur Point and troll towards Holdens Bay on a curve. The depth fluxuates from 10 to 15m.

properties.Title: 8.Trolling
properties.subtitle: Lake Rotorua
properties.Description: Trolling Run 8 - In a curve specifically off Kawaha Point one side to the other finishing in front of Waiowhiro Stream.

properties.Title: 9.Trolling
properties.subtitle: Lake Rotorua
properties.Description: Trolling Run 9 - Western side of Mokoia Island in close.

properties.Title: 10.Trolling
properties.subtitle: Lake Rotorua
properties.Description: Trolling Run 10 - Eastern side of Mokoia Island in close.

properties.Title: 5.Spin/jig/fly
properties.subtitle: Lake Rerewhakaaitu
properties.Description: Drift boat for spin & fly fishing. A good location from autumn into spring for fishing from a drifting boat.

properties.Title: 5.Trout Release
properties.subtitle: Lake Tarawera
properties.Description: Trout Release 5. Waitangi Stream mouth.

properties.Title: 6.Trout Release
properties.subtitle: Lake Tarawera
properties.Description: Trout Release 6. The Orchard Stream mouth

properties.Title: 2b.Elliot Park
properties.subtitle: Ngongotaha Stream
properties.Description: Access Point 2b - Access to Elliot Park, Western Road where 4km of meandering stream flows through re-planted native bush, much of which has good access.

properties.Title: 4.Fly Fishing - Te Matahi Lagoon
properties.subtitle: Lake Rotoma
properties.Description: Fly Fishing Location 4 - Te Oneroa Bay between the Boat Ramp and Matahi Bay. Park off Matahi Road near the Playground. Access in front of Te Matahi Lagoon.

properties.Title: 4.Fly fishing/spin
properties.subtitle: Lake Waikaremoana
properties.Description: Fly fishing location 4 - Paraeroa Bay south

properties.Title: 21.Lake Aratiatia
properties.subtitle: Waikato River and Hydro Lakes
properties.Description: Access point 21 - A Department of Conservation walking track follows the lake shore on the true right to Huka Falls and the lake and river can be fished in various places from this track. This lake has no public boat ramp, but small boats or kayaks can be launched near the start of the track above the dam.

properties.Title: 1.Paierau Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Waipoua River
properties.Description: Access point 1 is by the gate at the bridge.

properties.Title: 2.Railway Tracks
properties.subtitle: Waipoua River
properties.Description: Access point 2 is down a narrow gravel track.

properties.Title: 3.Railway Crescent
properties.subtitle: Waipoua River
properties.Description: Access point 3 is at the end of the crescent.

properties.Title: 4.Bentley Street
properties.subtitle: Waipoua River
properties.Description: Access point 4 is at the end of Bentley Street - park on gravel or grass area.

properties.Title: 5.Masterton Bridge
properties.subtitle: Waipoua River
properties.Description: Access point 5 is just off Villa Street - car parking off street.

properties.Title: 6.Masterton Bridge downstream
properties.subtitle: Waipoua River
properties.Description: Access point 6 is just off Memorial Drive - there is ample car parking.

properties.Title: 7.Colombo Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Waipoua River
properties.Description: Access point 7 is next to the bridge - car parking close by.

properties.Title: 8.River Road
properties.subtitle: Waipoua River
properties.Description: Access point 8 is at the end of River Road. Park at cul-de-sac and walk to confluence of Waipoua and Ruamahanga.

properties.Title: 1.Marine Parade
properties.subtitle: Hutt River-Lower Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 1 to the estuary and river mouth on the true right side.

properties.Title: 2.Port Road
properties.subtitle: Hutt River-Lower Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 2 to the estuary and river mouth on the true left side.

properties.Title: 3.Croft Grove
properties.subtitle: Hutt River-Lower Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 3 off the start of the Hutt River Trail, offers access to the lower reaches on the true left.

properties.Title: 4.Shandon Golf Course
properties.subtitle: Hutt River-Lower Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 4 to the lower reaches on the true right adjacent to the golf course.

properties.Title: 5.Bracken Street
properties.subtitle: Hutt River-Lower Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 5 to lower reaches through Sladden Park. Toilet and playground facilities at this access point.

properties.Title: 6.Wakefield Street
properties.subtitle: Hutt River-Lower Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 6 is to the true right side of the river via Ava Park.

properties.Title: 7.Market Grove
properties.subtitle: Hutt River-Lower Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 7 is below Ewen Bridge to the true left side.

properties.Title: 8.Marsden Street
properties.subtitle: Hutt River-Lower Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 8 - Entry point to the true right side of the Hutt River Trail provides access upstream and downstream of Ewen Bridge.

properties.Title: 9.Riverbank Market
properties.subtitle: Hutt River Lower-Mid Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 9 provides excellent access upstream and downstream of Melling Bridge on true left.

properties.Title: 10.Block Road Carpark
properties.subtitle: Hutt River Lower-Mid Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 10 to the true right upstream of Melling Bridge.

properties.Title: 11.Harcourt Werry Drive (Boulcott)
properties.subtitle: Hutt River Lower-Mid Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 11 - Numerous access and parking options on the true left parallel to this road.

properties.Title: 12.Belmont School
properties.subtitle: Hutt River Lower-Mid Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 12 is a road beside the school to public parking beside the river on the true right.

properties.Title: 13.Owen Street
properties.subtitle: Hutt River-Lower Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 13 is the last reasonable access to the river on the true right for quite a way upstream.

properties.Title: 14.Harcourt Werry Drive (Avalon)
properties.subtitle: Hutt River Lower-Mid Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 14 numerous access and parking options on the true left parallel to this road.

properties.Title: 15.Taita Drive
properties.subtitle: Hutt River Lower-Mid Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 15 has numerous access and parking options on the true left parallel to this road.

properties.Title: 16. Eastern Hutt Road
properties.subtitle: Hutt River Middle-Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 16 off the road link up with the Hutt River Trail on the true left. Note: No access on true right through golf course.

properties.Title: 17.Silverstream Bridge
properties.subtitle: Hutt River Middle-Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 17 with good car park and facilities offering access up and downstream of the bridge.

properties.Title: 18.Hutt Trail
properties.subtitle: Hutt River Middle-Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 18 from Silverstream Bridge to Moonshine Bridges walk/bike access only along the trail which runs beside the river on the true left.

properties.Title: 19.Western Hutt Road
properties.subtitle: Hutt River Middle-Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 19 is a gravel road runs alongside the river which can be driven most of its length and offers good access to the true right. Please take care when turning off SH2.

properties.Title: 20.Moonshine Bridge
properties.subtitle: Hutt River Middle-Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 20 is a public reserve upstream and downstream. Can drive almost to the Whakatikei confluence on gravel road beside river. Toilet facilities available.

properties.Title: 21.Poets Park
properties.subtitle: Hutt River Middle-Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 21 provides walking and bike access upstream on the true left. Cross the Hutt River to fish the Whakatikei (the Hutt becomes more braided here and can be safely waded in normal low flow).

properties.Title: 22.Totara Park Bridge
properties.subtitle: Hutt River Middle-Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 22 access to both sides of the river at bridge.

properties.Title: 23.Awakairangi Park
properties.subtitle: Hutt River-Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 23 is walking access through the reserve to the true right from Totara Park Bridge.

properties.Title: 24.River Road (SH2)
properties.subtitle: Hutt River-Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 24 is a gravel road runs alongside the river from Totara Park Bridge on the true left. Walking access only at the river bend upstream, near Maoribank.

properties.Title: 25.Norbert Street
properties.subtitle: Hutt River-Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 25 is a footbridge at end of the street links to Hutt River Trail. River access is limited to a select few points on the true left upstream of here.

properties.Title: 26.Black Beech Street
properties.subtitle: Hutt River-Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 26 is a public walkway to Hutt River Trail at the end of the street. A few informal tracks lead down to the river. Access from here up is in the river during normal low flow.

properties.Title: 27.Akatarawa Confluence
properties.subtitle: Hutt River-Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 27 - Offers good parking with toilet facilities offering access up the Akatarawa and true left of Hutt. The Hutt River Trail upstream offers limited fishing access but the river is wadeable in normal low flows.

properties.Title: 28.Gemstone Drive
properties.subtitle: Hutt River-Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 28 is a public walkway to the Hutt River Trail from this street. Offers a few access points to river.

properties.Title: 29.Mangaroa Confluence
properties.subtitle: Hutt River-Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 29 offers access at confluence on true left of Hutt River. Care is needed when parking on side of SH2. This is the last access point until the regional park at Twin Lakes.

properties.Title: 30.Twin Lakes Road
properties.subtitle: Hutt River - Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 30 just follow the signage on Twin Lakes Road to river access. Fishable from here for a few pools upstream but soon turns to steep-sided gorge.

properties.Title: 31.Flume Bridge Walkway
properties.subtitle: Hutt River Middle-Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 31 offers walking access from carpark along road to Strainer House. Several tracks lead down to river from the walkway.

properties.Title: 32.Swingbridge Carpark
properties.subtitle: Hutt River-Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 32 fishing upstream as far as the weir. Note - access to the river upstream is prohibited as this is the city drinking water intake.

properties.Title: 11a.Kumeroa Village
properties.subtitle: Upper Manawatu River
properties.Description: Access point 11a in Kumeroa Village, turn left into Domain Road. At the Little Road intersection, go straight ahead through the gate.

properties.Title: 11.Kumeroa Domain
properties.subtitle: Upper Manawatu River
properties.Description: Access point 11b is off Oringi Road (signposted). Please park in the parking area near the gate.

properties.Title: 11c.Potter Road
properties.subtitle: Upper Manawatu River
properties.Description: Access point 11c - Continuing up Little Road, turn left into Potter Road, go to end of the seal and continue along a private gravel road and ask for permission.

properties.Title: 12.The Honey House
properties.subtitle: Upper Manawatu River
properties.Description: Access point 12 - cross the river at the Hopelands Bridge, turn left up Kumeroa Road, and turn left off Kumeroa Road. Please close the gates.

properties.Title: 13.Jackson’s Road Metal pit
properties.subtitle: Upper Manawatu River
properties.Description: Access point 13 is off Jacksons Road. From Hopelands Road, travel about 1.7km up Jacksons Road. Park and walk through the gates to the river.

properties.Title: 14.Hopelands Bridge
properties.subtitle: Upper Manawatu River
properties.Description: Point 14 is not an access to the river point, rather a landmark to other access points.

properties.Title: 15.Oak Tree
properties.subtitle: Upper Manawatu River
properties.Description: Access point 15 is from Hopelands Road, travel down Bluff Road and park off the road near the Oak tree (signposted).

properties.Title: 16.Bluff Road Bluff
properties.subtitle: Upper Manawatu River
properties.Description: Access point 16 - From SH2, travel up Bluff Road about 2.6km. Where the road comes close to the river there is a dip in the road and a sharp turn to the left. Do not take the sharp turn left, instead, go straight ahead down a steep gravel track and through to the river.

properties.Title: 17.Haukopua Scenic Reserve
properties.subtitle: Upper Manawatu River
properties.Description: Access point 17 is from either Kohinui Road or Thompson Road turn into Oete Road passing the Haukopua Scenic Reserve sign, and on to the river bed.

properties.Title: 18.Ngawapurua Bridge, SH2
properties.subtitle: Upper Manawatu River
properties.Description: Access point 18 - Park at the end of Bluff Road where it enters SH2. Make your way along to Ngawapurua Bridge on SH2 for access.

properties.Title: 19.Troup Road
properties.subtitle: Upper Manawatu River
properties.Description: Access point 19 to the river is off Troup Road and requires the permission of the landowner.

properties.Title: 20.Ormond Road
properties.subtitle: Upper Manawatu River
properties.Description: Access point 20 - Drive down the Ormond Road extension from its intersection with Troup Road for 1.3km. Park here and then follow the track.

properties.Title: 22.Woodville Ferry Reserve, SH3
properties.subtitle: Upper Manawatu River
properties.Description: Access point 22 - Turn off SH3 into the Woodville Ferry Reserve, which is between the two bridges over the river at the eastern end of the Manawatu Gorge. Please shut the gate after yourselves.

properties.Title: 1.Pohangina Valley East Bridge
properties.subtitle: Pohangina River
properties.Description: Access point 1 is off Pohangina Valley East Road - drive for another 12km or until you reach a bridge.

properties.Title: 2.Churchill Drive
properties.subtitle: Pohangina River
properties.Description: Access point 2 - Go straight/veer left along Churchill Drive for about 1km to reach access under a bridge.

properties.Title: 3.Gravel Pit
properties.subtitle: Pohangina River
properties.Description: Access point 3 is off Pohangina Valley East Road. Past the Raumai picnic area just before bridge.

properties.Title: 4.Raumai Picnic Area
properties.subtitle: Pohangina River
properties.Description: Access point 4 is off Pohangina Valley East Road. In the picnic area just before bridge.

properties.Title: 5.Saddle Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Pohangina River
properties.Description: Access point 5 is at the end of the gravel track.

properties.Title: 6.State Highway 3 Bridge
properties.subtitle: Pohangina River
properties.Description: Access point 6 from the Ashhurst end of the bridge - Use the gravel tracks.

properties.Title: 1.Springvale Bridge
properties.subtitle: Rangitikei River
properties.Description: Access point 1 is beside Springvale Bridge.

properties.Title: 2.Mangaohane
properties.subtitle: Rangitikei River
properties.Description: Access point 2 is off Mangaohane Road.

properties.Title: 3.Mangaweka Picnic Area
properties.subtitle: Rangatikei River
properties.Description: Access point 3 is off the Mangaweka Picnic Area.

properties.Title: 4.Mangarere Road
properties.subtitle: Rangitikei River
properties.Description: Access point 4 is off Mangarere Road.

properties.Title: 5.Otara Road
properties.subtitle: Rangitikei River
properties.Description: Access point 5 is off Otara Road.

properties.Title: 6.Vinegar Hill Road
properties.subtitle: Rangitikei River
properties.Description: Access point 6 is off Vinegar Hill Road.

properties.Title: 7.Cheltenham Hunterville Road
properties.subtitle: Rangitikei River
properties.Description: Access point 7 is off Cheltenham Hunterville Road.

properties.Title: 8.Rangitikei Valley Road
properties.subtitle: Rangitikei River
properties.Description: Access point 8 is off Rangitikei Valley Road.

properties.Title: 9.Putorino Road
properties.subtitle: Rangitikei River
properties.Description: Access point 9 is off Putorino Road.

properties.Title: 10.Rangitikei Road-end of road
properties.subtitle: Rangitikei River
properties.Description: Access point 10 is at the end of Rangitikei Road.

properties.Title: 11.Te Houhou Road
properties.subtitle: Rangitikei River
properties.Description: Access point 11 is off Te Houhou Road.

properties.Title: 12.Reu Reu Road
properties.subtitle: Rangitikei River
properties.Description: Access point 12 is off Reu Reu Road

properties.Title: 13.Makino Road
properties.subtitle: Rangitikei River
properties.Description: Access point 13 is off Makino Road.

properties.Title: 14.Onepuhi Road
properties.subtitle: Rangitikei River
properties.Description: Access point 14 is off Onepuhi Road.

properties.Title: 15.Kakariki Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Rangitikei River
properties.Description: Access point 15 is off Kakariki Road Bridge.

properties.Title: 16.Bulls Bridge - True Left Access
properties.subtitle: Rangitikei River
properties.Description: Access point 16 is off Bulls Bridge to the true left side access.

properties.Title: 17.Treatment Plant
properties.subtitle: Rangitikei River
properties.Description: Access point 17 is off the Treatment Plant.

properties.Title: 18.Bulls Bridge - True Right Access
properties.subtitle: Rangitikei River
properties.Description: Access point 18 is by the Bulls Bridge to the true right side access.

properties.Title: 19.Double Gates - McDonell Road
properties.subtitle: Rangatikei River
properties.Description: Access point 19 is off Double Gates - McDonell Road.

properties.Title: 20.Campion Road
properties.subtitle: Rangitikei River
properties.Description: Access point 20 is off Campion Road.

properties.Title: 21.Rosina Road
properties.subtitle: Rangitikei River
properties.Description: Access point 21 is off Rosina Road.

properties.Title: 22.Tangimoana - Scotts Ferry Landing
properties.subtitle: Rangitikei River
properties.Description: Access point 22 is off Tangimoana - Scotts Ferry Landing.

properties.Title: 23.Parewanui Road
properties.subtitle: Rangitikei River
properties.Description: Access point 23 is off Parewanui Road.

properties.Title: 1.Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Wairarapa Moana
properties.Description: Boat Ramp access at Lake Domain Reserve.

properties.Title: 2.Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Wairarapa Moana
properties.Description: 2.Boat Ramp at Te Hopai Road.

properties.Title: 3.Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Wairarapa Moana
properties.Description: 3.Boat Ramp Access.

properties.Title: 4.Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Wairarapa Moana
properties.Description: 4.Boat launching access off the beach.

properties.Title: 1.Lake Rotomanu Carpark
properties.subtitle: Lake Rotomanu
properties.Description: Access point 1 is along Clemow Road and park at the carpark at the bottom of Lake Rotomanu. You can walk to the river 50-100m from the carpark to fish upstream of Te Rewa Rewa bridge.

properties.Title: 2.Constance Street
properties.subtitle: Waiwhakaiho River
properties.Description: Access point 2 - Turn left on Constance Street before the set of lights when heading north on SH3 out of New Plymouth. Before going around the corner, pull up to the gravel parking area on your left in front of a bar gate. Walk over the stop-bank to the river.

properties.Title: 3.Rimu Street
properties.subtitle: Waiwhakaiho River
properties.Description: Access point 3 is on Rimu Street. Head right at the fork in the road and walk along the track at the end of the road, which gives access to a number of good pools. The white, yellow and black landmark pole at the end of the Rimu Street walking track marks the upstream limit for all year fishing.

properties.Title: 4. Merrilands Domain
properties.subtitle: Waiwhakaiho River
properties.Description: Access point 4 - Drive in via the sealed access road next to the sports field. Plenty of parking and toilet facilities are available, but be mindful that the road access gate is locked in the evenings.

properties.Title: 5.William Street
properties.subtitle: Waiwhakaiho River
properties.Description: Access point 5 - At the end of William Street, park by the gate away from driveways and walk down the track, which gives access to a series of pools and runs around the river bend.

properties.Title: 6.Tupare Gardens
properties.subtitle: Waiwhakaiho River
properties.Description: Access point 6 - Turn into the Tupare Gardens parking lot, off Mangorei Road. Walk downhill through the gardens to reach the river. Free entry into the gardens.

properties.Title: 7.Burgess Park
properties.subtitle: Waiwhakaiho River
properties.Description: Access point 7 - When heading south on SH3 out of New Plymouth, pull off SH3 into the carpark on the left. There is access to the river by following the Meeting of the Waters scenic reserve walking track.

properties.Title: 8. Waiwhakaiho Road West
properties.subtitle: Waiwhakaiho River
properties.Description: Access point 8 - Waiwhakaiho Road off SH3 gives access to the “power-house pool”, which is where the discharge from Mangorei power station enters the river. Park at the Meeting of the Waters Scenic Reserve carpark.

properties.Title: 9. Hydro Road/TOPEC
properties.subtitle: Waiwhakaiho River
properties.Description: Access point 9 - Turn left off SH3 heading south out of New Plymouth onto Hydro Road. Then turn right at the junction that takes you to TOPEC. Park at the end of the road, walk along the track over the bridge to access the other side of the river.

properties.Title: 10.Plantation Road
properties.subtitle: Waiwhakaiho River
properties.Description: Access point 10 - Turn left off SH3 past Lake Mangamahoe, when heading south from New Plymouth, then turn right into Mangapouri Cemetery. Park outside away from the gates, or inside next to the toilets, with the hours noted on the District council website. A gravel track next to the toilets leads to the river with pedestrian access 24/7.

properties.Title: 11.SH3
properties.subtitle: Waiwhakaiho River
properties.Description: Access point 11 - On SH3, park on the New Plymouth side of the bridge heading east towards Egmont Village, where there is a rough track down the bank to the river. Be mindful of traffic.

properties.Title: 1.Lake Mangamahoe
properties.subtitle: Excluding Waiwhakaiho inlet and Mangamahoe stream.
properties.Description: Access point 1 - To the main part of the lake, turn off SH3 opposite the Kent Road intersection and follow the gravel road that runs along the western shore. Fish from one of the two platforms on the lake, or from the shoreline.

properties.Title: 2. Waiwhakaiho inlet
properties.subtitle: Upstream of the landmark pole located just upstream of the confluence with Lake Mangamahoe.
properties.Description: Access point 2 to Waiwhakaiho inlet and along the eastern shore; take the walking track at the swing bridge at the southern end of the lake (hilly end) or at the Plantation road mountain bike park entrance, east of Lake Mangamahoe and walk down the gravel forestry road, taking the second track on the left.

properties.Title: 3. Mangamahoe Stream
properties.subtitle: Upstream of the walkway swing-bridge at the head of Lake Mangamahoe
properties.Description: Access point 3 to the mouth of the Mangamahoe stream, below the swing-bridge, on the walking track.

properties.Title: 1. Wiremu Road Bridge.
properties.subtitle: Waiaua River
properties.Description: Access point 1 - Turn off SH45 onto Ihaia Road in Opunake. Turn right onto Wiremu Road, cross the bridge and park on the left hand side of the road. Jump the barrier to get access to the riverbed.

properties.Title: 2.SH45 Opunake
properties.subtitle: Waiaua River
properties.Description: Access point 2 - Head south out of Opunake on SH45, pull onto the side of the road and park just before the bridge out of town. Use the stairs down to the weir and the walking track to access the river to fish upstream or downstream.

properties.Title: 3.Opunake Lake
properties.subtitle: Opunake Lake
properties.Description: Access point 3 - In Opunake, turn off SH45 onto Layard Street. Park next to the Opunake Lake public toilets. You can walk to fishing spots on the bottom end of the lake along Park Place. Also, park at the end of Domett Street and walk to the top end lake.

properties.Title: 1.Saunders Road
properties.subtitle: Blue Rata reserve - Hangatahua (Stony) River
properties.Description: Access point 1 - along Saunders Road towards Blue Rata Reserve. Travel to the end of the road, when you get to a turn around area park there. Walk to the river through the trees. Possible other points of access through the trees along Blue Rata Reserve.

properties.Title: 2.Mangatete Road bridge
properties.subtitle: Hangatahua (Stony) River
properties.Description: Access point 2 - Travel towards the mountain on Saunders Road from Okato. Turn right onto Mangatete Road and park on the New Plymouth side of the bridge. Access to river is through the gate on your left when you face the bridge.

properties.Title: 3.SH45 bridge
properties.subtitle: Hangatahua (Stony) River
properties.Description: Access point 3 - Head south on SH45 through Okato. The next bridge you come to turn left onto the edge of the road as soon as you cross. Do not park in front of the gate. The river is over the stile on the fence next to the gate. Follow your nose to the river.

properties.Title: 1.Opunake Road/Cardiff Centennial Walkway
properties.subtitle: Waingongoro River
properties.Description: Access point 1 - From Stratford, turn off SH3 onto Celia Street which becomes Opunake Road. Drive roughly 5km to the Waingongoro Bridge. Park on the western side of the bridge next to the Cardiff walkway sign. Walk down track down to the river. Can only fish upstream of the bridge as will need landowner permission for downstream.

properties.Title: 2.Taumata Park
properties.subtitle: Waingongoro River
properties.Description: In the centre of Eltham, turn off SH3 onto Bridge Street and head west over the railway line. Turn right onto Preston Street and park in the designated area outside the Park entrance. Go through the gate, turn left and head down past the cricket nets to a dirt track leading to the river. Either wade upstream or follow a rough track further upstream about 1km.

properties.Title: 3.Ohawe Reserve
properties.subtitle: Waingongoro River
properties.Description: Access point 3 - Turn off Surf Highway 45 onto Ohawe Road, 4km west of Hawera. Keep heading left until you come to Rangatapu Street, turn down it. Park near the boat club and walk into the river through the reserve.

properties.Title: 1.Thoumine Park
properties.subtitle: Kaupokonui Stream
properties.Description: Access point 1 - Turn off SH3 in Eltham onto Eltham Road, until you reach Kaponga. Before crossing the bridge turn left onto Riverside Street and immediately turn right into a carpark at Thoumine Park. The river will be in front of you.

properties.Title: 2. Skeet Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Mangawhero Stream
properties.Description: Turn off SH3 onto at Te Roti, between Eltham and Normanby. Follow Skeet Road for 15mins until reach Upper Glenn Road. Continue past Upper Glenn Road until you come to the next bridge. Park on the road verge. Access into the stream is on the western side of the bridge and you can make your way down the bank on the upstream side next to the water pipe. Caution as the bank is a little bit steep. Fish downstream using the DOC reserve.

properties.Title: 3.SH45 bridge
properties.subtitle: Kaupokonui Stream
properties.Description: Access point 3 - On SH45 just a few minutes west of Manaia there is a old disused dairy factory just before crossing a bridge over the Kaupokonui Stream. Park outside the dairy factory. Find a suitable place next to the bridge to access the river. Be careful as the banks may be steep.

properties.Title: 1.King Edward Park/Scout Den pool
properties.subtitle: Patea River
properties.Description: Acess point 1 In the heart of Stratford. Off SH3 at the 2nd round-about heading south take the 3rd exit onto Fenton Street. Park in the carparks in front of the gates leading into the park. Walk through the gates to the front of the Scout Den building to find the Scout Den pool. Can fish upstream via the river or the Carrington walkway on the true left side.

properties.Title: 2.Carrington Walkway
properties.subtitle: Patea River
properties.Description: Access point 2 - To enter the walkway in the middle, at the 2nd round-about heading south on SH3 take the first exit onto Fenton Street. Turn right onto Swansea Road at the end of the street. Before you cross over the bridge park on the side of the road next to the open grass area that will be on your right. Access to the river through the grass area.

properties.Title: 3.Lake Rotorangi
properties.subtitle: Lake Rotorangi (Upper Reaches)
properties.Description: Access point 3 - Fishable mostly by boat. Turn onto Rawhitiroa Road in Eltham and follow it 24km to Mangamingi then turn onto Glen Nui Road. The boat ramp is not too far from the turnoff on your right hand side.

properties.Title: 4.Lake Rotorangi
properties.subtitle: Lake Rotorangi (middle reaches)
properties.Description: Access poiunt 4 to boat ramp. From Hawera follow Tawhiti/Ararata Road. Take a right onto Tangahoe Valley Road and follow to the Pukekino landing water ski area and boat ramp.

properties.Title: 5.Lake Rotorangi
properties.subtitle: Lake Rotorangi (Lower Reaches)
properties.Description: Access point 5 to boat ramp. Turn onto Ball Road from SH3 south of Hawera. Follow that onto Maben Road until you reach the boat ramp above the Patea dam.

properties.Title: 6.Patea River (below dam)
properties.subtitle: Below Dam
properties.Description: Access point 6 to 14km stretch of river below the dam. Turn onto Ball Road from SH3 south of Hawera. Follow that over McColl's Bridge onto Maben Road. From the bridge to the dam is fishable water.

properties.Title: 1.Everett Park
properties.subtitle: Manganui River
properties.Description: Access point 1 is a 25min drive from New Plymouth. Head south on SH3 into Inglewood then over the railway line onto Rata Street which turns into Tarata Road. Turn left onto Bristol Road then left into Everett Road. The first gate into Everett Park is on your right in about 800m. Follow the track to a turn-around area by the river. The second gate is 2-300m north of the first gate. Follow track to a carpark and walk to the river.

properties.Title: 2.Lake Ratapiko
properties.subtitle: Lake is closed in May for duck shooting.
properties.Description: South on SH3 below Inglewood, turn left onto Tariki Road south. Continue straight onto Ratipiko Road at the school. At the lake turn left and park at the boat ramp (eastern arm). There is also walking access to the western arm (water ski area).

properties.Title: 2.Brown Road
properties.subtitle: Waiongana River
properties.Description: Access Point 2 - Heading north from SH3, turn left onto Tate Road. Turn left onto Brown Road that the T intersection. Continue straight at the gravel road and park before the bridge. Access the river from the track at the right of the bridge.

properties.Title: Taranaki Kart Club.
properties.subtitle: Lake Ngangana
properties.Description: At SH3 bypassing Waitara, turn right onto Princess street. Take Joll Street on your right and follow it to the end of the road to the Kart track. Park in the little gravel area and walk down to the lake.

properties.Title: Lake Rotomanu Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Boat ramp carpark (access to whole lake)
properties.Description: Proceed east along Devon Street East, through the lights at Fitzroy and into Clemow Road, which leads to the lake.

properties.Title: 1.Lake Wiritoa Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Wiritoa
properties.Description: Access point 1 just south of Whanganui, turn onto Kaitoke Road. When you see the lake, pull into the carpark in front of the boat ramp sign (on a right hand corner). Walk down to the lake.

properties.Title: 2.End of Nicholson Drive
properties.subtitle: Lake Wiritoa
properties.Description: Access point 2 - Turn onto Kaitoke Road. Follow until you come to the Nicholson Drive turnoff. Park on the grass to the left beside the lake.

properties.Title: 3.Araheke Mountain Bike Park
properties.subtitle: Lake Wiritoa
properties.Description: Access point 3 - Turn onto Kaitoke Road. Follow until you come to a set of wooden rails on your left. Park in the car park in front of them. Walk to the lake. Picnic table at location.

properties.Title: 1.Stent Road
properties.subtitle: Te Ikapārua (Warea) River
properties.Description: Access point 1 - Heading south on SH45, pass through Warea and turn right onto Stent Road. Follow the road to the end where there is plenty of parking. You can either follow the track along the coastline to the mouth of the river, or follow the esplanade strip heading north from the carpark through the paddock.

properties.Title: 2.SH45/Warea Tennis Club
properties.subtitle: Te Ikapārua (Warea) River
properties.Description: Access point 2 - In Warea heading south, turn left over the cattle stop into the Warea Tennis Club driveway. Park in the gravel carpark next to the bowling club and walk north to the river.

properties.Title: 2.Everett Park Cave Walk Track
properties.subtitle: Manganui River
properties.Description: Access point 2 - Heading north on Everett road from Inglewood, continue past the first two entrances into Everett park. Just before you come to Vertical Horizon Camp there is a DOC entrance sign on the right hand side of the road saying Cave Walk. There is a parking area in front of the sign. Follow the walking track down to the river, there are also other tracks people have made to the waters edge.

properties.Title: 1.Devon Road (SH3) Bridge
properties.subtitle: Waiongana River
properties.Description: Access point 1 - Head north out of New Plymouth on SH3. Continue past the SH3a turnoff until you come to the next bridge and park in a safe place on the northern / Waitara side of the bridge. Can walk down into the river from the road bridge on the Waitara side. Can fish upstream and downstream.

properties.Title: 1.Devon Road (SH3) Bridge
properties.subtitle: Mangaoraka Stream
properties.Description: Access point 1 - Head north along SH3 out of New Plymouth, past the airport turn off, then park safely at the next bridge. Access to the stream down the banks beside the bridge.

properties.Title: 2.Corbett Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Mangaoraka Stream
properties.Description: Access point 2 - Heading north out of New Plymouth, turn right off SH3 onto Corbett Road. Follow the road until you reach the first bridge and park safely on the side of the road. Access the stream down the bank next to the bridge. There are esplanade strips both upstream and downstream of the bridge.

properties.Title: 3.Manutahi Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Mangaoraka Stream
properties.Description: Access point 3 - Heading north out of New Plymouth, take the off-ramp at Bell Block and then turn right onto Henwood Road and follow straight onto Manutahi Road. At the first bridge you come to on Manutahi Road park safely. Access to the stream is down the bank next to the bridge. Esplanade strip on both sides upstream of bridge.

properties.Title: 1.Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Wiritoa
properties.Description: Access is just south of Whanganui, turn onto Kaitoke Road. When you see the lake pull into the carpark in front of the boat ramp sign (on a right hand corner). Walk down to the lake.

properties.Title: 1.Whanganui River Estuary (True left bank)
properties.subtitle: Whanganui River
properties.Description: Access point 1 - Cross the SH3 bridge south of Whanganui. Take 3rd exit at round-about and then turn right onto Languard Road. Park somewhere next to the river. You can also take the 1st at the round-about to get to spots along SH4.

properties.Title: 2.Whanganui River estuary (True right bank)
properties.subtitle: Whanganui River
properties.Description: Access point 2 - There are a number of different streets to access the river on the eastern bank. At the round-about before the SH3 bridge take the 3rd exit. Follow heads road and turn off onto Taupo Quay, Beach Road, Gilberd Street, Wharf Street, Morgan Street or Tregenna Street to access fishing spots.

properties.Title: 3.Kaiwhaiki Road
properties.subtitle: Whanganui River
properties.Description: Access point 3 - Head north on SH4. Turn left onto Kaiwhaiki Road, just past Upokongaro School. The best access is at the end of the road by the mountain bike park.

properties.Title: 4.Whanganui River Road
properties.subtitle: Whanganui River
properties.Description: Access point 4 - Head north on SH4 then turn left onto Whanganui River Road. The road is narrow so be aware of other vehicles. The end of the road comes out at Pipiriki and you can make your way to Raetihi. There are a number of places to park up and fish along the road.

properties.Title: Ruatiti Domain
properties.subtitle: Manganui o Te Ao River
properties.Description: Head north on SH4 out of Raetihi then turn left onto Ruatiti Road. Follow Ruatiti Road to a bridge crossing the river. About 250-300m past the bridge turn left onto a track that leads down to the domain.

properties.Title: 1.Ruatiti Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Orautoha Stream
properties.Description: Access point 1 - Head north of Raetihi on SH4 then turn left onto Ruatiti Road. Follow the road until you come to the Makakahi Road intersection. Continue past this for 800m until you reach a bridge. Park safely away from any gates and access the stream beside the bridge.

properties.Title: 2.Papa Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Orautoha Stream
properties.Description: Access point 2 - Head north of Raetihi on SH4 then turn left onto Ruatiti Road. Continue until you come to Papa Road and then turn right onto it. The bridge is a couple hundred metres up the road but park before the bridge and walk to it.

properties.Title: 1.Mangawhero Forest walk
properties.subtitle: Mangawhero River
properties.Description: Access poit 1 - In Ohakune, turn onto Goldfinch Street from SH3. Continue along, the road turns into Mangawhero Terrace and then Ohakune Mountain Road. Park in the carpark opposite the public toilets at the walk entrance. Follow the walking track down to the river.

properties.Title: 2.Ohakune Township
properties.subtitle: Mangawhero River
properties.Description: 'A number of easily accessable sites through Ohakune township. Park and walk to the river from Ohakune Mountain Road, Mangawhero Terrace, Ohakune Disc Golf, SH49, Burns Street and Mangawhero River Road bridge.

properties.Title: 3.Ohakune-Raetihi Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Mangawhero River
properties.Description: Access point 3 - Head towards Raetihi from Ohakune on the Raetihi-Ohakune Road. Just past Golf Course Road you will come to a bridge, park safely to the side of the road. Access to the river is over a set of wooden rails on the left on the Raetihi side.

properties.Title: 1.Oio Road
properties.subtitle: Retaruke River
properties.Description: From SH4 heading north, turn onto Oio Road just south of Owhango. Follow the road until you come to the Oio-Upoko intersection. Park next to the Oio Road bridge and access the river from the easiest point.

properties.Title: 1.Sattlers Dam
properties.subtitle: Sattlers Dam
properties.Description: To access Sattlers Dam head west from Raetihi along the Pipiriki- Raetihi Road before turning right into Mangaeturoa North Road. The dam will be on your right. Park on the wide road margin and walk to the dam.

properties.Title: 4. Kaupokonui Beach
properties.subtitle: Kaupokonui Stream
properties.Description: Turn off SH45 onto Lower Glenn Road. Then turn right onto Kaupokonui Heads Road and follow it through the campsite to the river. Park on the northern side of the bridge. On the side of the baches closest to the river there is a style to cross that gives you access up the river through the Kaupokonui reserve.

properties.Title: Upper Rangitikei River
properties.subtitle: (Designated Water)
properties.Description: The upper or headwaters of the Rangitikei River and its tributaries (north of the Ohinewaione Stream confluence, 9 km upstream of the Springvale Bridge) has been designated as a back country fishery.NOTE 1: The headwaters of the Rangitikei River are both nationally and internationally significant as a rainbow trout fishery.NOTE2: Anglers wishing to fish these Designated Waters must first hold a valid Designated Waters Licence in addition to their whole-season Fishing Licence.

properties.Title: 1.Poronui Station
properties.subtitle: Mohaka River
properties.Description: Access point 1 - A poled public walking route to the Mohaka River starts at the end of Taharua Road which is accessed off SH5 near Rangitaiki. The land adjacent to the track is privately owned and should not be crossed. It is a 9km walk to the river. The alternative is to fly into one of the private airstrips or the Department of Conservation (DOC) helicopter pad at Oamaru hut. The Oamaru and Kaipo Rivers meet at this point to form the Mohaka River. The public access continues downstream of the confluence for approximately one kilometre on the true left bank.

properties.Title: 2.Blue Gums or Hot Springs
properties.subtitle: Mohaka River
properties.Description: Access Point 2 is via Puketitiri, Pakaututu and Makahu Roads to the Blue Gums/Hotsprings Road end. The Te Puia hut track provides good walking access. Camping is permitted.

properties.Title: 3.Makahu River
properties.subtitle: Makahu River
properties.Description: Access Point 3 to the Makahu River is over private land. Please contact Oliver Nicholas (Ph 06-839-8629) for permission. No dogs or firearms.

properties.Title: 4.Pakaututu Bridge
properties.subtitle: Mohaka River
properties.Description: Access Point 4 gives good access to the Mohaka River. A strip of public land on the true left bank leads downstream to the Ripia River confluence and up the true right bank of that river for approx 10km.

properties.Title: 5.McVicars Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Mohaka River
properties.Description: Access Point 5 - Turn onto McVicars Road from SH5 on the Taupo side of the river. About 3km along you reach the McVicars Road Bridge. Access both upstream and downstream from this point.

properties.Title: 7.Glenfalls Recreation Reserve
properties.subtitle: Mohaka River
properties.Description: Access Point 7 is off Waitara Road, with good access with camping available on this DoC reserve about 6kms from SH5.

properties.Title: 8.Jock Sutton Road
properties.subtitle: Mohaka River
properties.Description: Access Point 8 is off Waitara Road through the Panpac Forestry Road to the Waipunga River junction. Camping is allowed on the riverbank. Please drive with lights on for safety reasons. No open fires permitted.Please Note: 8.Jock Sutton Road - can be closed at times for safety due to forestry operations.

properties.Title: 9.Glenfalls Forest (off Auroa Road)
properties.subtitle: Mohaka River
properties.Description: Access Point 9 is off Aurora Road through the Panpac Forestry road to the Waipunga River junction - Taupora Road. Camping is allowed on the riverbank [Everetts Campsite]. Please drive with lights on for safety reasons. No open fires permitted.

properties.Title: 10.Te Hoe Junction
properties.subtitle: Mohaka River
properties.Description: Access Point 10 is at Te Hoe Junction, accessible from both SH5 via Waitara Road and SH2 via Pohokura Road (Tutira Store turnoff). The true right bank of the Mohaka River is accessible from this point.

properties.Title: 11.Willowflat Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Mohaka River
properties.Description: Access Point 11 - Turn off SH2 just south of Kotemaori. Access to the river is possible from the road bridge. Park safely off the side of the road either end.

properties.Title: 12.Patuwahlne Road
properties.subtitle: Mohaka River
