properties.Description: Access Point 12- turn off SH2 at Raupunga on to Putere Road, then Patawahine Road is approximately 10km on the left. This forestry road leads steeply down to the river and in wet conditions is only accessible by four wheel drive vehicle.

properties.Title: 13.SH2 Bridge
properties.subtitle: Mohaka River
properties.Description: Access Point 13 is at the SH2 Bridge. A parking and picnic area on the true right bank provides access to a short stretch of the Mohaka River.

properties.Title: 14.SH2 Access
properties.subtitle: Mohaka River
properties.Description: Access Point 14 is approximately 1km north of the SH2 bridge. An unnamed gravel road on the right leads down to the Mohaka River. Park anywhere close to the edge of the water and fish about 1km of river.

properties.Title: 15.Mohaka Township Road
properties.subtitle: Mohaka River
properties.Description: Access Point 15 along Mohaka Township Road then into Mohaka Coast Road, provides access to the river mouth and the road bridge, 1km upstream from the mouth. Some good sea-run fish use this reach, particularly late in the whitebait season (November).

properties.Title: 16.Tatarakina Bridge
properties.subtitle: Waipunga River
properties.Description: Access Point 16 is off the road to Tatarakina Station. The Waipunga River turns off SH5 about 5km south of the Tarawera Tavern. Because of the steep nature of the river channel and thick bank vegetation, only about 1km of river is fishable from this point.

properties.Title: 17.Tarawera Hot springs
properties.subtitle: Okoeke Stream
properties.Description: Access Point 17 is via the access track to the hot springs and adjacent river heads north from the Tarawera Tavern carpark. Please leave gates as you find them. Approximately 2km of river is reasonably accessible from this point.

properties.Title: 18.State Highway 5
properties.subtitle: Okoeke Stream
properties.Description: Access Point 18 is where SH5 follows the river which can be accessed from a number of places. Note that these points are adjacent to SH5 and considerable care should be exercised when parking in this area.

properties.Title: 19.State Highway 5
properties.subtitle: Okoeke Stream
properties.Description: Access Point 19 is where SH5 follows the river which can be accessed from a number of places. Note that these points are adjacent to SH5 and considerable care should be exercised when parking in this area.

properties.Title: 20.State Highway 5
properties.subtitle: Okoeke Stream
properties.Description: Access Point 20 is where SH5 follows the river which can be accessed from a number of places. This is near Opoto Falls Reserve. Note that these points are adjacent to SH5 and considerable care should be exercised when parking in this area.

properties.Title: 21.State Highway 5
properties.subtitle: Okoeke Stream / Waipunga River
properties.Description: Access Point 21 is where SH5 follows the river which can be accessed from a number of places. Note that these points are adjacent to SH5 and considerable care should be exercised when parking in this area.

properties.Title: 22.Upper Waipunga/Okoeke Stream
properties.subtitle: Okoeke Stream / Waipunga River
properties.Description: Access Point 22 - Turn right onto Pohukura Road after passing the Waipunga Falls lookout area when travelling from Napier. Then turn onto Waipunga Road. An access permit is needed. Phone: 07-350 1234 or 07-366 1000.

properties.Title: 1.Makino River
properties.subtitle: Mohaka River Tributary
properties.Description: Access Point 1 at the Makino River originates in the Kaweka Forest Park just upstream from the Te Puia Lodge. This is a small back country river that fishes well early in the season. As with most rivers of its size, care in presentation is required to achieve success.

properties.Title: 2.Makahu River
properties.subtitle: Mohaka River Tributary
properties.Description: Access Point 2 is to the Makahu River. As with the Makino River it fishes well early in the season and requires care in your approach to achieve success.

properties.Title: 3.Ripia River
properties.subtitle: Mohaka River Tributary
properties.Description: Access Point 3 to the Ripia River is where it enters the Mohaka River downstream of the Pakaututu Road Bridge on the true left side. It is a fast flowing bouldery river that requires care when wading and can hold good numbers of trout. A strip of public land runs up the true right bank of the river for approximately 10km. The land adjacent to this is privately owned.

properties.Title: 4.lnangatahi Stream
properties.subtitle: Mohaka River Tributary
properties.Description: Access Point 4 is to the little known tributary lnangatahi Stream, that runs into the Mohaka River near the SH5 bridge. It can be accessed from Potter Road Bridge. A permit is required to access this road. This can be obtained from Rayonier (06-834-0713 or 0274 477 0815).

properties.Title: 5.Te Hoe/Hautapu Rivers
properties.subtitle: Mohaka River Tributary
properties.Description: Access Point 5 is to lesser known Mohaka River tributaries,Te Hoe and Hautapu Rivers. Access is difficult due to a lack of public access and the nature of the terrain. The upper reaches of both rivers within the Whirinaki Forest Park can be accessed by aircraft. Permits are required from Rayonier New Zealand (06-834 0713 or 0274 477 0815) to access the Te Hoe River from the confluence of the Mohaka River.

properties.Title: 1.Boyd's Airstrip
properties.subtitle: Ngaruroro River/Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 1 is at Boyd's Airstrip, used by DoC as a landing site for fixed wing aircraft and helicopters. Access is by foot along the river. It is possible to fly into the Boyd and raft down the river to Kuripapango, but care is needed.

properties.Title: 2.Other Landing Sites
properties.subtitle: Ngaruroro River/Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access Points 2 are a number of other designated landing sites for helicopters between Boyd's and Kuripapango both within the Kaweka Forest Park. Permission from the commercial operators is required to land or fish from these sites.

properties.Title: 3a.Kuripapango
properties.subtitle: Ngaruroro River/Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 3a is off the Napier-Taihape Road at Kuripapango. Just before the road bridge a picnic site gives access to the river, both upstream towards the Cameron hut with a number of river crossings, and downstream for approximately 1km.

properties.Title: 3b.Kuripapango
properties.subtitle: Ngaruroro River/Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 3b is off the Napier-Taihape Road at the driveway to the Department of Conservation's Robson lodge, alongside the Napier end of the bridge, provides good access to nearly 2km of river downstream of this point.

properties.Title: 3c.Kuripapango
properties.subtitle: Ngaruroro River/Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 3c is off the Napier-Taihape Road at the picnic area providing access to some pools on the other side of the bridge but slightly upstream. Access for rafts is also available at these points for the keen angler willing to raft out to below Whanawhana.

properties.Title: 4.Whanawhana Road
properties.subtitle: Ngaruroro River/Middle Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 4 - turn off Matapiro Road onto Whanawhana Road, then down River Access Road [gravel] to end up alongside the braided section of Ngaruroro River. Foot access in both directions and across the river is limited by the river's flow and depth.

properties.Title: 6.Maraekakaho Road
properties.subtitle: Ngaruroro River/Middle Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 6 is 200m along Kereru Road from Maraekakaho Road where a metal access road leads off to the right to the river. Walking access both upstream and downstream of this point.

properties.Title: 7.Ohiti Road
properties.subtitle: Ngaruroro River/Middle Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 7 - turn off Matapiro Road onto Ohiti Road and travel approximately 4.5kms along until you reach a gravel vehicle track that leads to the river.

properties.Title: 8.Fernhill Bridge (Omahu)
properties.subtitle: Ngaruroro River/Middle Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 8 is a Regional Council access track on the Napier side of the bridge. Access upstream this side of the bridge, and also the track passes back under the bridge and heads to downstream access.

properties.Title: 9.Carrick Road
properties.subtitle: Ngaruroro River/Middle Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 9 is another Regional Council access track providing good access both upstream and downstream to the section of river between SH50 and the expressway. Carrick Road is reached off Omahu Road.

properties.Title: 10.Ormond Road
properties.subtitle: Ngaruroro River/Middle Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 10 is reached off Omahu Road, via Ormond Road. There's ample parking beside the Ngaruroro River bridge.

properties.Title: 11.Chesterhope Bridge (Pakowhai Road)
properties.subtitle: Ngaruroro River/Lower Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 11 is off Pakowhai Road with Regional Council access tracks at both ends of the Chesterhope Bridge providing access to the sections of the lower river.

properties.Title: 12.River Mouth (Waitangi/Awatoto)
properties.subtitle: Ngaruroro River/Lower Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 12 is where the Regional Council provides good access to the joint mouths of the Ngaruroro and Tutaekuri Rivers. Multiple access points are available.

properties.Title: 13.Napier-Talhape Road (Gentle Annie)
properties.subtitle: Ngaruroro River Tributary / Taruarau River
properties.Description: Access Point 13 is off the Napier-Talhape Road (the Gentle Annie). Most of the land in this area is privately owned and landowner permission is required before any angling access.

properties.Title: 14.Comet Road
properties.subtitle: Ngaruroro River Tributary / Taruarau River
properties.Description: Access Point 14 - drive to the end of Comet Road, within Kaweka Forest Park, and a DoC walking track heads steeply down to the Taruarau River 1&1/2 hours away. There is the option of overnight camping or Shute's hut.

properties.Title: 15.Big Hill Road
properties.subtitle: Ngaruroro River Tributary / Ohara-Poporangi Streams
properties.Description: Access Point 15 is off Kereru and Big Hill Road. The land at this point is privately owned and landowner permission will be required before any angling access.

properties.Title: 16.Mangleton Road
properties.subtitle: Ngaruroro River Tributary / Ohara Stream
properties.Description: Access Point 16 turn off Mangleton Road onto Gull Flat Road and park near either of the bridges. Public access for 3km up the Ohara Stream exists from the road bridge.

properties.Title: 6.McVicars Road
properties.subtitle: Mohaka River
properties.Description: Access Point 6 is approx 1km from SH5, down a metal vehicle track that leads to the river. Along the road near the lnangatahi Stream confluence is an esplanade reserve on the true left bank.

properties.Title: 1.Lake Tutira South
properties.subtitle: Lakes Tutira & Waikopiro
properties.Description: Access Point 1 is signposted by a rest area road sign which leads to a track around the entire southern end between lakes Tutira and Waikopiro. Fishing from the shore, camping, with toilet facilities also provided.

properties.Title: 2.Lake Tutira Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Lakes Tutira & Waikopiro
properties.Description: Access Point 2 is off SH2 along a short gravel track that leads around to a boat ramp. The track can be accessed by north and south bound traffic.

properties.Title: 4.Aropaoanui Road
properties.subtitle: Aropaoanui & Waikoau Rivers
properties.Description: Access Point 4 is obtained by driving to the bottom of Aropaoanui Road and crossing the bridge. The entire length of the river can be accessed as marginal strip runs up its entire length on the true right.

properties.Title: 5.Devils Elbow
properties.subtitle: Aropaoanui & Waikoau Rivers
properties.Description: Access Point 5 is approximately 2km north of the Devils Elbow, on SH2 before the Waikoau Bridge, where there is a large gravel bay so you can park well off the road and access the river by walking over the bank.

properties.Title: 6.Waikoau Bridge
properties.subtitle: Aropaoanui & Waikoau Rivers
properties.Description: Access Point 6 is directly after the Waikoau Bridge to the north where a gravel road (McIntyres Access Road) leads off to a ford that crosses the river. Park here and walk the river right up to the next access point.

properties.Title: 7.Waikoau Road
properties.subtitle: Aropaoanui & Waikoau Rivers
properties.Description: Access Point 7 is approximately 2km up Waikoau Road from Tutira you cross the Waikoau Road Bridge. Park on the true right of the bridge on the down stream side. A track leads back towards the bridge and down to the river.

properties.Title: 8.Le Quesne Road
properties.subtitle: Esk River
properties.Description: Access Point 8 to the Esk River mouth can be obtained by turning off SH2 onto Franklin Road then turning left onto Le Quesne Road at the T-intersection. Park at the end of this road and from here it is approximately a 400m walk to the Esk River.

properties.Title: 9.Shaw Road/Eskdale Park
properties.subtitle: Esk River
properties.Description: Access Point 9 is off SH5 onto Shaw Road. Follow the signs to the Eskdale Park. Once in the park, follow the vehicle track to the rivers edge.

properties.Title: 10.Waipunga Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Esk River
properties.Description: Access Point 10 is at the Waipunga Road Bridge, which provides access to the river on the true left. Note, when fishing the true right, up or down stream, you must stay within the river bed.

properties.Title: 11.Ellis Wallace Road
properties.subtitle: Esk River
properties.Description: Access Point 11 - Turn off SH5 onto Ellis Wallace Road. Just after crossing the railway, there is a parking bay off to the right which provides access to the river. Access is F&G signposted.

properties.Title: 12.Ellis Wallace Road end
properties.subtitle: Esk River
properties.Description: Access Point 12 is at the end of Ellis Wallace Road there is a ford that crosses the river. A marginal strip runs up both sides giving access to over 10km of the Esk river.

properties.Title: 13.Berry Road
properties.subtitle: Esk River
properties.Description: Access Point 13 - Turn right onto Ohurakura Road. Approximately 8km down this road, turn right onto Berry Road until you reach the first forestry gate. Park away from the gate and walk to the river.

properties.Title: 14.Lake Opouahi
properties.subtitle: Lake Opouahi
properties.Description: Access Point 14 - Turn off State Highway 2 onto Matahora Road, then turn onto Pohokura Road for approx 10kms. There is fishing from the wharf, or alternatively take a kayak to fish from.

properties.Title: 1.Mill Road Extension
properties.subtitle: Tukituki River (West)
properties.Description: Access Point 1 from Mill Road is 4km up Makaretu Road on the left. The last 8km are a narrow, winding gravel road. Near the road end there is a locked gate. Contact the Napier Fish & Game office to obtain a key.

properties.Title: 2.Hylton Burn (Tukituki Road)
properties.subtitle: Tukituki River (West)
properties.Description: Access Point 2 is an unformed public road approximately 10km up Tukituki Road. Walking access only from the stile following the painted posts. Do not disturb stock and leave gates as you find them.

properties.Title: 3.Tukituki Road
properties.subtitle: Tukituki River (West)
properties.Description: Access Point 3 is via a Central Hawke's Bay District Council gravel extraction track. Steep 2wd gravel track right to a large area of river both up and downstream.

properties.Title: 4.Tukituki Road/Ingliss Bush
properties.subtitle: Tukituki River (West)
properties.Description: Access Point 4 is on a DoC Scenic Reserve off Tukituki Road approx. 2.5km from SH50. Follow the fence line to the bush edge, walk through the reserve to the river. Some bush bashing required. No dogs.

properties.Title: 5.SH50 Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Tukituki River (West)
properties.Description: Access Point 5 is on the true left of the bridge, upstream side. Park and make your way to the rivers edge.

properties.Title: 6.Burnside Road
properties.subtitle: Tukituki River (West)
properties.Description: Access Point 6 is at the end of Burnside Road, from Ashcoft Road off SH50, crosses approximately 8km down. This section of the river may dewater during droughts.

properties.Title: 7.Ongaonga / Waipukurau Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Tukituki River (West)
properties.Description: Access Point 7 is just off the bridge near Parsons Road. This area is particularly good early and late in the season, but may de-water in a dry summer.

properties.Title: 8.SH2 Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Tukituki River (West)
properties.Description: Access Point 8 is through the unused shingle plant off State Highway 2. Good dry fly fishing in summer.

properties.Title: 9.Scenic Road
properties.subtitle: Tukituki River (West)
properties.Description: Access Point 9 is off State Highway 2, north of Waipukurau, turn onto Lindsay Road then Scenic Road runs off to the left approximately 2km from here. Walk through the Tukituki Scenic Reserve.

properties.Title: 10.SH2 Road Bridge (Waipukurau)
properties.subtitle: Tukituki River (West)
properties.Description: Access Point 10 is just off Lindsay Road via Hawke's Bay Regional Council administered land on both sides of the bridge. Good access both up and downstream.

properties.Title: 11.Ford Road
properties.subtitle: Tukituki River (West)
properties.Description: Access Point 11 is off Ford Road on the north side of the SH2 Road Bridge near Waipukurau. Access on the south side of the road for its whole length.

properties.Title: 12.Mount Herbert Road
properties.subtitle: Tukituki River (West)
properties.Description: Access Point 12 is at the end of Mt Herbert Road, to the east of Waipukurau, through the township. At the roads end continue on the track to the rivers edge park under the trees.

properties.Title: 13.Tapairu Road
properties.subtitle: Tukituki River (West)
properties.Description: Access Point 13 is at the end of Tapairu Road, south of Waipawa, off State Highway 2. Follow the road to the end and park, then it's a short stroll to the river.

properties.Title: 14.Walker Road
properties.subtitle: Tukituki River (West)
properties.Description: Access Point 14 is across Hawke's Bay Regional Council land at the roads end. This is the confluence of the Tukituki and Waipawa Rivers commonly called the Breakwater.

properties.Title: 15.Tamamu Bridge (Pourere Road)
properties.subtitle: Tukituki River (West)
properties.Description: Access Point 15 - Follow Pourere Road from Waipawa. Access is from both sides of the bridge. Downstream areas are accessed via gravelled vehicle tracks. Walking access only beyond this point.

properties.Title: 16.River Road (Shag Rock)
properties.subtitle: Tukituki River (West)
properties.Description: Access Point 16 is approximately 2km up River Road from Patangata bridge. Walking access only.

properties.Title: 17.Patangata Bridge
properties.subtitle: Tukituki River (West)
properties.Description: Access Point 17 offers the best access on the true right downstream from the bridge, via a gravel vehicle track.

properties.Title: 18.Rowe Road
properties.subtitle: Tukituki River (East)
properties.Description: Access point 18 - Rowe Road is 17km south of Havelock North along Middle Road. Access is via privately owned farmland at the end of the public road (Rowe Road) and permission is required. Foot access only.

properties.Title: 19.McKenzie Road
properties.subtitle: Tukituki River (East)
properties.Description: Access point 19 - 4km up Kahuranaki Road from Rochfort Road, an unformed public road leads to the river. The road is maintained by the adjacent landowner. Please notify the landowner that you wish to use the road. Phone 06-874-7613.

properties.Title: 20.Blind Road
properties.subtitle: Tukituki River (East)
properties.Description: Access point 20 is via on foot access from the end of Blind Road through a farm track to the river.

properties.Title: 21.Rochfort Road
properties.subtitle: Tukituki River (East)
properties.Description: Access point 21 is via double gates approximately 1km from the Kahuranaki Road intersection. This is the top of the Wildlife Refuge. No dogs. This is fishing access only - no firearms.

properties.Title: 22.Kahuranaki Road
properties.subtitle: Tukituki River (East)
properties.Description: Access point 22 offers a number of access points along the road. Most landowners allow angler access as long as you ask first. This is a Wildlife Refuge, so no dogs or firearms.

properties.Title: 23.Waimarama Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Tukituki River (East)
properties.Description: Access point 23 is via a gravel track on the true right, immediately upstream of the bridge. The track goes a short distance downstream under the bridge. Wildlife Refuge, so no dogs or firearms above here.

properties.Title: 25.River Road
properties.subtitle: Tukituki River (East)
properties.Description: Access point 25 is off River Road at the Hastings District Council Riverlands Park. It's at the end of the road, with ample parking and various access opportunities.

properties.Title: 26.Moore Road
properties.subtitle: Tukituki River (East)
properties.Description: Access point 26 is via Moore Road off Tukituki Road approximately 7km from Haumoana. Walking access from the road end, up or downstream.

properties.Title: 27.Tennant Road
properties.subtitle: Tukituki River (East)
properties.Description: Access point 27 is down Tennant Road off Tukituki Road approximately 6km from Haumoana. Walking access from the road end.

properties.Title: 28.Mill Road (Blackbridge)
properties.subtitle: Tukituki River (East)
properties.Description: Access point 28 offers walking access from both sides of the bridge. Vehicle access on true right, downstream of the bridge via a shingle plant.

properties.Title: 1.Makaroro Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Waipawa River
properties.Description: Access Point 1 is off Whakarara Road turn onto Makaroro Road until reaching the bridge. Fishing upstream or downstream, best early in the season.

properties.Title: 2.SH50 Road Bridge (Waipawa River)
properties.subtitle: Waipawa River
properties.Description: Access Point 2 is beside SH50 Road Bridge (Waipawa River) on the north side downstream. From this point, you can walk upstream or downstream a long distance.

properties.Title: 3.Plantation Road
properties.subtitle: Waipawa River
properties.Description: Access Point 3 is via Hawke's Bay Regional Council access. Note this section of the river often dewaters in a dry summer.

properties.Title: 4.Stockade Road
properties.subtitle: Waipawa River
properties.Description: Access Point 4 turn off Swamp Road onto Stockdale Road. At the end continue to Hawke's Bay Regional Council access. Note this section can de-water in a dry summer.

properties.Title: 5.Tikokino Roadhaw
properties.subtitle: Waipawa River
properties.Description: Access Point 5 is for the Mangaounku Stream which is off Tinokino Road at the bridge. Plenty of fishing for as far as you want to walk. Access Sign at Gate.

properties.Title: 6.SH2 Road Bridge (Waipawa River)
properties.subtitle: Waipawa River
properties.Description: Access Point 6 is at the SH2 Road Bridge. Take the quarry gravel road down beside the bridge, park and fish the downstream side closest to Waipawa.

properties.Title: 1.Waitangi Regional Park
properties.subtitle: Tutaekuri River
properties.Description: Access Point 1 is at Waitangi Regional Park. Public access provided by the Hawke's Bay Regional Council featuring parking, picnic areas and most with vehicle access.

properties.Title: 2.Brookfields Road
properties.subtitle: Tutaekuri River
properties.Description: Access Point 2 is by Brookfields Road Bridge. Public access provided by the Hawke's Bay Regional Council featuring parking, picnic areas and most with vehicle access.

properties.Title: 3.Guppy Road
properties.subtitle: Tutaekuri River
properties.Description: Access Point 3 is off SHW 52 at Meeanee Road then onto Guppy Road to the end. Public access provided by the Hawke's Bay Regional Council featuring parking, picnic areas and most with vehicle access.

properties.Title: 4.Redclyffe Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Tutaekuri River
properties.Description: Access Point 4 is either side of Redclyffe Road Bridge. Public access provided by the Hawke's Bay Regional Council featuring parking, picnic areas and most with vehicle access.

properties.Title: 5.Springfield Road
properties.subtitle: Tutaekuri River
properties.Description: Access Point 5 is off Springfield Road down to the river. Public access provided by the Hawke's Bay Regional Council featuring parking, picnic areas and most with vehicle access.

properties.Title: 6.Omaranui Road
properties.subtitle: Tutaekuri River
properties.Description: Access Point 6 is off Omaranui Park at the gate and then it’s a short walk to the Tutaekuri River.

properties.Title: 7.Springfield Road
properties.subtitle: Tutaekuri River
properties.Description: Access Point 7 is off Springfield Road. A Fish & Game access information sign is provided at gate.

properties.Title: 8.Dartmoor Road
properties.subtitle: Tutaekuri River
properties.Description: Access Point 8 is off Dartmoor Road at Puketapu Park. There is ample parking.

properties.Title: 9.Moteo Pa Road
properties.subtitle: Tutaekuri River
properties.Description: Access Point 9 turn off Moteo Pa Road down the gravel road, where you will find multiple access points.

properties.Title: 10.Dartmoor Road
properties.subtitle: Tutaekuri River
properties.Description: Access Point 10 is off Dartmoor Road down a short track to the river. A Fish & Game access information sign is provided at the gate.

properties.Title: 11.Dartmoor Road
properties.subtitle: Tutaekuri River
properties.Description: Access Point 11 is off Dartmoor Road down a short gravel road track to the river. Keep away from the private driveway.

properties.Title: 12.Dartmoor Road
properties.subtitle: Tutaekuri River
properties.Description: Access Point 12 is just opposite Aply Road along Darmoor Road.

properties.Title: 13.Dartmoor Road
properties.subtitle: Tutaekuri River
properties.Description: Access Point 13 is off Dartmoor Road in a parking layby with a short track to the river. A Fish & Game access information sign is provided.

properties.Title: 14.Dartmoor Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Tutaekuri River
properties.Description: Access Point 14 turn off just after Dartmoor Road Bridge to the Mangaone Confluence. Park under the trees. This point also also gives access to the Mangaone River.

properties.Title: 15.Lower Flag Range Road
properties.subtitle: Tutaekuri River
properties.Description: Access Point 15 is at the end of Lower Flag Range Road with ample parking. 2WD is not recommended on the final part when it's wet.

properties.Title: 16.Dampney Road
properties.subtitle: Tutaekuri River
properties.Description: Access Point 16 is at Dampney Road. Public vehicle access to the Tutaekuri River and Mangatutu Stream. The road is gravel and 4WD recommended and the ford is only safe in normal flows.

properties.Title: 17.Lawrence Hut
properties.subtitle: Tutaekuri River
properties.Description: Access Point 17 turn off Taihape Road onto Lawrence Road to the end. The route through the forest to the Lawrence Hut area is marked by the Department of Conservation.

properties.Title: 18.Kuripapango Lakes
properties.subtitle: Kuripapango Lakes
properties.Description: Access point 18 is a short walk off Kuripapango Road that takes you to the Lakes. There is a Lakes carpark at the northern end of the tramping track.

properties.Title: 19.Waldon Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Mangatutu Stream
properties.Description: Access point 19 is near Waldon Road Bridge at Mangatutu Road Bridge with access to the Tutaekuri River and Mangatutu Stream. Park off the road by the Mangatutu Bridge.

properties.Title: 20.Hawkston Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Mangatutu Stream
properties.Description: Access point 20 is by the Hawkston Road Bridge Access is provided by Hawkston Station so respect this by staying along stream margins. No dogs and leave no rubbish.

properties.Title: 21.Puketitiri Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Mangaone River
properties.Description: Access point 21 is beside the Puketitiri Road Bridge that goes over the Mangaone River. A Fish & Game access information sign is provided, just park under the bridge safely.

properties.Title: 22.Matariki Forests
properties.subtitle: Mangaone River
properties.Description: Access point 22 is through Matariki Forests and is by permit only.

properties.Title: 24.Waimarama Road (Smalls)
properties.subtitle: Tukituki River (East)
properties.Description: Access point 24 is via the cattle yards approximately 1km downstream of the Waimarama Road Bridge. Rough vehicle tracks. Both up and downstream walking access.

properties.Title: 1.Rainbow Falls Road
properties.subtitle: Kerikeri River
properties.Description: Access point 1 is from the reserve at the end of Rainbow Falls Road, which is located between Waipapa and Kerikeri on the Waipapa Road. Park at the reserve car park and then follow designated tracks to the river.

properties.Title: 2.State Highway 10
properties.subtitle: Waiaruhe River
properties.Description: Access point 2 is on State Highway 10, opposite the Puketona Junction and has a stile across the boundary fence installed to assist anglers obtaining access to the River.

properties.Title: 3.Lillypond Lane
properties.subtitle: Waitangi River
properties.Description: Access point 3 is situated at Lillypond Lane, off Puketona Road. This access point leads to the true right bank of the main river where anglers are able to walk upstream for 2,500m or downstream for 700m.

properties.Title: 4.State Highway 10 Bridge
properties.subtitle: Puketotara Stream (upper)
properties.Description: Access point 4 is situated next to the State Highway 10 bridge, 200m North of the Waimate North Road turnoff. Anglers have access to the true right bank of the river for some 4,000m upstream.

properties.Title: 5.Golf View Road
properties.subtitle: Puketotara Stream (lower)
properties.Description: Access point 5 is at the bridge on Golf View Road, which leads to the Kerikeri Golf Course. Limited fishable water, which only extends for 350m upstream from the sign on the true right bank, or downstream for 200m on the true right bank.

properties.Title: 6.Forest Road
properties.subtitle: Waipapa River
properties.Description: Access point 6 is off State Highway 1, down Forest Road about 8km north of the township of Okaihau. A reserve is located parallel to the river at the end of this road where parking is available.

properties.Title: 1.Prescott Road
properties.subtitle: Wilson's Dam
properties.Description: Access point 1 is located off State Highway 1, just north of Ruakaka on Prescott Road. Requires a moderate walk down to the reservoir.

properties.Title: 2.Prescott Road
properties.subtitle: Wilson's Dam
properties.Description: Access point 2 is located off State Highway 1, just north of Ruakaka on Prescott Road. Requires a moderate walk down to the reservoir.

properties.Title: 3.Wilson's Dam wall
properties.subtitle: Wilson's Dam
properties.Description: Access point 3 at the end of Sail Rock Road where there's a large parking lot at the base of the wall. Anglers are required to walk from there to the edge of the reservoir.

properties.Title: 4.Waima River
properties.subtitle: Dargaville Area
properties.Description: Access point 4 - The Waima River is 45km north of Dargaville along State Highway 12, then up Trounson Park Road to Aranga Station Road.

properties.Title: 5.Mangatu River
properties.subtitle: Dargaville Area
properties.Description: Access point 5 - The Mangatu River flows into the Kaihu River approximately 5kms upstream of the motor camp along Oputeke Road. The conditions are similar to those of the Kaihu River.

properties.Title: 6.Kaihu River
properties.subtitle: Dargaville Area
properties.Description: Access point 6 - The Kaihu River 30 Km north of Dargaville township on State Highway 12 flows in a southerly direction. The best way to fish the river is to head upstream from Kaihu township.

properties.Title: 7.Punakitere River
properties.subtitle: Kaikohe Area
properties.Description: Access point 7 - The Punakitere River Flows along Ngapipito Road, South West of Kaikohe out to the Hokianga Harbour. Access is from SH15 and SH12. However there is no marginal strip along the majority of the river.

properties.Title: 1.Russell Road
properties.subtitle: Kaimamaku River
properties.Description: Access point 1 is approximately 1km from the SH1 intersection. Signage and stile. Fishing from in the river channel is recommended.

properties.Title: 2.Russell Road
properties.subtitle: Kaimamaku River
properties.Description: Access point 2 is from the Hodge Road Bridge.

properties.Title: 3.Russell Road
properties.subtitle: Kaimamaku River
properties.Description: Access point 3 is downstream from Peach Orchard Road allowing good easy walking and fishing entry.

properties.Title: 4.Peach Orchard Rd
properties.subtitle: Kaikanui River
properties.Description: Access point 4 - Stiles are present either side of this bridge.

properties.Title: 5.Kaikanui River Bridge
properties.subtitle: Kaikanui River
properties.Description: Access Point 5 - Leave SH1 and turn right into Russell Rd. The Kaikanui River is the first bridge you will come across. Access at this point allows anglers to fish downstream for 0.5km and 200m downstream is the Kaimamaku confluence.

properties.Title: 6.Pigs Head Road
properties.subtitle: Kaikanui River
properties.Description: Access Point 6 - 6km along Whananaki North Road is Pigs Head Road turnoff on the left. A short distance down this road is a bridge crossing the Kaikanui River. Kaikanui Road turnoff on the right just prior to the bridge crossing gives access to the Kaikanui's upper reaches which has no marginal strip, so obtaining landowner permission is imperative. The road is in close proximity to the river at various points. By wading upstream from these points anglers may fish where the river makes that possible.

properties.Title: 7.Otonga Marua Road
properties.subtitle: Kirikiritoki Stream / Te Waiongatahuna Stream
properties.Description: There are several access points along the Otonga Marua Road. There is only marginal access so anglers will have to walk by the river.

properties.Title: 8.Mower Road
properties.subtitle: Mangahahuru Stream
properties.Description: Access point 8 is to the Mangahahuru Stream. This waterway is a small glimmer of its previous self as exotic foresting upstream in The Glenbervie State forest has impacted on the water quality. The stream can be accessed from Mower Rd. Anglers can walk upstream in the river channel. Access also exists off Mains Rd at the forestry entrance gate.

properties.Title: 9.Main Road
properties.subtitle: Mangahahuru Stream
properties.Description: Access point 9 is off Main Road at the forestry entrance gate.

properties.Title: 10.Jordan Valley Rd Bridge
properties.subtitle: Wairua River
properties.Description: Access point 10 is off Jordan Valley Road. Continue until the Wairua River Bridge is reached. Park here with access is both up and down the river on either side. Access is signposted.

properties.Title: 11.Rushbrook Road
properties.subtitle: Mangahahuru Stream-Wairua River confluence
properties.Description: Access point 11, approx. 500m before the Wairua River bridge on JVR turn off into Rushbrook Road and follow until you come to another bridge. Down to the right is an access sign and stile. Anglers may fish up or down this stretch of water.

properties.Title: 12.State Highway 1
properties.subtitle: Waiariki Stream
properties.Description: Access point 11 - 1km south of a SH1 railway crossing, An access point adjacent to an old section of state highway allows anglers to fish upstream slightly but predominantly downstream on the right hand bank. The left hand bank allows access for many kilometres of farmland fishing, which is part of the Hikurangi Swamp flood protection plan.

properties.Title: 13.State Highway 1
properties.subtitle: Waiotu River
properties.Description: Access point 13 - At the intersection of SH1 and Waiotu Block Road.

properties.Title: 14.Tapuhi Road
properties.subtitle: Waiotu River
properties.Description: Access point 14 is about 2km north of the rail crossing on SH1, turn right just past Hukerenui Tavern onto Tapuhi Rd. Proceed up Tapuhi Rd until the second concrete bridge is crossed and on your left is an access sign and stile.

properties.Title: 15.Tapuhi Road
properties.subtitle: Waiotu River
properties.Description: Access point 15 is approx. 1.5km up Tapuhi Rd from access point 14. A short 500-600m walk along the fence line will bring you to the Waiotu River. Fishing is permitted upstream for 2-3 hours until anglers reach Morgan Rd Bridge.

properties.Title: 16.Morgan Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Waiotu River
properties.Description: Access point 16 is at the Morgan Rd Bridge. Anglers may fish upstream on the right hand bank for approximately 1.5km. From the bridge they may fish downstream on the left hand bank until access point 15 is reached.

properties.Title: 17.Matarau Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Wairua River
properties.Description: Access point 17 - Turn right off Rushbrook Road and follow road until you reach Matarau Rd-Wairua River Bridge. 100m past this bridge on the right hand side is an access point and stile.

properties.Title: 18.Malone Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Wairua River
properties.Description: Access point 14 - Off Kokopu Road, turn down Malone Road until you reach the Malone Road Bridge. Park safely either side.

properties.Title: 19.Wairua Falls Road
properties.subtitle: Wairua River
properties.Description: Access point 19 is off SH15 onto Wairua Falls Road. Marginal strip allows fishing downstream or upstream until Malone Road. This stretch of river is tree-lined for many kms as it meanders through surrounding farmland.

properties.Title: 1.Onekura Road
properties.subtitle: Lake Manuwai
properties.Description: Access point 1 - The entrance for public access comes off Onekura Road which is a walking track of approximately 80 metres and leads down to the lake edge.

properties.Title: 2.Sandys Road
properties.subtitle: Lake Manuwai
properties.Description: Access point 2 is from Sandys Road with ample parking at the reservoirs edge.

properties.Title: 1.SH60 Bridge
properties.subtitle: Motueka River - Lower Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 1 is available on both sides of bridge. Vehicle access on the west bank up and down stream on the true left side of river. Foot access from parking area on true right.

properties.Title: 2.Douglas Road
properties.subtitle: Motueka River - Lower Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 2 - Park at the designated car park at the end of Douglas Road. Walk/climb over the stile and follow the track markers to the river.

properties.Title: 3.West Bank Road “Gum Tree Corner”
properties.subtitle: Motueka River - Lower Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 3 - Approximately 5km from SH 60 off West Bank Road, at Gum Tree Corner, to find the true left side of river. Parking is on side of road.

properties.Title: 4.West Bank Road
properties.subtitle: Motueka River - Lower Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 4 - Follow West Bank Road upstream 0.3km from 'Gum Tree Corner' then follow the track markers for upstream access.

properties.Title: 5.Whakarewa Street Motueka
properties.subtitle: Motueka River - Lower Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 4 - Vehicle access to Whakarewa Street end to a gate, with foot access up and down true right of the river.

properties.Title: 6.Hurley Road
properties.subtitle: Motueka - Lower Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 6 - Vehicle access off Motueka Valley Highway on Hurley Road, and then follow the gravel road through the gate, over the stop bank, to the parking area. Foot access is up and down the river.

properties.Title: 7.West Bank Road - Rocky River
properties.subtitle: Motueka River - Lower Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 7 - 7.7km upstream from Gum Tree Corner or 0.5km down from Alexander Bluff Bridge. Park at Annes Picnic Area, below Rocky River Bridge. For downstream access, go through the gate 100m downstream of Annies Picnic area (vehicle access is sometimes possible).

properties.Title: 8.Alexander Bluff Bridge
properties.subtitle: Motueka River - Lower Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 8 - Best foot access is via West Bank Road from car park below the bridge on true left of the river. 4WD access downstream of the bridge off Motueka Valley Highway.

properties.Title: 9.West Bank Road
properties.subtitle: Motueka River - Lower Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 9 - Approximately 3.0km upstream of the Alexander Bridge at Herring Stream confluence, there is further access to the river upstream by walking along the road and cutting over to river.

properties.Title: 10.Bluff off Motueka Valley Highway
properties.subtitle: Motueka River - Lower Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 10 - Just 4.0km upstream from Alexander Bridge on true right of river offers upstream access by climbing over the stile at the car park. For downstream access, follow the road verge to the stile over the fence.

properties.Title: 11.West Bank Road - Mint Alley
properties.subtitle: Motueka River - Lower Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 11 - Is off Mint Alley, approximately 2km upstream from Herring Stream bridge. Good downstream access by walking down the riverbed.

properties.Title: 12.Peninsula Bridge
properties.subtitle: Motueka River - Middle Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 12 - The best parking is at the TDC Reserve. For true left upstream of the bridge off Peninsula Road, go through the gate beside the Bowling Club.

properties.Title: 13.Motueka Valley Highway
properties.subtitle: Motueka River - Middle Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 13 - Off the Motueka Valley Highway, 1.8km upstream from Peninsula Bridge. Park at the access sign and follow the track to the river.

properties.Title: 14.Motueka Valley Highway
properties.subtitle: Motueka River - Middle Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 14 - Off the Motueka Valley Highway, 1.5km upstream from access 14. Park safely on the roadside at the double gates. Foot access to the river is over the stile.

properties.Title: 15.West Bank Road/Graham Stream
properties.subtitle: Motueka River - Middle Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 15 - Vehicle access to the river is through the picnic area below Graham Stream Bridge.

properties.Title: 16.Motueka Valley Highway
properties.subtitle: Motueka River - Middle Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 16 - Off the Motueka Valley Highway, opposite the Pearse River confluence. Park through the gate.

properties.Title: 17.West Bank Road/Pearse River
properties.subtitle: Motueka River - Middle Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 17 - Park at Pearse River Bridge. Cross the road and walk down the track on the true left of Pearse River.

properties.Title: 18.West Bank Road
properties.subtitle: Motueka River - Middle Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 18 - Approximately 1km upstream from the Pearse River bridge on West Bank Road. Vehicle access to the river.

properties.Title: 19.Woodstock Bridge
properties.subtitle: Motueka River - Middle Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 19 - Park safely at Woodstock Bridge and find there's foot access from both sides of bridge.

properties.Title: 20.Motueka Valley Highway
properties.subtitle: Motueka River - Middle Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 20 - Off the Motueka Valley Highway, 2.5km upstream from Woodstock Bridge, opposite Baton River confluence, find vehicle access to the river.

properties.Title: 21.Motueka Valley Highway/Macleans Reserve
properties.subtitle: Motueka River - Middle Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 21 - Off the Motueka Valley Highway at Macleans Reserve, find vehicle access along a gravel track through the picnic and campground area.

properties.Title: 22.Motueka Valley Highway/Stanley Brook
properties.subtitle: Motueka River - Middle Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 22 - Off the Motueka Valley Highway, park on roadside. It’s a short walk to the river immediately below the Stanley Brook confluence.

properties.Title: 23.Wangapeka River Confluence
properties.subtitle: Motueka River - Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 23 - Vehicle access is via Tapawera along Tapawera Baton Road. Turn right onto Newport Road (Drummonds Road) and take the track 50m from turnoff that leads to the river. Park and walk downstream to the confluence.

properties.Title: 24.Tapawera –Baton Road
properties.subtitle: Motueka River - Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 24 - 6.5km downstream from Tapawera Road Bridge. Park at the power pole. Access points are available upstream where the river meets the road. There are no signs.

properties.Title: 25.Tapawera Bridge off SH61
properties.subtitle: Motueka River - Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 25 - Vehicle access to the river on true right beside the bridge, fishing downstream of the bridge. There is no sign.

properties.Title: 26.State Highway 6/Kohatu Bridge
properties.subtitle: Motueka River - Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 26 - Vehicle access to the Motupiko confluence and then access to the true left of the Motueka River.

properties.Title: 27.Valley Road
properties.subtitle: Motueka River - Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 27 - Take North Road at the junction of State Highway 6 and turn left onto Valley Road. Drive 200m south to the access sign/gravel track. There's good vehicle access to the river upstream.

properties.Title: 28.Opposite Gold Pine
properties.subtitle: Motueka River - Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 28 - Turn off Valley Road 3km south of access point 27. Drive down the 200m track to the river, across from Gold Pine.

properties.Title: 29.Valley Road
properties.subtitle: Motueka River - Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 29 - Downstream from Golden Downs Gun Club on the true right. Follow the track and park. Foot access down the rough track which is approximately 300m to the river.

properties.Title: 30.Janson Bridge
properties.subtitle: Motueka River - Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 30 - Park on the downstream side on the east bank of the bridge to access the true right of the river.

properties.Title: 31.Motueka Gorge
properties.subtitle: Motueka River - Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 31 - Turn left after crossing Janson Bridge (Blue Glen Road) and follow the gravel track to the Motueka Gorge at the end of road. There is no sign.

properties.Title: 1.SH6 Bridge at Kohatu
properties.subtitle: Motupiko River
properties.Description: Access Point 1 - Drive over the bridge on the Western side. Access is on the left approximately 200m past the bridge.

properties.Title: 2.SH6 at Quinney's Bush
properties.subtitle: Motupiko River
properties.Description: Access Point 2 - Off State Highway 6 at Quinney's Bush. Permission is required from the landowner first here. Please phone Mark Quinney on 03 522 4249.

properties.Title: 3.SH6 at Long Gully
properties.subtitle: Motupiko River
properties.Description: Access Point 3 - Off State Highway 6 at Long Gully. Vehicle access is down a gravel road to the river. There is no sign.

properties.Title: 4.Korere Tophouse Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Motupiko River
properties.Description: Access Point 4 - At the bridge, park on east side downstream on the true right of river.

properties.Title: 5.Korere Tophouse Road
properties.subtitle: Motupiko River
properties.Description: Access Point 5 - 4km upstream from Korere Bridge, park on the left side of the road, away from any gates. Foot access is through private property so please show respect.

properties.Title: 6.Rainy River Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Motupiko River
properties.Description: Access Point 6 - Drive over the Rainy River Road Bridge and park on the upstream side. Walk back over the bridge and through the gate on left to get to the river.

properties.Title: 1.Pikimai Bridge
properties.subtitle: Wangapeka River
properties.Description: Access Point 1 - Vehicle accessis via Tapawera along the Tapawera Baton Road. Then turn right onto Pikimai Road. Park on the corner and follow the track markers to get to the river.

properties.Title: 2.Tapawera-Baton Road
properties.subtitle: Wangapeka River
properties.Description: Access Point 2 - 1.5km upstream from the Pikimai Road turnoff, find a parking area to the true right side of river. When parking, please keep clear of any gateways.

properties.Title: 3.Tapawera-Baton Road
properties.subtitle: Wangapeka River
properties.Description: Access Point 3 is 1.5km upstream. Park at the access sign and follow the short track to the river.

properties.Title: 4.Tapawera-Baton Road
properties.subtitle: Wangapeka River
properties.Description: Access Point 4 - 1km upstream from Cylinder Bridge. Park on the side of road at the sign (avoid parking down boggy track). Foot access to river from here.

properties.Title: 5.Wangapeka Plain Road
properties.subtitle: Wangapeka River
properties.Description: Access Point 5 is 5km upstream of Cylinder Bridge at the end of Wangapeka Plain Road. Please keep gateways clear by parking back down the road on the verge at the designated parking site. On return, walk back to your vehicle along the rivers edge, not through the farm.

properties.Title: 6.Upper Wangapeka Road
properties.subtitle: Wangapeka River
properties.Description: Access Point 6 is along Wangapeka Road - Park at the access sign which is 3km downstream from Dart Stream Ford. Cross the road and walk to the river.

properties.Title: 7.Upper Wangapeka Road
properties.subtitle: Wangapeka River
properties.Description: Access Point 7 is along Wangapeka Road - 1.6 km downstream from Dart Stream Ford. Park on the hill side of the road at the carpark.

properties.Title: 8.Upper Wangapeka Road-Dart Ford
properties.subtitle: Wangapeka River
properties.Description: Access Point 8 - Park at Dart Ford. Follow the Dart River downstream approx 200m to the Wangapeka River. Fish upstream from true left bank. To access out, cross the river above the farmhouse and follow the Wangapeka Road to Dart Stream Ford. There is no sign.

properties.Title: 9.Upper Wangapeka Road-above Farmhouse
properties.subtitle: Wangapeka River
properties.Description: Access Point 9 is 3.4km upstream of Dart Stream Ford. There is legal access here and at multiple points upstream. Enter and exit where the road adjoins river. Legal access along the riverbank (although some private title between road and riverbank exists). Please park away from any gates. There are no signs.

properties.Title: 10.Upper Wangapeka Road-Chummies Pool
properties.subtitle: Wangapeka River
properties.Description: Access Point 10 is along Wangapeka Road at Chummies pool. The parking area is on the right. There are no signs.

properties.Title: 11.Upper Wangapeka Road-above Farmhouse
properties.subtitle: Wangapeka River
properties.Description: Access Point 11 is along the Wangapeka Road above the farmhouse. The parking area is on the right.

properties.Title: 12.Upper Wangapeka Road-above Farmhouse
properties.subtitle: Wangapeka River
properties.Description: Access Point 12 is along Wangapeka Road above the farmhouse. The parking area is on the right.

properties.Title: 13.Upper Wangapeka Road-above Farmhouse
properties.subtitle: Wangapeka River
properties.Description: Access Point 13 is along Wangapeka Road above the farmhouse. This is start of the Wangapeka Track.

properties.Title: 1.Wairau Bar
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 1 - Vehicle access to the northern side of the Wairau River mouth. Boat ramp.

properties.Title: 2.Baldicks Bend
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 2 - No sign. Foot access downstream along edge of river by vineyard. Please take care during the harvest. Do not enter the vineyard when spraying is happening.

properties.Title: 3.Wairau Diversion Bridge North Side
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 3 - Northern side driving access downstream of the bridge, walking access upstream, downstream and southern side of the bridge.

properties.Title: 4.Wairau Diversion Bridge South Side
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 4 - Vehicle access during whitebait season. Foot access all year.

properties.Title: 5.Bothams Bend North Bank
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 5 is from Thomas's Road. Drive over the stop bank and park out of the way. This is the start of the diversion.

properties.Title: 6.Bothams Bend Road-South Bank
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 6 allows vehicle access to the diversion and Wairau directly below SH1.

properties.Title: 7.Ferry Bridge North Bank
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 7 - Park on the downstream side of the bridge. Walking access upstream to the diversion.

properties.Title: 8.Stop Bank Road South Bank
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 8 - Turn left down Peninsula Road (south bank of Ferry Bridge) to the carpark. Foot access to the river and the mouth of Spring Creek.

properties.Title: 9.Wairau Bridge SH1
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 9 - Driving access above and below the bridge on the South Bank.

properties.Title: 10.Gravel Pit Access
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 10 - Off the Tuamarina/Kaituna Road. Vehicle access over the flood bank to the river. There is also foot access to the river 1.7km further upstream, along the Tuamarina/Kaituna Road.

properties.Title: 11.Hillocks Road End
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 11 - Vehicle access over the flood bank to the river.

properties.Title: 12.Cravens Road End
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 12 - Vehicle access over the flood bank to the river.

properties.Title: 13.The Islands
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 13 - Vehicle access 3.2km upstream from Gravel Pit (Access point 10).

properties.Title: 14.Selmes Rd End
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 14 - Vehicle access over flood bank to the river.

properties.Title: 15.Suttons Corner
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 15 - Park away from the gateway. Walking access is through a small wooden gate to the river 2.5km from The Islands (Access point 13).

properties.Title: 16.Wratts Road End
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 16 - Park before the farm house driveway. Walking access over the stile and along the fence line to the river.

properties.Title: 17.Steadmans
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 17 - Walking access is through a small gate to the river, 1.5km from Suttons Corner (Access point 15).

properties.Title: 18.Giffords Road End
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 18 - Vehicle access is over the flood bank to river.

properties.Title: 19.Jefferies Road End
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 19 - Vehicle access over the flood bank past the gravel processing area to the river. Access is also available via Pauls and Boyces Roads.

properties.Title: 20.Gravel Pit Road-Boyces Road
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 20 - Opposite Gibsons Road. Follow the vehicle track past the shingle storage area to the river, 3.1km from Steadmans (Access point 17) and 3.9km from SH6 Bridge.

properties.Title: 21.Renwick Bridge SH6 South Bank
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 21 - Vehicle access off SH6 upstream and downstream of the bridge. Also, vehicle access upstream along the stop bank past access point 24 and Fareham Lane up to SVIS intake. Vehicle access is also available at Pauls and Boyces Road ends.

properties.Title: 22.Renwick Bridge SH6 North Bank
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 22 - Access on the upstream and downstream side of the bridge.

properties.Title: 23.Salmon Farm
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 23 - Go over the first bridge 200m along Northbank Road. Vehicle access is through the gate and along the track beside the stop bank. Park at the end of the vineyard. It’s a short walk fording a small stream to the river.

properties.Title: 24.Condors Bend Road End
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 24 - Drive straight ahead along gravel road for 1km then turn right. Vehicle access to flood bank. Walk over bank to the river.

properties.Title: 25.Rock Ferry
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 25 - 1.3km past Rock Ferry. Park in the cut in and walk down the steep track to the river.

properties.Title: 26.Waihopai River Bridge
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 26 - Walking access on east bank of Waihopai River via Condors Forest Road. Park near the gate. Then it’s a 20 minute walk to the Wairau River on Waihopai West bank.

properties.Title: 27.Narrows
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 27 - Vehicle access to the river.

properties.Title: 28.North Bank Road
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 28 - Rapid #1806 North Bank Road. 1.3km downstream of Bartletts Creek Bridge.

properties.Title: 29.Fareham Lane
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 29 - 1.3km downstream from Waihopai Bridge. Vehicle access to the river at SVIS intake and along the stop bank to SH6 Bridge.

properties.Title: 30.March Burn Creek
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 30 - Vehicle access to the roads end, then foot access only along the stop-bank to the river.

properties.Title: 31.North Bank Road
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 31 - Foot access to the river. 3.4km from Bartletts Creek Bridge.

properties.Title: 32.Loddon Lane
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 32 - Vehicle access is straight ahead to the river after fording a stream.

properties.Title: 33.North Bank Road
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 33 - No sign. 3.4km upstream of access point 31 or 2km upstream of Pine Valley #2 Bridge. Park on the side of the road and scramble through scrub to the river.

properties.Title: 34.Cat Creek Point Bridge
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 34 - Park at Cat/Timms Creek bridge (2.7km from Pine Valley #2 bridge or .7km from Access point 33) and follow the creek downstream to the river.

properties.Title: 35.Church Lane
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 35 - Vehicle access to the river from Church Lane (turn right at the river bank).

properties.Title: 36.Mill Road
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 36 - Vehicle access to the river. Park away from gateways.

properties.Title: 37.Tapps Road
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 37 - Vehicle access to the river. Tapps Road is not signposted. Park away from gateways. It's 2.4km from Mill Road (Access point 36).

properties.Title: 38.Top Valley Stream Bridge
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 38 - Walking access to the Wairau River down the streambed. Access to Wairau River from Top Valley Stream to the Goulter Confluence is easily obtained at various locations off the West Bank Road.

properties.Title: 39.Larking Road (Springfield Terraces)
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 39 - Vehicle access to the river. The road is not signposted. Follow the access signs and park away from the gates. It's 7.7km from Tapps Road (Access point 37) and 3.8km from Fowlers Way (Access point 40).

properties.Title: 40.Fowlers Access Way
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 40 - Dry weather vehicle access only. Follow the vineyard edge to the river. 2km downstream from the Wye River Bridge.

properties.Title: 41.Branch Hydro Channel Road
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 41 - Vehicle access to the Wairau River, hydro channels and Goulter Confluence, if the Wairau is low.

properties.Title: 42.Branch River Bridge SH63
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 42 - Vehicle access to the riverbed downstream end. The entry point is 300m on the west side of the bridge, drive to the gravel storage area.

properties.Title: 43.Kowhai Point
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 43 - is at the Kowhai Point Camping and picnic area.

properties.Title: 44.Wash Bridge SH63
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 44 - Upstream limit for salmon and winter fishing. Access available from both sides of the bridge.

properties.Title: 45.Stoney Creek
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 45 - 1.4km from Wash Bridge (Access point 44). Walk down the creek to river.

properties.Title: 46.Groyne Corner
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 46 is 5.7km from Stoney Creek (Access point 45). Park in riverbed.

properties.Title: 47.Rainbow Station Hay Shed SH63
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 47 - No vehicle access. Park away from gate, follow signs across the paddock to the stile and track to river. 4.1km from Groyne Corner (Access point 46).

properties.Title: 48.Rainbow Valley Ski Area Turnoff
properties.subtitle: Wairau River
properties.Description: Access point 48 - Public road to Six Mile Creek and Ski Area turnoff. Voluntary beat system in place above No Catchem Stream. Seasonal access above Six Mile Creek to Molesworth.

properties.Title: 1.Rai Falls
properties.subtitle: Rai River
properties.Description: Access point 1 is 1.5km from Pelorus Bridge. Good parking opposite Rai Falls. Walking track for upstream access starts by the parking area.

properties.Title: 2.Bulford Bridge
properties.subtitle: Rai River
properties.Description: Access point 2 is over the Bulford Bridge immediately downstream off the side of the gravel road. Park safely with blocking any gates.

properties.Title: 3.SH6
properties.subtitle: Rai River
properties.Description: Access point 3 offers safe parking where indicated off SH6. The track to the river is opposite. Good stream crossing is available here.

properties.Title: 4.Brown Stream Reserve
properties.subtitle: Rai River
properties.Description: Access point 4 is at the Brown Stream Reserve, with parking and a camping area.

properties.Title: 1.Opouri Valley Road-Carluke Bridge
properties.subtitle: Opouri River
properties.Description: Access point 5 is by parking over the Carluke Bridge on the downstream side. The river is open all year downstream of the bridge.

properties.Title: 2.Tunakino Valley Bridge
properties.subtitle: Opouri River
properties.Description: Access point 2 is via the vehicle track on the upstream side of the Tunakino Valley Bridge.

properties.Title: 3.Opouri Valley Road
properties.subtitle: Opouri River
properties.Description: Access point 3 is 1.8km from the Tunakino Valley Road with vehicle access to the river.

properties.Title: 4.Opouri Valley Bridge No.2
properties.subtitle: Opouri River
properties.Description: Access point 4 park where indicated at the sign. Cross the Opouri Valley Bridge No. 2 and use steep track on left immediately after bridge. Caution is required.

properties.Title: 1.Te Hoiere Road
properties.subtitle: Pelorus River - Lower Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 1 is 2.7km from Havelock along Te Hoiere Road with public access to the river up and downstream off the first bridge, on the east bank only. Limited access to the river exists on the west bank off the second bridge.

properties.Title: 2.Top of Twidles Island
properties.subtitle: Pelorus River - Lower Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 2 is 2.3km from Te Hoiere Road. Park on roadside at the sign where indicated. Foot access to the river by following the track markers.

properties.Title: 3.Kaiuma Road
properties.subtitle: Pelorus River - Lower Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 3 is 6.6km downstream of Daltons Bridge. Foot access only along the track to the river. No dogs please.

properties.Title: 4.Canvastown School
properties.subtitle: Pelorus River - Lower Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 4 is by taking the vehicle track immediately left of Canvastown School, 500m to the river. Watch out for any electric wires across the track. The sign is often missing.

properties.Title: 5.Kaiuma Road
properties.subtitle: Pelorus River
properties.Description: Access point 5 is 400m downstream of Daltons Bridge. Park where indicated at the sign and follow the track markers along the fence line downstream.

properties.Title: 6.Daltons Bridge
properties.subtitle: Pelorus River - Lower Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 6 is via vehicle parking over Daltons Bridge downstream on the north bank. Foot access by the bridge upstream on the north bank walking track and downstream on the south bank.

properties.Title: 7.SH6
properties.subtitle: Pelorus River - Lower Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 7 is 400m upstream of Daltons Bridge, beside Daltons Culvert. Safe parking by the gravel piles. Best accessed in low flows. Foot access via the track a further 300m upstream which provides better access to some shallow water.

properties.Title: 8.SH6 Hughes Creek
properties.subtitle: Pelorus River - Lower Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 8 is 3km from Daltons Bridge. Safe parking where indicated on the track to Hayshed, 100m upstream on south side of road or on the river side of the road at the entry sign (through a tight turn onto the paddock). Cross over the fence and walk to the river. Take care entering/exiting as this is a busy State Highway.

properties.Title: 9.SH6 Totara Flat gravel extraction area
properties.subtitle: Pelorus River - Lower Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 9 is via vehicle access to the river. There is a DOC picnic area with a nice swimming hole immediately upstream on the next State Highway exit right. Take care entering/exiting as this is a busy State Highway.

properties.Title: 10.Pelorus Bridge Car Park
properties.subtitle: Pelorus River - Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 10 with good parking, but no sign. Department of Conservation Falls track provides upstream access to the Pelorus River and the Circle track access to the Rai and Pelorus Rivers confluence.

properties.Title: 11.Tinline Confluence
properties.subtitle: Pelorus River - Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 11 is 8.4kms from SH6. The track and parking is 100m past the Tinline Stream Bridge, on the south bank.

properties.Title: 12.Heringa Stream Confluence
properties.subtitle: Pelorus River - Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 12 is 3.8km from the Tinline Stream Bridge.

properties.Title: 13.End of Road Car Park
properties.subtitle: Pelorus River - Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 13 is 14km from SH6. The Department of Conservation track starts into the Mt Richmond Park. Excellent huts, tracks and swing bridges provide access to the Upper Pelorus River and its tributaries. There is no sign.

properties.Title: 1.Wakamarina Confluence
properties.subtitle: Wakamarina River
properties.Description: Access point 1 is off SH6 Bridge over the Wakamarina River. Follow the track downstream along the east bank for 500m. Park where indicated. Access to the Wakamarina above SH6 Bridge is available beside the Trout Hotel.

properties.Title: 2.Wakamarina Valley Road
properties.subtitle: Wakamarina River
properties.Description: Access point 2 is 3.1km from SH6.

properties.Title: 3.Wakamarina Valley Road
properties.subtitle: Wakamarina River
properties.Description: Access point 3 is at the Butchers Flat Camping Area (DOC), which is 15km from SH6.

properties.Title: 1.Waitapu Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Takaka River
properties.Description: Access point 1 Take SH 60 through Takaka towards Collingwood. Ample parking available on Takaka side of bridge (true right). Foot access track up and downstream. Good spin fishing opportunity in large pool. “Sea run” or estuary dwelling Brown Trout throughout Whitebait season October-November. Occasional Chinook Salmon late spring and summer months.

properties.Title: 2.Takaka Township
properties.subtitle: Takaka River
properties.Description: Access point 2 is via foot access to the river (true right) via Reilly Street. Park at Citizens Band Rooms and walk to the river.

properties.Title: 3.Kotinga Bridge
properties.subtitle: Takaka River
properties.Description: Access point 3 - Turn off SH60 approximately 2km south of Takaka onto Long Plain Road. Cross bridge and take first right turn on a narrow gravel track for approximately 500m and park. Good upstream access, particularly for fly anglers.

properties.Title: 4.Paynes Ford Bridge
properties.subtitle: Takaka River
properties.Description: Access point 4 - This Reserve off SH60 is located on the Takaka side of the River with excellent parking complete with picnic tables and toilets. Downstream access best by crossing the river to the Waingaro River confluence entering on the true left. This access point also provides access to the lower Waingaro River.

properties.Title: 5.Stoney Creek
properties.subtitle: Takaka River
properties.Description: Access point 5 - Park on the Takaka side of Stoney Creek bridge along SH60. The track immediately north of bridge is a 150m walk to river. Expect dry river conditions throughout summer months.

properties.Title: 6.Lindsays Bridge/Urewhenua Reserve
properties.subtitle: Takaka River
properties.Description: Access point 6 is at the picnic and parking area located on Nelson side of SH60 bridge. There's good fly fishing reach upstream.

properties.Title: 7.Uruwhenua Road
properties.subtitle: Takaka River
properties.Description: Access point 7. From SH60 turn onto Uruwhenua Road (approximately 100m north of #6) and follow road 4km to sign. Good fly-fishing up and downstream.

properties.Title: 8.Blue Hole Picnic Area
properties.subtitle: Takaka River
properties.Description: Access point 8. This beautiful bush setting is located approximately 5.5km from the SH60 turnoff. Follow the gravel track into the grassed reserve where there is ample room for parking. The sign is often missing.

properties.Title: 9.Appletree Flat
properties.subtitle: Takaka River
properties.Description: Access point 9. You will have passed some good reaches of fishing water (eg. below Sams Creek Bridge) before arriving at this small grassy flat located approximately 13.8km from the SH60 turnoff. There is no sign.

properties.Title: 10.Drummonds Flat
properties.subtitle: Takaka River
properties.Description: Access point 10 is at the last picnic area before the powerhouse is approximately 15.8km from SH60 turnoff. Here the riverbed is steeper and river flow more turbulent. There is no sign.

properties.Title: 11.Balck Road
properties.subtitle: Waikoropupu River
properties.Description: Access point 11. Follow SH60 through Takaka and cross Takaka River Bridge. Take first left on Pupu Valley Road. Turn left on Pupu Springs Road cross Waikoropupu Bridge, and take an immediate left and travel 1.5km down Balck Road to Takaka River. From this point access to the lower Waikoropupu River can be gained 700m downstream. No sign.

properties.Title: 12.One Spec Road
properties.subtitle: Anatoki River
properties.Description: Access point 12. Take Long Plain Road (see #3) from SH 60 south of Takaka. Cross the Takaka River and take the first right turn onto One Spec Road. Follow approximately 2km and cross the Anatoki Bridge turning immediately left onto gravel track for 200m before turning left again to car park and river. Sign is often missing.

properties.Title: 13.McCallum Road
properties.subtitle: Anatoki River
properties.Description: Access point 13. Follow Long Plain Road and take a right turn onto McCallum Road. Limited parking 1.3km past Bencarri Farm Park at Culvert #27. Foot track to river 10m downstream of culvert 27 – sign often missing.

properties.Title: 14.McCallum Road
properties.subtitle: Anatoki River
properties.Description: Access point 14. Parking 3.3km past Bencarri Farm Park at culvert #51. Limited parking – sign is often missing.

properties.Title: 15.Waingaro Road
properties.subtitle: Waingaro River
properties.Description: Access point 15. Turn onto Hamama Road from SH 60 south of Paynes Ford and take first right onto Waingaro Road. Park at sign keeping clear of the track. Foot access only along the raceway approximately 600m to river. Text the farm manager on number indicated at sign to inform when you are entering and exiting farm. Leave gates as found.

properties.Title: 16.End of Hamama Road
properties.subtitle: Waingaro River
properties.Description: Access point 16. Permission and directions required from landowner at 560 Hamama Road. The upper reaches are in a steep, isolated gorge and the current is swift.

properties.Title: 17.Cobb Reservoir
properties.subtitle: Cobb Reservoir
properties.Description: Access point 17. The Cobb hydroelectric scheme is located on the Cobb River about 40km (via Cobb Dam Road) from Takaka. Picnic areas and a DOC hut/toilet exist at the top end of the lake.

properties.Title: 1.Collingwood-Puponga Main Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Aorere River
properties.Description: Access point 1 is past Collingwood on the Collingwood-Puponga Road to Aorere Bridge. Park on the left hand (Collingwood) side of the bridge. “Sea run” browns and kahawai are in this reach during the whitebait run.

properties.Title: 2.Swamp Road
properties.subtitle: Aorere River
properties.Description: Access point 2. Ring Lindsay and Carla Nalder for access (03) 524 8309, or 027 5248309. Right turn from SH60 onto Collingwood-Bainham main Road. Turn right down Swamp Road and drive 1.5km, turning right near the road end and park by the gate where indicated. Walk down raceway 1 km to river. This is a negotiated access way across private land, so please respect these requests.

properties.Title: 3.Devils Boots
properties.subtitle: Aorere River
properties.Description: Access point 3. Turn off Collingwood-Bainham Road onto Devils Boots Road and drive 1km past Devils Boots to car park by gate. Walk 100m further on road through gate past sheep yards and woolshed and take style on right. Walk towards river following orange markers and take style over last fence.

properties.Title: 4.Gillies Road
properties.subtitle: Aorere River
properties.Description: Access point 4. Follow Collingwood-Bainham Road and cross Aorere River at Rockville Bridge. Take first left past Aorere Hall on McKay Pass Road. Travel approximately 300m then left turn on Gillies Road 1.1km and park at sign. Best fished during normal-low flows.

properties.Title: 5.James Road
properties.subtitle: Aorere River
properties.Description: Access point 5. Continue over Rockville Bridge and take first left on McKay Pass Road. Take left on James Road. Follow 1km and park at sign, then follow markers to river. Foot access to river upstream of this point. More access 200m further along road, and again at the bridge (park on Western side and walk over bridge).

properties.Title: 6.Aorere Valley Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Aorere River
properties.Description: Access point 6. Follow McKay Pass Road past James Road. At the 'T' intersection, take a left turn onto Aorere Valley road then a left onto Quartz Range Road. Cross over the Aorere River via the Salisbury Bridge and park on left, opposite the sign. Take stile and track to river. Good spin fishing venue off the rocks at the Salisbury Creek confluence. The Aorere is open all year downstream of here.

properties.Title: 7.Fifteen Mile Bridge
properties.subtitle: Aorere River
properties.Description: Access point 7. Follow Aorere Valley Road and cross bridge over 15 Mile Creek. Park on right hand side, and follow creek down to river or walk up road approximately 60m and follow track left off road to riverbed.

properties.Title: 8.Walsh Creek
properties.subtitle: Aorere River
properties.Description: Access point 8 - Follow Aorere Valley Road and park on the left-hand side of the small wooden bridge over Walsh Creek, at the Fish and Game access sign. This is a typical open rock beach with best fishing upstream.

properties.Title: 9.Road End and Start of Heaphy Track
properties.subtitle: Aorere River
properties.Description: Access point 9. Follow the DOC Brown River Walk to gold fossicking beach and river access.OPEN SEASON:1 Oct - 30 AprSIZE LIMIT:Only 1 fish may exceed 500mm FISHING METHODS Fly, SpinDAILY BAG LIMIT:2 sports fish

properties.Title: 1.SH6
properties.subtitle: Buller River-Middle Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 1 is off SH6, 7.8km south of Murchison, or 3km from O’Sullivans Bridge.

properties.Title: 2.Doughboy Stream-Hinehaka Road
properties.subtitle: Buller River
properties.Description: Access point 2. Follow the 'route' markers along the edge of the paddock to the river.

properties.Title: 3.Hinehaka Road
properties.subtitle: Buller River - Middle Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 3 is along Hinehaka Road, 1.4 km from Access No 4. Foot access only, so park by the tree on the road edge away from the shed/gates.

properties.Title: 1.Matakitaki West Bank Road
properties.subtitle: Matakitaki River / Buller River Catchment
properties.Description: Access Point 1 to the lower Matakitaki River, upstream of SH6. This is not sign posted, but plenty of opportunities are available.

properties.Title: 5.Fairfax St Murchison
properties.subtitle: Buller River - Middle Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 5 take the track near the church.

properties.Title: 6.Riverview Holiday Park and Café
properties.subtitle: Buller River - Middle Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 6. Follow the tracks up and down stream from the boat ramp. There is no sign.

properties.Title: 7.SH6
properties.subtitle: Buller River - Middle Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 7 is 2.4km from Murchison along SH6. Follow the road by the truck weighing station 0.8 km to the river. There is no sign.

properties.Title: 8.Owen Domain
properties.subtitle: Buller River - Middle Reaches
