properties.Description: Access Point 8 - Entrance is by the Owen Tavern. Excellent Tasman District Council camping facilities including showers are available here.

properties.Title: 9.Raits Bridge
properties.subtitle: Buller River - Middle Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 9 - Turn off SH6 1.2 km from the Owen Domain. Cross over the stile and stick to riverbed where possible.

properties.Title: 10.Picnic Area
properties.subtitle: Buller River
properties.Description: Access point 10 just follow the road to the river. Limited fishing water here.

properties.Title: 11.SH6
properties.subtitle: Buller River
properties.Description: Access Point 11 is 1.1kms from No.10. Care is required on this busy road - It is not suitable to turn onto if going northbound towards Nelson. Park at the sign and walk through the gate, then follow the grass track to the river.

properties.Title: 12.Gowan Bridge
properties.subtitle: Buller River - Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 12 offers winter fishing downstream of here. Drive across the bridge from SH6 and park on the upstream side, immediately after the bridge. Then cross the road to access the river. Good fishing opportunities upstream and downstream.

properties.Title: 14.Windy Point - SH63
properties.subtitle: Buller River - Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 14 is 1.0km from Kawatiri Junction. Turn down the track to the river, off a sharp bend in SH6.

properties.Title: 15.Harleys Rock Bridge
properties.subtitle: Buller River - Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 15 provides access up and downstream from the east bank

properties.Title: 16.Baigents Public Road
properties.subtitle: Buller River - Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access point 16 is 200m east of Harleys Rock Bridge. Drive down the stream approximately 1.8km to the parking area.

properties.Title: 17.Howard River confluence
properties.subtitle: Buller River - Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 17 is a track on the west bank of the Howard Stream.

properties.Title: 18.Homestead Creek - SH63
properties.subtitle: Buller River - Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 18 - Park where indicated and follow the fence line approximately 800m to the river. Note: This crosses private land, so please shut all the gates.

properties.Title: 19.Speargrass Creek - SH63
properties.subtitle: Buller River - Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 19 is only available after 1st of November. No access down Speargrass Creek. Parking area is 300m east of the Bridge. Follow the fence line approximately 1.2kms to the river.

properties.Title: 20.Upper Buller Bridge
properties.subtitle: Buller River - Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 20 - Parking is on both sides of the bridge. A DOC walking track provides access up the true right bank, upstream of the bridge.

properties.Title: 21.Lake Rotoiti Outlet/Buller River source
properties.subtitle: Buller River - Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 21 - Turn down Mt Robert Road, drive 1.5km to the river and Nelson Lakes National Park camping grounds. There is no sign.

properties.Title: 22.Teetotal Road
properties.subtitle: Buller River - Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 22 - Drive 5.5km along a rough track (ignore the right turning tracks) until you go through a gate and the Teetotal Creek. The Buller River is now within 100m.

properties.Title: 1.Matiri Valley Road
properties.subtitle: Matiri River / Buller catchment
properties.Description: Access point 1 is 8.6km along Matiri Valley Road from SH6.

properties.Title: 2.Lake Matiri Track
properties.subtitle: Matiri River / Buller River Catchment
properties.Description: Access Point 2 - Drive 6km from the bridge along West Bank Road to the DOC car park. 4WD vehicles only or walk from there. No trout in or above Lake Matiri. Be aware of fluctuating flows with hydro generation.

properties.Title: 1.East Owen Road
properties.subtitle: Owen River / Buller River Catchment
properties.Description: Access Point 1 is 200m from SH6. This is a rough track to the river. There is no sign.

properties.Title: 3.Opposite Johnson Creek
properties.subtitle: Owen River / Buller River Catchment
properties.Description: Access Point 3 - Park on the road corner and walk down the track to the river.

properties.Title: 4.Owen River Gorge, Rock Entrance
properties.subtitle: Owen River / Buller River Catchment
properties.Description: Access Point 4 is 5.0km from SH6. Park at the sign and walk past the rock entrance to the river.

properties.Title: 5.Maggie Creek
properties.subtitle: Owen River / Buller River Catchment
properties.Description: Access Point 5 is 7.2km from SH6. Park away from the gate, with walking access only down the track.

properties.Title: 6.Shingle Cliffs
properties.subtitle: Owen River / Buller River Catchment
properties.Description: Access Point 6 is 9.7km from SH6. Park away from the gate, with walking access only down the track.

properties.Title: 7.Brewery Creek
properties.subtitle: Owen River / Buller River Catchment
properties.Description: Access Point 7 - Walk to the the confluence of Brewery Creek to cross the Owen River. To drive further up the valley, first gain permission at the farm house across Brewery Creek bridge.

properties.Title: 1.Gowan Valley Road
properties.subtitle: Gowan River / Buller River Catchment
properties.Description: Access Point 1 is 1.4km from the bridge over the Buller River. Park on the narrow road verge - Please Note: Not suitable parking for campervans.

properties.Title: 2.East Bank Road
properties.subtitle: Gowan River / Buller River Catchment
properties.Description: Access Point 2 - Park at the bridge on the east side away from the gates. This provides legal foot access downstream to the Buller River, and upstream to Lake Rotoroa.

properties.Title: 3.Gowan Valley Road
properties.subtitle: Gowan River / Buller River Catchment
properties.Description: Access point 3 is 1.6km from the East Gowan Bridge turn off.

properties.Title: 4.Fisherman's Cottage
properties.subtitle: Gowan River / Buller River Catchment
properties.Description: Access Point 4 - Park on the narrow road verge (parking here is not suitable for campervans) or use the 4WD access down the rough track to the river.

properties.Title: 5.Gowan River Source Bridge
properties.subtitle: Gowan River / Buller River Catchment
properties.Description: Access Point 5 is along both banks of the river. There's a good walking track downstream on the east bank.

properties.Title: 2.Hotham St
properties.subtitle: Matakitaki River
properties.Description: Access point 2 - Access to the east bank up and downstream. There is no sign.

properties.Title: Lake Argyle Parking
properties.subtitle: Hydro Storage Reservoir
properties.Description: Lake Argyle is popular fishing location for both shore and boat anglers. It is a small man-made hydro storage reservoir about 220m wide, 1300m long and 3.5m deep. Access is excellent with a gravel road following most of the shoreline. It is regularly stocked with hatchery fish (1+ kg), and also has brown trout present. The lower hydro canal (below hydro plant/SH63 is also open all year).

properties.Title: Travis River
properties.subtitle: (Designated Water)
properties.Description: REACH: The Travers River and its tributaries – upstream of Lake Rotoiti.Open Season:1 Oct– 30 AprMETHODS: Fly, SpinBAG LIMIT: 2 troutMIN SIZE: only 1 may exceed 500m)NOTE: Anglers wishing to fish these Designated Waters must first hold a valid Designated Waters Licence in addition to their whole-season Fishing Licence.

properties.Title: Matakitaki River
properties.subtitle: (Designated Water)
properties.Description: Reach: The Matakitaki River and its tributaries – upstream from Horse Terrace BridgeOPEN SEASON: 1 Oct – 30 AprMETHODS: Fly, SpinBAG LIMIT: 2 troutMIN SIZE: Only 1 may exceed 500mNOTE 1: There is private land adjacent to the river in the lower section of the Designated Waters fishery, so normal permission is required by the landowner if access to private land is required.NOTE 2: Anglers wishing to fish these Designated Waters must first hold a valid Designated Waters Licence in addition to their whole-season Fishing Licence.

properties.Title: Upper Wairau
properties.subtitle: (Designated Water)
properties.Description: REACH: The Upper Wairau River and its tributaries (but excluding Fish Lake) upstream from Six Mile Creek (upstream of Rainbow Ski Field bottom carpark).OPEN SEASON: 1 Oct – 30 AprMETHODS: Fly, SpinBAG LIMIT: 2 troutMIN SIZE: Only 1 may exceed 500mNOTE: Anglers wishing to fish these Designated Waters must first hold a valid Designated Waters Licence in addition to their whole-season Fishing Licence.

properties.Title: Lake Argyle
properties.subtitle: Hatchery Release
properties.Description: METHODS: All methodsOPEN: All YearDAILY BAG LIMIT: 2 sportsfishBrown and Rainbow troutRELEASE INFO:Regular releases most months of the year.

properties.Title: Waimea Park family/adult pond
properties.subtitle: Hatchery Release
properties.Description: METHODS: All methodsOPEN: All YearDAILY BAG LIMIT: 1 SportsfishRainbow troutRELEASE INFO:Regular releases most months of the year.

properties.Title: Lake Argyle Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Boat Launching
properties.Description: Concrete boat ramp on Southern side of lake, also possible to launch on gravel Northern side directly opposite.

properties.Title: Lake Rotoiti Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Kerr Bay East
properties.Description: Concrete boat ramp adjacent to the jetty.

properties.Title: Lake Rotoiti Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Kerr Bay West
properties.Description: Concrete ramps adjacent to the jetty. Plenty of parking nearby.

properties.Title: Lake Rotoiti – West Bay
properties.subtitle: Boat launching
properties.Description: Concrete ramp adjacent to the jetty.

properties.Title: Lake Rotoroa
properties.subtitle: Boat Launching
properties.Description: Concrete ramp adjacent to the jetty.

properties.Title: 13.Keystone Picnic Area
properties.subtitle: Buller River - Upper Reaches
properties.Description: Access Point 13 - Park adjacent to the river for good upstream access.

properties.Title: 2.East Owen Road - top of paddocks
properties.subtitle: Owen River / Buller River Catchment
properties.Description: Access Point 2 - Park on the road verge at the top of the paddock. Go through the gate and follow the track markers to the river.

properties.Title: 1.Lake Coleridge Intake
properties.subtitle: Lake Coleridge
properties.Description: Access point 1 is at the Intake (off Mt Algidus Rd). Lake Coleridge is the largest and most heavily fished lake in North Canterbury. It supports one of very few New Zealand populations of landlocked Chinook salmon which are the most common catch in the lake.

properties.Title: 2.Ryton Bay
properties.subtitle: Lake Coleridge
properties.Description: Access point 2 is at Ryton Bay (turn left off Harper Road just before the Ryton River bridge). Lake Coleridge is the largest and most heavily fished lake in North Canterbury. It supports one of very few New Zealand populations of landlocked Chinook salmon which are the most common catch in the lake.

properties.Title: 3.Harper Bay
properties.subtitle: Lake Coleridge
properties.Description: Access point 3 continue up Harper Road after crossing the Ryton Bridge, through the Harper village and turn left after crossing the Harper River). Lake Coleridge is the largest and most heavily fished lake in North Canterbury. It supports one of very few New Zealand populations of landlocked Chinook salmon which are the most common catch in the lake.

properties.Title: Lake Lilian
properties.subtitle: Glenthorne Station
properties.Description: Lake Lilian is accessed through Glenthorne Station. Permission must be obtained from the station to use the road which runs up the Harper Valley from the top of Lake Coleridge. Oncepermission has been obtained, drive up the southern side of the river until reaching the Lilian Stream. Walk up the Lilian Stream for fifteen minutes to reach the lake.

properties.Title: Lake Henrietta
properties.subtitle: Car parking nearby
properties.Description: Lake Henrietta does not receive a lot of angling pressure as it is mostly surrounded with swamp. However careful anglers can be rewarded with good fishing. Small carpark nearby.

properties.Title: Lake Selfe
properties.subtitle: North-West side
properties.Description: The shingle fan on the north western side of Lake Selfe is a popular spot for spin anglers.

properties.Title: Lake Catherine
properties.subtitle: Walking track access
properties.Description: Lake Catherine is also accessed from the same walking track that is used to access Lake Ida. The track follows the Ryton River to the lake. Allow approximately one hour to reach the lake.

properties.Title: Lakes Ida & Little Ida
properties.subtitle: Walking track access
properties.Description: Lakes Ida & Little Ida are accessed by way of a walking track that starts at a car park between Lakes Evelyn and Selfe. The walk takes approximately 30 minutes.

properties.Title: Lake Evelyn
properties.subtitle: Shoreline fishing
properties.Description: Lake Evelyn is accessed off Harper Road. Good shoreline fishing is available on the other side of the lake.

properties.Title: Lake Georgina
properties.subtitle: Shoreline fishing
properties.Description: Lake Georgina is a nice little lake which anglers can walk right around during a fishing session.

properties.Title: Lake Lyndon
properties.subtitle: Various access points
properties.Description: Lake Lyndon can be accessed from Lake Coleridge via the Lyndon (or dry weather) Road or directly off SH73 just over Porters Pass.

properties.Title: Lake Sarah
properties.subtitle: Fly fishing only
properties.Description: Travel approximately 2km past Lake Grasmere on State Highway 73 and turn right onto Craigieburn Road. Lake Sarah is a five minute drive along this road.

properties.Title: Lake Grasmere
properties.subtitle: Lake edge parking
properties.Description: Turn off State Highway 73 into a paddock marked with a F&G access sign on the gate about 3 kilometres west of Lake Pearson. Drive down the track and park at the Lake Grasmere edge.

properties.Title: 1.South End
properties.subtitle: Lake Pearson
properties.Description: A number of small tracks lead off State Highway 73, down to parking areas at the edge of Lake Pearson. Lake Pearson South End has car parking.

properties.Title: 2.Narrows
properties.subtitle: Lake Pearson
properties.Description: Off State Highway 73, down to parking areas at the edge of Lake Pearson. Car parking is at the lakes narrowest point.

properties.Title: 3.Camping
properties.subtitle: Lake Pearson
properties.Description: Off State Highway 73, down to parking areas at the edge of Lake Pearson. Camping grounds and abundant car parking.

properties.Title: Lake Hawdon
properties.subtitle: Walk to the lake
properties.Description: Continue down Craigieburn Road beyond Lake Sarah. Just after crossing the railway line for the fourth time, a track can be seen on the right hand side. Vehicle access is no longer permitted and a fifteen minute walk is required to reach the lake.

properties.Title: Lake Marymere
properties.subtitle: Fly fishing only
properties.Description: Continue along Craigieburn Road past the Lake Hawdon track for 700m and another track will come into view on the right. Once again, vehicle access is no longer permitted and a fifteen minute walk is required to reach Lake Marymere.

properties.Title: Lake Blackwater
properties.subtitle: Flockhill Station
properties.Description: Lake Blackwater lies on Flockhill Station and is a one hour walk from Craigieburn Road. Permission is required for access to this lake.

properties.Title: Lake Letitia
properties.subtitle: Mt White Station Homestead
properties.Description: Cross the Mt White Bridge over the Waimakariri River just past the Cass township, travel downstream on the shingle road for about an hour until reaching Mt White Station Homestead. Lake Letitia is at the end of the road just past the station cookshop.

properties.Title: Lake Sumner
properties.subtitle: Walk to the head of the lake
properties.Description: Unrestricted 4WD road access is available to Loch Katrine, from there foot access is available to the head of Lake Sumner.

properties.Title: Loch Katrine
properties.subtitle: Camping facilities
properties.Description: A settlement of huts at the head of Loch Katrine is the location for many holiday-makers using the area. Camping facilities available.

properties.Title: Lake Mason
properties.subtitle: Lake Taylor Station
properties.Description: Lake Mason and Little Lake Mason lie on Lake Taylor Station. Permission must be gained from the station before driving to the lake. Walking access is available to Lake Mason from Home Bay at Lake Sumner.

properties.Title: Lake Taylor
properties.subtitle: Watercraft friendly
properties.Description: Lake Taylor is a popular fishing and camping spot. The DoC camp is right by the lake for launching watercraft. There are shore tracks both sides of the lake.

properties.Title: Lake Sheppard
properties.subtitle: Lakes Station homestead
properties.Description: Access to Lake Sheppard is over private land through the Lakes Station homestead. Permission must be obtained from the Lakes Station before entering the property.

properties.Title: 1.Manuka Point
properties.subtitle: Rakaia River
properties.Description: Access point 1. Manuka Point is at the top of the Double Hill Run Road just past the turn-off to Glenfalloch Station.

properties.Title: 2.Glenariffe
properties.subtitle: Rakaia River
properties.Description: Access point 2 - Take the gate on the downstream side of the Glenariffe Hatchery gate and then out to the river.

properties.Title: 3.Kowhai Flat
properties.subtitle: Rakaia River
properties.Description: Access point 3 is a sign-posted camping area at Kowhai Flat, which is off Double Hill Run Road, through which angler access is possible.

properties.Title: 4.Whisky Stream
properties.subtitle: Rakaia River
properties.Description: Access point 4 is the first access track to the river above the gorge on the south side, off Double Hill Run Road. The easiest way to find it is by looking out for the bigAcheron slip, which is on the far side of the river, opposite the track.

properties.Title: 5.Gorge Bridge-South Side
properties.subtitle: Rakaia River
properties.Description: Access point 5. Park your vehicle to the left after crossing the Gorge Bridge and its walking access only onto the riverbed.

properties.Title: 6.Lowes Cutting
properties.subtitle: Rakaia River
properties.Description: Access point 6. Take the shingle track to the right (Lowes Cutting) which leaves the Rakaia-Methven Road on a sharp right hand bend, about 26.5km from Rakaia.

properties.Title: 7.Somerton Road
properties.subtitle: Rakaia River
properties.Description: Access point 7 is a continuation of Somerton Road, about 7km from along Rakaia-Methven Road from Rakaia.

properties.Title: 8.McKays Road
properties.subtitle: Rakaia River
properties.Description: Access point 8 is a continuation of McKays Road, about 5km along Rakaia-Methven Road from Rakaia.

properties.Title: 9.Wolseley Road
properties.subtitle: Rakaia River
properties.Description: Access point 9 is a continuation of Wolseley Road, about 3.5km along Rakaia-Methven Road from Rakaia.

properties.Title: 10.Main Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Rakaia River
properties.Description: Access point 10 is a road that is a continuation of the Old Main South Road, about 1km east of Rakaia. This is a popular area for launching jet boats (4WD only) and for foot angler access.

properties.Title: 11.Golf Course
properties.subtitle: Rakaia River
properties.Description: Access point 11 is a track runs along the eastern boundary of the golf course on Acton Road, about 5.6km from Rakaia. Beware of irrigation race as the water level may rise rapidly.

properties.Title: 12.Maginisses
properties.subtitle: Rakaia River
properties.Description: Access point 12 is a track is marked with a Fish & Game Angler Access sign, there are two gates side by side, go through the left gate which leads you out onto the riverbed, about 8.8km down Acton Road from Rakaia.

properties.Title: 13.Griggs Road
properties.subtitle: Rakaia River
properties.Description: Access point 13 is via an unformed shingle road directly opposite Griggs Road, about 11km from Rakaia. Look for the Fish & Game Angler Access sign.

properties.Title: 14.Dobsons Ferry Road
properties.subtitle: Rakaia River
properties.Description: Access point 14. This access road runs off Acton Road approximately 16.2km from Rakaia.

properties.Title: 15.Deer Fence Track
properties.subtitle: Rakaia River
properties.Description: Access point 15. This runs off the road to the huts, right on a 90 degree bend. This track is suitable for four wheel drive vehicles only.

properties.Title: 16.Rivermouth-South Side
properties.subtitle: Rakaia River
properties.Description: Access point 16. Turn left onto the sealed road at the end of Acton Road. The quickest way to reach the river or mouth is to drive around the road on top of the stopbank which surrounds the huts. Beware of driving on the beach as it can be very soft.

properties.Title: 17.Lake Coleridge Power Station
properties.subtitle: Rakaia River
properties.Description: Access point 17. Drive through the Lake Coleridge village and turn left in front of the power station, cross the bridge over the tailrace, turn left at the first opportunity and head out to the river.

properties.Title: 18.Gorge Bridge-North Side
properties.subtitle: Rakaia River
properties.Description: Access point 18. A track leads out to the river a short distance below the Gorge Bridge. This is a popular place for both fishing and launching boats (4WD only).

properties.Title: 19.Sleemans Road
properties.subtitle: Rakaia River
properties.Description: Access point 19. Turn hard left at the end of Rakaia Terrace Road, about 28.7km from Rakaia. Once you drive over the irrigation canal you need to go through the gate in between the pine trees which will have an angler access sign.

properties.Title: 20.Steeles Road
properties.subtitle: Rakaia River
properties.Description: Access point 20 is a continuation of Steeles Road, about 22.3km up Rakaia Terrace Road from Rakaia.

properties.Title: 21.Te Pirita Road
properties.subtitle: Rakaia River
properties.Description: Access point 21 is a well formed shingle road (Te Pirita Road) about 14km up Rakaia Terrace Road from Rakaia.

properties.Title: 22.Darrochs Road
properties.subtitle: Rakaia River
properties.Description: Access point 22 is at the end of Darrochs Road, a formed shingle road signposted about 8.7km up Rakaia Terrace Road from Rakaia.

properties.Title: 23.State Highway 1
properties.subtitle: Rakaia Riiver
properties.Description: Access point 23. This leads out of the picnic area on the north side of the SH1 bridge. This track is often rough and only suited to off-road or 4WD vehicles.

properties.Title: 24.Rakaia Irrigation
properties.subtitle: Rakaia River
properties.Description: Access point 24. This runs off North Rakaia Road a short distance below SH1. Turn left at the end of the track and follow it down and out to the river, crossing two fords on the way. The fords are maintained to a standard suitable for wading, four wheel drive vehicles and motorbikes, as part of an irrigation scheme consent.

properties.Title: 25.Rivermouth-North Side
properties.subtitle: Rakaia River
properties.Description: Access point 25. Good boat launching is available at the North Rakaia Huts boat ramp (a $2 fee is payable into the honesty box) access down the lagoon to the main river can be influenced by river and tide conditions. Land access to the river mouth is by following a track to the left of the boat ramp, around the head of the lagoon and back down to the mouth. ATV is the best option for beach based access.

properties.Title: 1.Rivermouth-North Side
properties.subtitle: Waimakariri River
properties.Description: Access point 1 is at the mouth of the Waimakariri River and can be accessed on the north side through the Kairaki township. Plenty of parking.

properties.Title: 2.McIntosh’s Rocks
properties.subtitle: Waimakariri River
properties.Description: Access point 2 - Take the shingle road (Ferry Road) on the right hand side which departs from the Kaiapoi to Kairaki Road as it sweeps to the left, 2km short of the river mouth. Park at the end of this track and walk over the stop bank to the rocks.

properties.Title: 3.The Banana Hole
properties.subtitle: Waimakariri River
properties.Description: Access point 3 is at the Banana Hole is on the north bank of the Waimakariri a few hundred metres below the old highway bridge. Turn left just over the bridge onto the shingle track which leads out to the river. Follow the track downstream and fish off the rocks at the end.

properties.Title: 4.Rivermouth-South Side
properties.subtitle: Waimakariri River
properties.Description: Access point 4 is where the south side of the mouth can be accessed on motorbike or four wheel drive vehicle through the locked gate at Spencer Park. Keys for this gate and beach permits are available (at a cost) from the Spencer Park Ranger.

properties.Title: 5.Stewarts Gully
properties.subtitle: Waimakariri River
properties.Description: Access point 5 is by the yacht club at Stewarts Gully. This foot access only track starts by the gate which leads to the river.

properties.Title: 6.Old Main North Road-South Side
properties.subtitle: Waimakariri River
properties.Description: Access point 6 heading North on the Old Main North road towards the Old Highway bridge, turn right at Bridge end on to Kaianga Road. Just over the railway line turn left onto the Waimakariri River Regional Park. Access to the river is both left and right at the end of this road. The left access turn also leads out to Otukaikino River andit’s confluence with the Waimakariri River.

properties.Title: 7.North Side (SH1 to Browns Rock)
properties.subtitle: Waimakariri River
properties.Description: Access points 7 to 7e are between SH1 and Browns Rock and provides excellent access to the river. A system of riverside roads and stop-banks run along the north side of the river. This track starts underneath the old highway bridge and runs to Browns Rock, just a few kilometres short of the Gorge.

properties.Title: 7a.Taylors Road
properties.subtitle: Waimakariri River
properties.Description: Access point 7a is between SH1 and Browns Rock at Taylors Road.

properties.Title: 7b.Banyons Brake
properties.subtitle: Waimakariri River
properties.Description: Access point 7b is between SH1 and Browns Rock off Banyons Brake, near Harrs Road.

properties.Title: 7c.Waimak Waterhole
properties.subtitle: Waimakariri River
properties.Description: Access point 7c is between SH1 and Browns Rock at the Waimak Waterhole near the end of Downs Road.

properties.Title: 7d.Poyntz Road
properties.subtitle: Waimakariri River
properties.Description: Access point 7d is between SH1 and Browns Rock at the end of Poinytz Road.

properties.Title: 7e.Dog Trial Road
properties.subtitle: Waimakariri River
properties.Description: Access point 7e is between SH1 and Browns Rock at the end of Dog Trial Road.

properties.Title: 8.Woodstock
properties.subtitle: Waimakariri River
properties.Description: Access point 8 take the Harman Gorge Road, turn left into Woodstock Road until you arrive at the shingle track at the bottom of the cutting near the Woodstock Homestead. Follow the signs out to the river. This is a popular boat launching spot which also provides access for foot anglers.

properties.Title: 9.SH1 to McLeans Island
properties.subtitle: Waimakariri River
properties.Description: Access point 9 is off State Highway 1, from the top from McLeans Island Road, or from Dickeys Road at the bottom, onto Coutts Island Road. Good access is available from the stop-bank running along this stretch of river.

properties.Title: 9a.Lorraine Road
properties.subtitle: Waimakariri River
properties.Description: Access point 9a is off State Highway 1, from the top from McLeans Island Road or from Dickeys Road at the bottom, off Coutts Island Road, on to the end of Lorimas Road. Good access is available from the stop-bank running along this stretch of river

properties.Title: 9b.Coutts Road
properties.subtitle: Waimakariri River
properties.Description: Access point 9b is off State Highway 1, from the top from McLeans Island Road or from Dickeys Road at the bottom, turn into Haul Road from Coutts Island Road and park at the end. Good access is available from the stop-bank running along this stretch of river.

properties.Title: 10.Weedons Ross Road
properties.subtitle: Waimakariri River
properties.Description: Access 10 is down at the end of Weedons Ross Road, which runs off the Old West Coast Road.

properties.Title: 11.Thompsons Road
properties.subtitle: Waimakariri River
properties.Description: Access 11 is down Thompsons Road, which runs off the Old West Coast Road. Motor caravan site nearby.

properties.Title: 12.Intake Road
properties.subtitle: Waimakariri River
properties.Description: Access point 12 is down Intake Road, which runs off the Old West Coast Road with plenty of parking and access options.

properties.Title: 13.Courtenay Road
properties.subtitle: Waimakariri River
properties.Description: Access point 13 is down Courtenay Road, which runs off the Old West Coast Road.

properties.Title: 14.Cooks Road
properties.subtitle: Waimakariri River
properties.Description: Access point 14 is s off the Old West Coast Road turn down Cooks Road, which runs to the river. Look for the Fish & Game access sign.

properties.Title: 15.Bleak House Road
properties.subtitle: Waimakariri River
properties.Description: Access point 15 is at the intersection of the Old West Coast Road and Kimberley Road. Turn down Bleak House Road which runs to the river.

properties.Title: 16.Gorge Bridge-South Side
properties.subtitle: Waimakariri River
properties.Description: Access point 16 is on State Highway 72 at the Waimakariri Gorge Bridge (Waddington to Oxford). A shingle track leads down the terrace and out onto the riverbed. This is a popular boat launching spot.

properties.Title: 17.Keens Road
properties.subtitle: Waimakariri River
properties.Description: Access point 17 is off Keens Road (near Springfield) leads to Kowai River which can be followed downstream to the confluence with the Waimakariri. This area is known locally as Cabbage Tree Flat.

properties.Title: 18.Mt White Bridge
properties.subtitle: Waimakariri River
properties.Description: Access point 18 is off State Highway 72, turn right into a shingle track just before you reach the Waimakariri. This track leads down the terrace to the Mt White Bridge.

properties.Title: 19.The Porter River
properties.subtitle: Porter River
properties.Description: Access point 19 is off State Highway 72, where the Porter River is crossed just prior to the Castle Hill Village. It runs through private property (Castle Hill Station). The Porter can be fished both upstream and downstream of SH73.

properties.Title: 20.Broken River
properties.subtitle: Broken River
properties.Description: Access point 20 is off State Highway 73, where access to the upper reaches can be obtained with permission of Castle Hill Station. The lower reaches can be accessed by following the Lake Sarah/Hawdon/Marymere Road (off SH73) beyond those lakesto its end.

properties.Title: 21.Winding Creek
properties.subtitle: Flock Station Lodge
properties.Description: Access point 21 is off State Highway 73 by foot access available from the Flock Hill Station Lodge. Anglers should ring the Lodge for details (03 318 8196).

properties.Title: 1.Waikuku Beach township
properties.subtitle: Ashley River
properties.Description: Access point 1 is through the Waikuku Beach township either Kings Ave or Collins Drive. The Ashley River is typical of many small to medium sized Canterbury rivers in that it gets very low during summer months. The fishing is best between October and December in the lower reaches.

properties.Title: 2.SH1 Bridge
properties.subtitle: Ashley River / Rakahuri
properties.Description: Access point 2 is at the SH1 Bridge. The Ashley River is typical of many small to medium sized Canterbury rivers in that it gets very low during summer months. The fishing is best between October and December in the lower reaches.

properties.Title: 3.Bridge north of Rangiora
properties.subtitle: Ashley River / Rakahuri
properties.Description: Access point 3 is at the bridge immediately north of Rangiora either Rossiters Road on the north side or The Ashley Picnic Ground on the south. The Ashley River is typical of many small to medium sized Canterbury rivers in that it gets very low during summer months. The fishing is best between October and December in the lower reaches.

properties.Title: 4.Rangiora-Cust Road
properties.subtitle: Cust River
properties.Description: Access point 4 is accessed off the Rangiora-Cust Road at Swamp Road bridge, among various other access points. The Cust River offers good brown trout fishing in spring when flows are good. Most of the Cust River lies on private land, so please check with landowners before you start fishing.

properties.Title: 5.Ohoka-Rangiora Road
properties.subtitle: Cust River
properties.Description: Access point 5 is accessed off the Ohoka-Rangiora Road. This river offers good brown trout fishing in spring when flows are good. Most of the Cust River lies on private land, so please check with landowners before you start fishing.

properties.Title: 7.Bramleys Road
properties.subtitle: Cam River / Ruataniwha
properties.Description: Access point 7 is at the Tuahiwi end of Bramleys Road, from Youngs Road which leads off Lineside Road between Kaiapoi and Rangiora. The Cam River supports reasonable populations of brown trout in the one to four pound size range.

properties.Title: 8.Lower Camside Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Cam River
properties.Description: Access point 8 is from the Lower Camside Road bridge on the north-western side of Kaiapoi. The Cam River supports reasonable populations of brown trout in the one to four pound size range.

properties.Title: 9.Spencerville Road
properties.subtitle: Styx River
properties.Description: Access point 9 is on Spencerville Road at the bridge over the Styx River, which is another small stream, and fishes best in spring and autumn, especially at dusk.

properties.Title: 10.Lower Styx Road
properties.subtitle: Styx River
properties.Description: Access point 10 is on Lower Styx Road with various access opportuinities. The Styx River which is another small stream and fishes best in spring and autumn, especially at dusk.

properties.Title: 11.Kainga Road
properties.subtitle: Styx River
properties.Description: Access point 11 is on the Styx River which is another small stream and fishes best in spring and autumn, especially at dusk. The best access sites are off Spencerville Road, Lower Styx Road and Kainga Road.

properties.Title: 13.Hall Street boat ramp
properties.subtitle: Kaiapoi River
properties.Description: Access point 13 is at the Hall Street boat ramp. The Kaiapoi River experiences good runs of salmon and is one of the only places in New Zealand where Chinook salmon are regularly caught on bait with freshwater shrimps and pilchards being most popular. The best fishing is between SH1 and the confluence with the Waimakariri.

properties.Title: 14.Smith Street
properties.subtitle: Kaiapoi River
properties.Description: Access point 14 is at Smith Street. The Kaiapoi River experiences good runs of salmon and is one of the only places in New Zealand where Chinook salmon are regularly caught on bait with freshwater shrimps and pilchards being most popular. The best fishing is between SH1 and the confluence with the Waimakariri.

properties.Title: 15.Silverstream
properties.subtitle: Kaiapoi River
properties.Description: Access point 15 is to the upper Kaiapoi (or Silverstream) which offers good spring creek fishing for trout. Check with local landowners before fishing this part of the river because much of it lies on private land.

properties.Title: 16.Dickeys Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Otukaikino River / South Branch
properties.Description: Access point 16 is at Dickeys Road Bridge (turn left off SH1 just before leaving Belfast and travel a short distance down Dickeys Road). This delightful spring creek contains good populations of smaller trout and is a very popular “after work” fishery. It also hosts good runs of larger spawning trout in autumn.

properties.Title: 17.Groynes Park
properties.subtitle: Otukaikino River / South Branch
properties.Description: Access point 17 through the Groynes Park (off Johns Road between the Airport and Belfast). This delightful spring creek contains good populations of smaller trout and is a very popular “after work” fishery. It also hosts good runs of larger spawning trout in autumn.

properties.Title: 18.Avon River
properties.subtitle: Avon River
properties.Description: Access point 18. Despite this river flowing through a major city, it is a good junior fishery. Access is very good along this river. Please check the current regulations for closed areas and dates.

properties.Title: 19.Heathcote River
properties.subtitle: Heathcote River
properties.Description: Access point 19. Despite this river flowing through a major city, it is a good junior fishery. Access is very good along this river. Please check the current regulations for closed areas and dates.

properties.Title: 20.Little River Hotel
properties.subtitle: Okana River
properties.Description: Access point 20 to the Okana River is via the Little River Hotel. This river contains populations of brown trout and can provide good fishing, especially in spring. Public access is available to the lower reaches of the Okana through the gate on the right hand side of the road opposite the Little River Hotel.

properties.Title: 21.Akaroa Highway
properties.subtitle: Lake Forsyth
properties.Description: Access point 21 - Where the Akaroa Highway first comes close to the lake, just after the Birdlings Flat turn-off, is one of the best places. Lake Forsyth fishes best in spring, especially if the lake has recently been opened to the sea.

properties.Title: 22.Akaroa Highway
properties.subtitle: Kaituna River
properties.Description: Access point 22 is directly off the Akaroa Highway. This area just above the confluence with Lake Ellesmere offers the best fishing, particularly during spring.

properties.Title: 23.Seabridge Road
properties.subtitle: Halswell River
properties.Description: Access point 23 to the rivermouth can be had from where the river intersects with Seabridge Road, down either bank, just south of Motukarara. The Halswell River meanders from near the Halswell township down to Lake Ellesmere. It crosses many public and private properties and flows beneath several bridges.

properties.Title: 24.Taumutu/Gullivers Road
properties.subtitle: Lake Ellesmere
properties.Description: Access point 24. Take the access track which leads off Gullivers Road and out onto the beach. The tributaries of Lake Ellesmere fish better than the lake itself, however, good fishing for sea run trout can occur at Taumutu when the lake is open to the sea.

properties.Title: 25.Wolfes Road
properties.subtitle: LII River
properties.Description: Access point 25 can be had at Wolfes Road (follow the road to a sharp bend next to the river). The LII fishes best during spring and early summer, particularly in the reach just above the lake on a dark night.

properties.Title: 26.Selwyn Huts Road
properties.subtitle: LII River
properties.Description: Access 26 is off the main road to the Selwyn Huts (Day Road). The LII fishes best during spring and early summer, particularly in the reach just above the lake on a dark night.

properties.Title: 27.Upper Selwyn Huts
properties.subtitle: Selwyn River
properties.Description: Access Point 27. This river contains good numbers of brown trout in the lower reaches but is often dry in the middle reaches. Access is good from the Upper Selwyn Huts to the mouth. Above the Upper Huts the Selwyn changes to a delightful meandering stream of pools and riffles. Coes Ford is the most popular access point to this part of the river.

properties.Title: 28.Coes Ford
properties.subtitle: Selwyn River
properties.Description: Access Point 28 - This access point offers great a camping opportunity and can provide good fishing, but again is subject to low flows.

properties.Title: 29.Aitkens Road
properties.subtitle: Irwell River
properties.Description: Access Point 29 - This river can provide good fishing but, again, is subject to low flows. Cross Coes Ford and follow Lake Road until it crosses the river, just after the Lake Road/ Lake Road South intersection. Take the first road on the left after the bridge (heading south - Hanmer Road), cross a wooden bridge and turn left into Aitkens Rd. This road leads out to the river.

properties.Title: 30.Timber Yard Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Harts Creek
properties.Description: Access Point 30 - Harts Creek is a good fly fishing stream, especially towards the mouth. To get to Harts Creek follow Lake Road to its intersection with Timber Yard Road (heading south). Turn left down the latter and turn left again onto a small bridge not far from the corner. Fishing at the mouth is good after dark but the river between the car park and the mouth can offer good fly fishing during daylight hours.

properties.Title: 12.SH1 Waimakariri confluence
properties.subtitle: Kaiapoi River
properties.Description: The Kaiapoi River experiences good runs of salmon and is one of the only places in New Zealand where Chinook salmon are regularly caught on bait; -freshwater shrimps and pilchards being most popular. The best fishing is between SH1 and the confluence with the Waimakariri. Access is available at the Hall Street boat ramp and from Smith Street, both within the township of Kaiapoi. The upper Kaiapoi (or Silverstream) offers good spring creek fishing for trout. Check with local landowners before fishing this part of the river because much of it lies on private land.

properties.Title: 1.Nina River
properties.subtitle: Designated Waters
properties.Description: Access Point 1 to the Nina River designated waters is situated off SH7 and offers good brown trout fishing in clear water, providing good sight fishing opportunities for fly anglers that want a back country experience. Angler etiquette is very important, as this fishery is very sensitive, so please respect other anglers and leave your intentions.

properties.Title: 2.Lewis River
properties.subtitle: Designated Waters
properties.Description: Access Point 2 to the Lewis River designated waters is situated off SH7 and offers good brown trout fishing in clear water providing good sight fishing opportunities for fly anglers that want a back country experience. Angler etiquette is very important, as this fishery is very sensitive, so please respect other anglers and leave your intentions.

properties.Title: 3.Lewis River
properties.subtitle: Designated Waters
properties.Description: Access Point 3 to the Lewis River designated waters is situated off SH7 and offers good brown trout fishing in clear water providing good sight fishing opportunities for fly anglers that want a back country experience. Angler etiquette is very important, as this fishery is very sensitive, so please respect other anglers and leave your intentions.

properties.Title: 4.Boyle River
properties.subtitle: Designated Water
properties.Description: Access Point 4 to the Boyle River designated waters is situated off SH7 and offers good brown trout fishing in clear water providing good sight fishing opportunities for fly anglers that want a back country experience. Angler etiquette is very important, as this fishery is very sensitive, so please respect other anglers and leave your intentions.

properties.Title: 5.Boyle River
properties.subtitle: Designated Water
properties.Description: Access Point 5 to the Boyle River designated waters is situated off SH7 and offers good brown trout fishing in clear water providing good sight fishing opportunities for fly anglers that want a back country experience. Angler etiquette is very important, as this fishery is very sensitive, so please respect other anglers and leave your intentions.

properties.Title: 6.Boyle/Doubtful Confluence
properties.subtitle: Designated Waters
properties.Description: Access Point 6 to the Boyle/Doubtful Confluence designated waters is situated off SH7 and offers good brown trout fishing in clear water providing good sight fishing opportunities for fly anglers that want a back country experience. Angler etiquette is very important, as this fishery is very sensitive, so please respect other anglers and leave your intentions.

properties.Title: 7.Windy Point
properties.subtitle: Designated Water
properties.Description: Access Point 7. Windy Point provides foot access to the Hope and Boyle Rivers designated waters and offers good brown trout fishing in clear water, providing good sight fishing opportunities for fly anglers that want a backcountry experience. Angler etiquette is very important, as this fishery is very sensitive, so please respect other anglers and leave your intentions.

properties.Title: 8.Hope River
properties.subtitle: Designated Water
properties.Description: Access Point 8 to the Hope River designated waters is situated off SH7 and offers good brown trout fishing in clear water, providing good sight fishing opportunities for fly anglers that want a back country experience. Angler etiquette is very important, as this fishery is very sensitive, so please respect other anglers and leave your intentions.

properties.Title: 9.Malings Pass
properties.subtitle: Designated Water
properties.Description: 'Access Point 9 to Malings Pass is the most upstream point for access into the Upper Waiau River designated waters. This river also offers good brown and rainbow trout fishing in clear water providing good sight fishing opportunities for fly anglers that want a back country experience. Angler etiquette is very important as this fishery is very sensitiveso please respect other anglers and leave your intentions. For 4WD access, please refer to the DOC website for St James vehicle access.

properties.Title: 11.Edwards Valley
properties.subtitle: Designated Water
properties.Description: Access Point 11. The Edwards Valley offers access into the Upper Waiau River designated waters. This river offers good brown and rainbow trout fishing in clear water providing good sight fishing opportunities for fly anglers that want a back country experience. Angler etiquette is very important, as this fishery is very sensititve, so please respect other anglers and leave your intentions. For 4WD access, please refer to the DOC website for St James vehicle access.

properties.Title: 12.Upper Waiau River
properties.subtitle: Designated Water
properties.Description: Access Point 12 to the Upper Waiau River designated waters starts upstream from the Hope River confluence and includes all tributaries, except Lake Guyon.

properties.Title: 13.Lewis Pass Fishery
properties.subtitle: Designated Water
properties.Description: Access Point 13 to the Lewis Pass Fishery designated waters starts upstream from the Hope River bridge on SH7 and this includes all tributaries upstream from this point.

properties.Title: 14.Hurunui River North Branch
properties.subtitle: Designated Water
properties.Description: Access Point 14 to the North Branch of the Hurunui River designated waters, is by either driving to a carpark at the top end of Loch Katrine and from this point it's walking access only via a marked track, or boating from Loch Katrine into Lake Sumner and walking up river from the lake shore. This river offers good brown trout fishing in clear water providing good sight fishing opportunities for fly anglers that want a backcountry experience. Angler etiquette is very important, as this fishery is very sensitive, so please respect other anglers and leave your intentions.

properties.Title: 15.Hurunui River North Signposted
properties.subtitle: Designated Water
properties.Description: Access Point 15 to the North Branch of the Hurunui River designated waters starts approximately 500m upstream from Lake Sumner, which is marked with Fish & Game signage on the true right of the river.

properties.Title: 16.Hurunui River / South Branch
properties.subtitle: Designated Water
properties.Description: Access Point 16 to the Hurunui River South Branch designated waters fishery is by permission through Esk Head or Lake Taylor Stations. Both stations are accessed from Lake Sumner Road.

properties.Title: 17.Hurunui River / South Branch
properties.subtitle: Designated Water
properties.Description: Access Point 17 to the Hurunui River South Branch designated waters starts upstream of the confluence with the North Esk River.

properties.Title: 10.Fowlers Pass carpark
properties.subtitle: Lake Guyon
properties.Description: Access Point 10 to Lake Guyon is by parking at the Fowlers Pass carpark off Tophouse Road and either hiking, mountain biking, or horse riding along the DOC track. This lake offers good brown and rainbow trout fishing. You can also access the Upper Waiau River via Lake Guyon.

properties.Title: 1.Ferry Bridge
properties.subtitle: Waiau River
properties.Description: Access Point 1 - This access point is off State Highway 7A. Once you drive over the Hamner River there is a track on your left marked with a Fish & Game Access sign. From here you will follow the track which goes down the Hanmer River and you will end up at the Waiau River upstream of the Ferry Bridge. This is also a popular spot to launch your jet boat.

properties.Title: 2.Leslie Hills Bridge
properties.subtitle: Waiau River
properties.Description: NOTE: A salmon licence is required if you wish to fish for sea-run salmon. (This apples to all access points below the Hope River confluence).There is an additional $5.00 for a salmon licence.

properties.Title: 3.Waiau Township
properties.subtitle: Waiau River
properties.Description: Access Point 3 - This access point is situated off route 70 and it provides vehicle access out onto the riverbed.

properties.Title: 4.Lemington Road
properties.subtitle: Waiau River
properties.Description: Access Point 4 - This access point is reached by turning off State Highway 1 into Spotswood and travelling down Waiau West Road, until you reach Lemington Road, and from here you will turn right and follow this until the end of the road.From here you can travel up and down the riverbed.

properties.Title: 5.SH1 Bridge
properties.subtitle: Waiau River
properties.Description: 'Access Point 5 - This access point is situated just before the State Highway 1 Bridge if you are heading north on the right hand side. This point also provides jet boat launching and the only way to access the river mouth is by jet boat or getting landowner permission to go through private property.

properties.Title: 2.Jollie Brook Swingbridge
properties.subtitle: Hurunui River
properties.Description: Access Point 2 - This access point is off the Lake Sumner Road where there is a public carpark. From here you can cross the river via the swingbridge, which is located close to the carpark.

properties.Title: 3.South Branch Confluence
properties.subtitle: Hurunui River
properties.Description: Access Point 3 - This access point is situated off the Lake Sumner Road and there is a vehicle track marked with a Fish & Game Angler Access sign which leads you down to the confluence.

properties.Title: 4.South Branch
properties.subtitle: Hurunui River
properties.Description: Access Point 4 - At this point, please go over the bridge and park safely well off the road. From here you can walk either upstream or downstream.

properties.Title: 5.Balmoral Bridge
properties.subtitle: Hurunui River
properties.Description: Access Point 5 - The river can be accessed from SH7 on both sides of the Balmoral Bridge, in which either side are signposted with an Fish & Game Angler Access sign.

properties.Title: 6.SH1 Bridge
properties.subtitle: Hurunui River
properties.Description: Access Point 6 - The river can be accessed easily off SH1 via a vehicle track next to the public toilet.

properties.Title: 7.Mouth-South Side
properties.subtitle: Hurunui River
properties.Description: Access Point 7 - The south side of the rivermouth is accessed via the road to Nape Nape, once you reach the coastline it is either walking or 4 wheel motorbike access to the rivermouth.

properties.Title: 8.Mouth-North Side
properties.subtitle: Hurunui River
properties.Description: Access Point 8 - Take the first road to the right while heading north out of the small town of Domett on SH1 and follow this road until you reach the coastline. This access point is best suited for either walking or boat anglers if you wish to access the rivermouth. Camping is also available.

properties.Title: 1.Lake Roto Kohatu
properties.subtitle: Christchurch Area
properties.Description: Access point 1 - These lakes are situated at the end of Sawyers Arms Road, near the Christchurch Airport and the lakes hold both salmon and brown trout.

properties.Title: 2.Hydra Waters
properties.subtitle: Hydra Waters
properties.Description: Access point 2 - The easiest way to access this stream is to drive up Double Hill Run Road and then turn right at Double Hill where there is an easement which takes you out onto the Rakaia River and from here the best way is to walk across the Rakaia River.

properties.Title: 3.Goat Hill Stream
properties.subtitle: Goat Hill Stream
properties.Description: Access point 3 - To access this stream it is best to drive up Algidus Road and once you get to the Wilberforce River, you will then need to walk upstream. Then you can start fishing from the confluence upstream.

properties.Title: 4.Wilberforce Diversion
properties.subtitle: Wilberforce Diversion
properties.Description: Access point 4 - This canal flows into the top of Lake Coleridge and provides easy access for anglers, but this canal can fluctuate in flow, depending how much water they divert into it from the Wilberforce River.

properties.Title: 5.Harper River
properties.subtitle: Harper River
properties.Description: Access point 5 - The Harper River is one of the major spawning streams for Lake Coleridge and has some small spring creek tributaries which also hold trout. There Is a carrpark off the Harper Road and from here there is walking access up the riverbed.

properties.Title: 6.Avoca River
properties.subtitle: Harper River Tributary
properties.Description: Access point 6 - The Avoca River is a tributary of the Harper River and in regarding access it is the same as the Harper River and that is by parking your vehicle at the carpark off the Harper Road and walking up the Harper River.

properties.Title: 7.Ryton River
properties.subtitle: Lake Coleridge Tributary
properties.Description: Access point 7 - This is another spawning stream which feeds into Lake Coleridge and can be accessed off the Harper Road near the road bridge, this stream also provides some technical fishing in the upper reaches.

properties.Title: 8.Cora Lynn Stream
properties.subtitle: Waimakariri River Feeder
properties.Description: Access point 8 - This is a spring fed stream which runs into the Waimakariri River and is situated off SH73 and to access this stream there are a couple of pull over bays off the road where you can park and cross the road to access the stream.

properties.Title: 9.Poulter River
properties.subtitle: Poulter River
properties.Description: Access point 9 - To access the Poulter River you will need to turn off SH73 onto MT White Road and travel along this road until you reach the carpark, which is just before the Poulter River Bridge.

properties.Title: 10.Esk River
properties.subtitle: Esk River
properties.Description: Access point 10 - This river is another major tributary of the Waimakariri River and is situated next to the Poulter River. To access this steam you must either get permission from Mt White Station or you can walk up from the confluence of the Waimakariri River.

properties.Title: 11.Ashley Gorge
properties.subtitle: Ashley [Rakahuri] River
properties.Description: Access point 11 - This is accessed off the Ashley Gorge Road at the campground which is situated about 1 hour out of Christchurch and this river system is predominantly a brown trout fishery.

properties.Title: 12.Ashley Middle Bridge
properties.subtitle: Ashley [Rakahuri] River
properties.Description: Access point 12 is off Lees Valley Road and once you cross the bridge, there's a vehicle track on your right which leads you down to the river and from here you can fish either upstream or downstream.

properties.Title: 13.Upper Ashley River
properties.subtitle: Ashley [Rakahuri] River
properties.Description: Access point 13 is situated further along Lees Valley Road where you can park on either side of the bridge. From there you can either fish up or down stream of the bridge.

properties.Title: 14.Ashley Upper Gorge Bridge
properties.subtitle: Ashley [Rakahuri] River
properties.Description: Access point 14 is situated at the start of Lees Valley itself. As soon as you descend from out of the gorge and cross the river, there is plenty of parking across the bridge. From here, you can either fish up or down stream of the bridge.

properties.Title: 15.Sea-run Salmon Limit
properties.subtitle: Waimakariri River
properties.Description: This marks the Waimakariri River sea-run salmon upper fishing limit.

properties.Title: 18.Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Waimakariri River
properties.Description: Access Point 18 - Off SH1, near Greigs Road, park near the bridge with easy boat launching access to the Waimakariri River

properties.Title: 19.Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Rakaia River
properties.Description: Access Point 19 - At the end of Pacific Drive, park near the boat ramp with easy boat launching access to the Rakaia River [Lagoon]. Please Note: Boat Ramp Fees Apply.

properties.Title: 1.Mawheraiti Bridge
properties.subtitle: Little Grey River
properties.Description: Access point 1 is off State Highway 7 at the in Mawheraiti Bridge and offers access to the Little Grey River. Turn off is sign posted with an angler access sign, followed by a short drive down to the river's edge.

properties.Title: 2.Mirfin's Bridge
properties.subtitle: Little Grey River
properties.Description: Access Point 3 is at the West end of Mirfin's Bridge, at the Mirfin Road and Atarua Road junction.

properties.Title: 5.Waipuna Road
properties.subtitle: Grey River
properties.Description: Access point 5 turn off Waipuna Road [Access sign posted] and follow the track to the car park.

properties.Title: 6.Waipuna Creek
properties.subtitle: Grey River
properties.Description: Access point 6 is off Waipuna Road next to the Waipuna Creek Bridge. It's recommended to park at the sign at the angler access sign and walk down the creek 400m to the Grey River.

properties.Title: 7.Waipuna Road
properties.subtitle: Grey River
properties.Description: Access point 7 - to the Grey River, immediately above the SH7 Bridge. Turn left 500m up Waipuna Road and park safely.

properties.Title: 9.Granville Road West
properties.subtitle: Grey River
properties.Description: Access point 9 is off Ikamatua Highway [SH7], turn down Granville Road West to the end and park.

properties.Title: 10.Atarau Road
properties.subtitle: Grey River
properties.Description: Access point 10 - Park by the Atarau Road Bridge, near Craigieburn Road. Access is either side of the bridge.

properties.Title: 11.Alcon Road
properties.subtitle: Grey River
properties.Description: Access point 11 is off Ikamatua Highway [SH7], turn down Alcon Road, marked by an angler access sign, drive to the end and park.

properties.Title: 12.Matai Road
properties.subtitle: Grey River
properties.Description: Access point 12 is off State Highway 7, down Matai Road. An access sign marks the turn off from Matai Road. Would not recommend driving beyond the stockbank as the track becomes muddy through the willows.

properties.Title: 13.Blackball
properties.subtitle: Grey River
properties.Description: Access point 13 is off Atarau Road, just south of the Blackball township. The turnoff is access sign posted, so travel to the end and park next to the Blackball Creek.

properties.Title: 14.Dredge Road
properties.subtitle: Grey River
properties.Description: Access point 14 is off State Highway 7, then take the Dredge Road, sign number 2, that takes you down to the river. Access sign posted.

properties.Title: 15.Ruby Creek
properties.subtitle: Grey River
properties.Description: Access point 15 is off the Taylorville-Blackball Road where there is a carpark next to Ruby Creek with access to the Grey river.

properties.Title: 16.Arnold Confluence
properties.subtitle: Grey River
properties.Description: Access point 16 is off the Taylorville-Blackball Road down a short gravel track onto the river bed giving you access to the Grey River and Arnold River confluence.

properties.Title: 17.Kiwi Point
properties.subtitle: Grey River
properties.Description: Access point 17 is off SH7 down a short road to Kiwi Point marked with an angler access sign.

properties.Title: 18.Taylorville Township
properties.subtitle: Grey River
properties.Description: Access point 18 is in Taylorville township. Turn off Taylorville Road into Taylor Road, follow signpost to the end and park safely.

properties.Title: 19.Golf Links Road
properties.subtitle: Grey River
properties.Description: Access point 19 - Turn off SH7 onto Golf Road and follow the access sign. Park safely at the end of the road.

properties.Title: 20.Water Treatment plant
properties.subtitle: Grey River
properties.Description: Access point 20 is off Taylorville Road at the Water treatment building. Only foot access down to the river.

properties.Title: 21.Taylorville Road
properties.subtitle: Grey River
properties.Description: Access point 21 is off Taylorville Road down a farm track. Please leave gates as you find them.

properties.Title: 22.Side Road
properties.subtitle: Grey River
properties.Description: Access point 22 is off Taylorville Road down Sids Road to the end.

properties.Title: 23.Railway Bridge
properties.subtitle: Grey River
properties.Description: Access point 23 is off SH7 to the Grey River, under the Railway Bridge and on to the gravel extraction area upstream.

properties.Title: 24.Cobden Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Grey River
properties.Description: Access point 24 is to the Cobden Boat Ramp, accessed via Bright St and then Weld St.

properties.Title: 25.Mawhera Quay
properties.subtitle: Grey River
properties.Description: Access point 25 is off Mawhera Quay which offers 1km of access to the Grey River.

properties.Title: 26.Short Street
properties.subtitle: Grey River
properties.Description: Access point 26 is off Preston Road, down Charles O'Connor Street, onto Short Street for access to the Grey River Lagoon.

properties.Title: 27.Preston Road
properties.subtitle: Grey River
properties.Description: Access point 27 is off Preston Road Bridge over Sawyers Creek, giving access to the the lower Sawyers Creek and its confluence with the Grey River Lagoon.

properties.Title: 28.Blaketown Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Grey River
properties.Description: Access point 28 is the Blaketown boat ramp and 600m of access to the Grey River lagoon. Access from the unnamed road is Steer Ave, or Packers Quay.

properties.Title: 29.Southern Breakwater Road
properties.subtitle: Grey River
properties.Description: Access point 29 is off Southern Breakwater Road which offers about 1km of access to the lower Grey River.

properties.Title: 30.North Tip Road
properties.subtitle: Grey River
properties.Description: Access point 30 is off North Tip Road, giving access to the lower Grey River on the North side.

properties.Title: 1.Campsite
properties.subtitle: Kohaihai River
properties.Description: Access point 1 is at the end of Kohaihai Road SH67, at the DoC campsite.

properties.Title: 1.Leslie–Karamea Track
properties.subtitle: Karamea River
properties.Description: Access point 1 is from the Flora car park at the end of Graham Valley South Branch Road, which offers access to the middle and upper reaches of the Karamea River via the Leslie–Karamea tramping track.

properties.Title: 2.Umere Road
properties.subtitle: Karamea River
properties.Description: Access point 2 is off Umere Road. Drive 8.5km up Umere Road until you arrive at the Fish & Game sign. Park there and go through a small patch off bush to the rivers edge.

properties.Title: 3.Arapito Road End
properties.subtitle: Karamea River
properties.Description: Access point 3 on Arapito Road at the end of the public road. Sign posted with a Fish & Game sign.

properties.Title: 4.Arapito Road
properties.subtitle: Karamea River
properties.Description: Access point 4 is on Arapito Road on a sharp corner sign posted with a Fish & Game angler access sign.

properties.Title: 5.Arapito Road Gravel Site
properties.subtitle: Karamea River
properties.Description: Access point 5 is on Arapito Road where gravel is extracted, sign posted with a Fish & Game angler access sign.

properties.Title: 6.Karamea Bridge
properties.subtitle: Karamea River
properties.Description: Access point 6 is the SH67 Karamea River Bridge. Best access is on the North Side of the bridge.

properties.Title: 7.Wharf Road
properties.subtitle: Karamea River
properties.Description: Access point 7 is off the end of Wharf Road, providing access to the lower reaches of the Karamea River.

properties.Title: 8.Karamea Estuary Walk Car Park
properties.subtitle: Karamea River
properties.Description: Access point 8 is at the end of Ray Street, providing access to the lower reaches of the Karamea River.

properties.Title: 9.Flagstaff Road
properties.subtitle: Karamea River
properties.Description: Access point 9 is off Flagstaff Road, providing access to the lower reaches of the Karamea River.

properties.Title: 10.Karamea Holiday Park
properties.subtitle: Karamea River
properties.Description: Access Point 10 is via Karamea Holiday Park, from Maori Point Road, providing access to the lower reaches of the Karamea River on the South Side.

properties.Title: 1.Little Wanganui River Bridge
properties.subtitle: Little Wanganui River
properties.Description: Access point 1 is off the SH67 Little Wanganui River Bridge. The best access is on the south side.

properties.Title: 2.Glasseye Road
properties.subtitle: Little Wanganui River
properties.Description: Access Point 2 is off SH67, turn onto Glasseye Road and drive 2.8km to the boat ramp to find access to the lower reaches on the true left side of the Little Wanganui River.

properties.Title: 3.Wharf Road
properties.subtitle: Little Wanganui River
properties.Description: Access Point 3 is off SH67, turn onto Wharf Road and drive to the roads end.

properties.Title: 1.End of Mokihinui Road
properties.subtitle: Mokihinui River
properties.Description: Access Point 1 - Turn off SH69 onto Mokihinui Road and drive to the road end/cableway.

properties.Title: 2.Old Ghost Trail Start
properties.subtitle: Mokihinui River
properties.Description: Access Point 2 is off SH69, turn onto Mokihinui Road and drive 5.9km to the turn off to the Old Ghost Trail start.

properties.Title: 3.Mokihinui Bridge
properties.subtitle: Mokihinui River
properties.Description: Access point 3 is at the SH67 Mokihinui River Bridge. The best access is on the south side.

properties.Title: 4.North Side Lower Reaches
properties.subtitle: Mokihinui River
properties.Description: Access Point 4 is off SH69, turn onto De Malmanches Road and drive down the narrow road. There are access points to the true right side of the Mokihinu River right down to its mouth - 3.3km down the road.

properties.Title: 5.State Highway 67
properties.subtitle: Mokihinui River
properties.Description: Access point 5 is off SH67 (Nikau Road). This provides good access to the Mokihinui for 1km starting at Lewis Street heading Northwards.

properties.Title: 6.Flood Wall
properties.subtitle: Mokihinui River
properties.Description: Access point 6 is off SH67 (Nikau Road), turn onto Lewis Street and travel 300m until you reach the first river access point.

properties.Title: 7.Burnett Street
properties.subtitle: Mokihinui River
properties.Description: Access point 7 is off Burnett Street. Burnett Street provides access to the mouth of the Mokihinui River on its South Side.

properties.Title: Designated Waters
properties.subtitle: Karamea River
properties.Description: The Karamea River Catchment upstream of the Kakapo River confluence are Designated Waters.

properties.Title: Designated Waters
properties.subtitle: Mokihinui River
properties.Description: The Mokihinui Catchment upstream of the Rough and Tumble Creek confluence are Designated Waters.

properties.Title: 1.Swing Bridge
properties.subtitle: Inangahua River
properties.Description: Access point 1 is off SH7, down a gravel track to a swing bridge of the Inangahua River and a DoC Picnic Area. The turn off is sign posted with a Fish & Game angler access sign.

properties.Title: 2.State Highway 7
properties.subtitle: Inangahua River
properties.Description: Access point 2 is from State Highway 7 which offers access to the upper Inangahua River.

properties.Title: 3.Blacks Point Township
properties.subtitle: Inangahua River
properties.Description: Access point 3 is off SH7 on to High Street. Drive 50m to the first corner and park safely there. There is legal access down to the Inangahua River from this corner, which is a 50m walk.

properties.Title: 4.Blacks Point
properties.subtitle: Inangahua River
properties.Description: Access point 4 is off SH7, down a track that’s off a pull-off area, just down stream from the Blacks Point township. Sign posted with a Fish & Game angler access sign.

properties.Title: 5.Reefton
properties.subtitle: Inangahua River
properties.Description: Access point 5 is off The Strand, which is a street at the back of the Reefton township and offers access to the Inangahua River, with freedom campervan parking right beside the river.

properties.Title: 6.Anderson Road
properties.subtitle: Inangahua River
properties.Description: Access Point 6 turn off SH7 (Buller Road), onto Anderson Road and drive down past the golf club to the end, where a short drivable track takes you to a parking area and rivers edge.

properties.Title: 7.O'Grady Road
properties.subtitle: Inangahua River
properties.Description: Access Point 7 from SH69, turn onto O'Grady Road and drive to the end until you reach the rivers edge and then park safely.

properties.Title: 8.Brazils Road
properties.subtitle: Inangahua River
properties.Description: Access Point 8 from SH69, turn onto Brazils Road and drive to the end until you reach the rivers edge and then park safely.

properties.Title: 9.Perserverance Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Inangahua River
properties.Description: Access Point 9 from SH69, turn into Perseverance Road and travel until you come to the bridge over the Inangahua River (about 450m). Park safely either end of the bridge and find access the river.

properties.Title: 10.Landing Bridge
properties.subtitle: Inangahua River
properties.Description: Access Point 10 from SH69 bridge at Inangahua Landing, just past Brown Creek Road. Note: access to the river on the Reefton side although is difficult, with the other side easier, but do not block farm gates when parking.

properties.Title: 11.Mitchell's Farm
properties.subtitle: Inangahua River
properties.Description: Access point 11 travel along SH69 and look for the Fish & Game sign near the gate. Please park at the sign and walk through the paddock down to the river, leaving the gate as you found it.

properties.Title: 12.Inangahua Bridge
properties.subtitle: Inangahua River
properties.Description: Access point 12 is off Upper Buller Gorge Road (SH6) bridge. Park safely on West end of the Inangahua Junction Bridge and walk under the bridge to access the river.

properties.Title: 13.Inangahua-Buller confluence
properties.subtitle: Inangahua River
properties.Description: Access point 13 is off Low Buller Gorge Road (SH6). Park at the Fish & Game angler access sign and walk down the track to river (about 70m).

properties.Title: 1.Iron Bridge
properties.subtitle: Buller River
properties.Description: Access point 1 from SH6, turn onto New Creek Road and travel 300m until you reach a parking area on the left and then the access track to the Buller River.

properties.Title: 2.White Cliffs
properties.subtitle: Buller River
properties.Description: 'Access point 2 from State Highway 6 (Lower Buller Gorge Road) is down a short track, sign posted with a Fish & Game angler access sign.

properties.Title: 3.Berlins
properties.subtitle: Buller River
properties.Description: Access point 3 from State Highway 6 (Lower Buller Gorge Road), pull into the area marked by a Fish & Game angler access sign. 4WD vehicles can then drive the 220m down the track to the river. If your vehicle is only 2WD then we recommend walking.

properties.Title: 4.Stitts Bluff
properties.subtitle: Buller River
properties.Description: Access point 4 from State Highway 6 (Lower Buller Gorge Road), pull into the pull-off area marked by a Fish & Game angler access sign. From there, walk down the rough 4WD track to the the Buller River (about 200m).

properties.Title: 5.Hawks Crag
properties.subtitle: Buller River
properties.Description: Access point 5 from State Highway 6 (Lower Buller Gorge Road), pull into the pull-off area marked by a Fish & Game angler access sign. From there, walk down the bank to the Buller River.

properties.Title: 1.State Highway 6 Bridge
properties.subtitle: Ohikanui / Buller River
properties.Description: Access point 1 from SH6 (Lower Buller Gorge Road) down a short road marked with a Fish & Game angler access sign 50m beyond the bridge. Park in the gravel pit area and walk down to the Ohikanui and then downstream to the Buller River.

properties.Title: 7.10 Mile Creek
properties.subtitle: Buller River
properties.Description: Access point 7 from SH6 (Lower Buller Gorge Road), pull into the picnic area next to 10 Mile Creek. There are tracks through the bush down to 10 Mile Creek then to the Buller River.

properties.Title: 8.Stopbank
properties.subtitle: Buller River
properties.Description: Access point 8 from SH6 (Lower Buller Gorge Road), pull into the pull-off area next to the extensive river stop bank works. Fit anglers can climb down the rocks here to access the river.

properties.Title: 7.SH7 Bridge
properties.subtitle: Arnold River
properties.Description: Access point 7 is by the State Highway 7 bridge over the Arnold River. The best access is on the west end of the bridge, where there is a Fish & Game angler access sign.

properties.Title: 3.Lake Brunner Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Crooked River
properties.Description: Access point 3 is off the Lake Brunner Road Bridge over the Crooked River. River access is available both ends of the bridge.

properties.Title: 4.Middle Reaches
properties.subtitle: Crooked River
properties.Description: Access point 4 is off the Lake Brunner Road down a private farm race marked with a Fish & Game angler access sign. Please give Matt a call when using this access point: 027 420 1283

properties.Title: 5.Cashmere Track
properties.subtitle: Crooked River
properties.Description: Access point 5 turn off Cashmere Bay Road then down a short gravel track marked with a Fish & Game angler access sign and park at the end of the track next to the river.

properties.Title: 6.Iveagh Bay Bridge
properties.subtitle: Crooked River
properties.Description: Access point 6 is at the Iveagh Bay Bridge (Cashmere Bay Road), with access to the river avaliable at both ends of the bridge.

properties.Title: 7.Lower Reaches
properties.subtitle: Crooked River
properties.Description: Access point 7 is off Cashmere Bay Road, turn down the gravel track marked with a Fish & Game angler access sign and park at the Fish & Game at the end of the track. There are numerous angling options.

properties.Title: 1.Lake Poerua
properties.subtitle: Lake Poerua
properties.Description: Access point 1 is off Lake Brunner Road at the Lake Poerua boat ramp which is marked with a Fish & Game angler access sign.

properties.Title: 1.Upper Reaches
properties.subtitle: Bruce Stream
properties.Description: Access point 1 to Bruce Stream is via Rothery Road. Continue to the end, then along the private farm and park at the Fish & Game angler access sign. Please leave all gates how you find them.

properties.Title: 1.Mitchells Lake Edge
properties.subtitle: Lake Brunner
properties.Description: Access point 1 is off Kumara Inchbonnie Road which provides access to the lake along Lake Brunner's southern shoreline.

properties.Title: 2.Petrel Creek Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Brunner
properties.Description: Access point 2 is at the Petrel Creek Boat Ramp, off Kumara Inchbonnie Road. This Boat Ramp is only recommended for small boats being just a sand ramp and there is also very limited parking.

properties.Title: 3.Mitchells Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Brunner
properties.Description: Access point 3 is at the Mitchells Boat Ramp, off Kumara Inchbonnie Road, down the Bain Bay Track Road.

properties.Title: 4.Bain Bay Track
properties.subtitle: Lake Brunner
properties.Description: Access point 4 is the Bain Bay Track, turn off Kumara Inchbonnie Road, down the Bain Bay Track Road. The track provides great shoreline fishing access to Carew Bay and Bain Bay.

properties.Title: 5.Cashmere Bay Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Laker Brunner
properties.Description: Access point 5 is the Cashmere Bay Boat Ramp, off Cashmere Bay Road.

properties.Title: 6.Cashmere Bay
properties.subtitle: Lake Brunner
properties.Description: Access point 6 is at Cashmere Bay, off Cashmere Bay Road. The bay provides easy shoreline fishing from its grassy areas.

properties.Title: 7.Iveagh Bay
properties.subtitle: Lake Brunner
properties.Description: Access point 7 is at Iveagh Bay, off Cashmere Bay Road and then onto Centennial Drive. The bay provides shoreline fishing along the edge of Mount Te Kinga.

properties.Title: 8.Moana Yacht Club
properties.subtitle: Lake Brunner
properties.Description: Access point 8 is the Moana Yacht Club boat ramp, located at the end of Ahau Street.

properties.Title: 9.Moana Township
properties.subtitle: Lake Brunner
properties.Description: 'Access point 9 is out from Moana township. Ahau Street provides 600m of access to Lake Brunner.

properties.Title: 10.Moana Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Brunner
properties.Description: Access point 10 is at the Moana Boat Ramp, located on Ahau Street.

properties.Title: 11.Beechwater Drive
properties.subtitle: Lake Brunner
properties.Description: Access point 11 is at the the end of Beechwater Drive, providing access to Lake Brunner's western shoreline. Park safely and walk down the track to the lakes edge.

properties.Title: 1.Arnold Swing Bridge
properties.subtitle: Arnold River
properties.Description: Access point 1 is at the Arnold Swing Bridge, located on Ahau Street by the Boat Ramp. Venture across the swing bridge for fishing the Arnold River and the eastern shoreline of Lake Brunner.

properties.Title: 2.Kotoku Bridge
properties.subtitle: Arnold River
