properties.Description: Access point 2 is at the Arnold Valley Road Bridge over the Arnold River. The best access is on the east end of the bridge, where a track leads you down under the bridge.

properties.Title: 3.Arnold Dam
properties.subtitle: Arnold River
properties.Description: Access point 3 is where Benson Creek enters the Arnold River. Here very little shoreline angling is available but it's a great spot to put in a kayak or small dingy to fish the lake formed by the dam. Walk down or float down (depending on water levels) Benson Creek to access the Arnold.

properties.Title: 4.Below the Arnold Dam
properties.subtitle: Arnold River
properties.Description: Access point 4 is at the end of Stratford Road. The the turn off from Lake Brunner Valley Road and it is marked with a Fish & Game angler access sign.

properties.Title: 5.Maori Gully Road
properties.subtitle: Arnold River
properties.Description: Access point 5 is opposite Maori Gully Road, on the old Kokiri Road. Park at the Fish & Game angler access sign and walk down the track to the river (about 430m).

properties.Title: 6.Kokiri Bridge
properties.subtitle: Arnold River
properties.Description: Access point 6 is from the east end of the bridge over the Arnold River on Blair Road. Access is available both up and downstream marked with Fish & Game angler access signs.

properties.Title: 1.Big Totara River
properties.subtitle: Big Totara River
properties.Description: Access point 1 is 90m south of the SH6 bridge over the Big Totara River, down a gravel track marked with an angler access sign. Park in the gravel area and walk down to the river.

properties.Title: 1.SH6 Bridge
properties.subtitle: Little Totara River
properties.Description: Access point 1 is from the SH6 bridge over the Little Totara River. Park either end of the bridge and make your way down to the river.

properties.Title: 2.Hands Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Little Totara River
properties.Description: Access point 2 is from the Hands Road Bridge over the Little Totara River. Park either end of the bridge and make your way down to the river.

properties.Title: 3.Hands Road End
properties.subtitle: Little Totara River
properties.Description: Access point 3 is the end of Hands Road. Park safely at the road end and walk to the river.

properties.Title: 1.Upper Reaches
properties.subtitle: Nile River
properties.Description: Access point 1 is at the end of Darkies Terrace Road, providing access to the upper reaches of the Nile River.

properties.Title: 2.Lowes Road
properties.subtitle: Nile River
properties.Description: Access point 2 is off SH6, 90m down Lowes Road. Pull off and park safely here and walk down to the river.

properties.Title: 3.Beach Road
properties.subtitle: Nile River
properties.Description: Access Point 3 is off SH6, the first 400m of Beach Road provides access to the lower Nile River.

properties.Title: 4.River Mouth
properties.subtitle: Nile River
properties.Description: Access point 4 is off SH6, travel 650m down Beach Road then pull into the parking area to access the Nile river mouth.

properties.Title: 1.Fox River Freedom Camping Site
properties.subtitle: Fox River

properties.Title: 2.SH6 Bridge
properties.subtitle: Fox River
properties.Description: Access point 2 is from the SH6 Bridge over the Fox River. Park safely either end of the bridge and make your way down to the river.

properties.Title: 1.SH6 Bridge
properties.subtitle: Pororari River
properties.Description: Access point 1 is from the SH6 Bridge over the Pororari River. Park safely either side of the south end of the bridge and make your way down to the river.

properties.Title: 1.SH6 Bridge
properties.subtitle: Punakaiki River
properties.Description: Access point 1 is from SH6 Bridge over the Punakaiki River. Use entryways at either end of the bridge and make your way down to the river.

properties.Title: 1.Ahaura Upper Reaches
properties.subtitle: Ahaura River

properties.Title: 2.Haupiri Confluence
properties.subtitle: Ahaura River
properties.Description: Access point 2 is at the end of Haupiri Road, off the stop bank. Please ensure when you park you don’t block the track or any gateways.

properties.Title: 3.SH7 Bridge-North End
properties.subtitle: Ahaura River

properties.Title: 4.SH7 Bridge-South End
properties.subtitle: Ahaura River
properties.Description: Access point 4 is off State Highway 7 at the south end of the bridge marked with a Fish & Game angler access sign.

properties.Title: 1.Haupiri Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Haupiri River
properties.Description: Access point 1 is off Haupiri Road bridge, a pull in area is on the West side for parking, then make your way down to the river.

properties.Title: 1.Lake Haupiri
properties.subtitle: Lake Haupiri
properties.Description: Access point 1 is off Haupiri Road, where there is parking all around the boat ramp.

properties.Title: 1.Lady Lake
properties.subtitle: Lady Lake
properties.Description: Access point one is off the Bellhill Road. With very little shoreline fishing, the lake is best fished with a small boat or watercraft that can be lifted into the water.

properties.Title: 1.Upper Crooked River
properties.subtitle: Crooked River
properties.Description: Access point 1 is off Bellhill Road, at the end of Rotomanu-Kopara Road. The gate is sometimes locked at the Rotomanu-Kopara Rd Bellhill Road junction. The key can be collected from Bruce Burgess by visiting his house, which is 520m back toward Rotomanu on the left side.

properties.Title: 2.Bellhill Road
properties.subtitle: Crooked River
properties.Description: Access point 2 is off the Bellhill Road Bridge over the Crooked River. The best access is on the South end of the bridge.

properties.Title: 9.Reedys Road
properties.subtitle: Buller River
properties.Description: Access point 9 is at the end of Reedys Road, where gravel extraction occurs on the Northern side of the Buller River.

properties.Title: 10.Westport Domain
properties.subtitle: Buller River
properties.Description: Access point 10 is at the back of Westport Domain, with access off Roebuck Street.

properties.Title: 11.Buller Bridge

properties.Title: 12.Upstream Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Buller River
properties.Description: Access point 12 is off The Esplanade. A tidal boat ramp and readily available fishing access.

properties.Title: 13.Westport Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Buller River

properties.Title: 14.Marrs Beach

properties.Title: 15.Tiphead
properties.subtitle: Buller River
properties.Description: Access point 15 is off Tiphead Road. Access to 1.5kms of lower Buller River.

properties.Title: 16.Shingle Beach
properties.subtitle: Buller River
properties.Description: 'Access point 16 is off Shingle Beach Road. Drive to the end of Shingle Beach Road and park safely.

properties.Title: 17.Coates Street
properties.subtitle: Buller River
properties.Description: Access point 17 is off Coates Street. This offers angling access to 900m of the lower Buller River.

properties.Title: 1.Stanley Gooseman Bridge

properties.Description: Access point 1 is on either end of the Stanley Gooseman Bridge, which is the Lake Brunner Road Bridge over the Taramakau River.

properties.Title: 2.McArthur Road

properties.Description: Access point 4 is off State Highway via the Gentle Annie Road. This access does go through private land, so please respect the landowners wishes on the sign as you make your way to the river.

properties.Title: 5.SH6 Bridge North End

properties.Description: Access point 5 is off State Highway 6, at the north end of the SH6 bridge over the Taramkau River.

properties.Title: 1.Kawhaka Race

properties.Description: Access Point 1 is via the Old Christchurch Road.

properties.Description: Access point 1 is off Stafford Loop Road.

properties.Title: 2.Kapitea Reservoir
properties.subtitle: Kapitea Reservoir
properties.Description: Access point 2 is off Stafford Loop Road, then down a rough track.

properties.Title: 6.Kaniere

properties.Title: 7.Arthurstown
properties.subtitle: Hokitika River
properties.Description: Access point 7 is off Arthurstown Road.

properties.Title: 8.Wadeson Island

properties.Title: 9.SH6 Bridge

properties.Title: 11.North Tip Head

properties.Title: 1.Sunny Bight Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Kaniere
properties.Description: Access point 1 is off Sunny Bight Road.

properties.Title: 2.Outlet
properties.subtitle: Lake Kaniere

properties.Title: 3.Hans Bay Boat Ramp

properties.Description: Access point 3 is at the Hans Bay Boat Ramp which is located on Hans Bay Road.

properties.Title: 4.Lake Kaniere Jetty

properties.Description: Access point 4 is off Hans Bay Road that offers plenty of easy shoreline fishing.

properties.Title: 5.Dorothy Falls Road

properties.Description: Access point 3 is at the Kaniere Kowhitirangi Road Bridge, over the Kaniere River.

properties.Title: 1.Upper Reaches

properties.Title: 3.Upper Kokatahi Rd Bridge
properties.subtitle: Styx River
properties.Description: Access point 3 is at the Upper Kokatahi Road Bridge over the Styx River.

properties.Title: 1.Upper Reaches
properties.subtitle: Kokatahi River
properties.Description: Access point 1 is off Middle Branch Road, providing access to the upper reaches of the Kokatahi River.

properties.Title: 2.Mill Road
properties.subtitle: Kokatahi River
properties.Description: Access point 2 is at the end of Mill Road. Please note; 1.5km up stream from this access point is the winter trout fishing boundry at the Styx River Junction. Upstream of the Styx River is closed 1 May to 30 September

properties.Title: 3.Meharry Road
properties.subtitle: Kokatahi River
properties.Description: Access point 3 is at the end of Meharry Road.

properties.Title: 4.Kokatahi Town Bridge

properties.Title: 1.Toaroha Carpark

properties.Title: 1.Lake Mahinapua Boat ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Mahinapua
properties.Description: Access point 1 is the Lake Mahinapua boat ramp, located down Shanghai Road.

properties.Title: 1.Kakapotahi River Confluence

properties.Description: Access point 1 is located down a short gravel track, 230m down Beach Road off SH6. Pleae note the Kakapotahi River is closed during winter (1 May - 30 Sept).

properties.Title: 2.Farm Access
properties.subtitle: Waitaha River
properties.Description: Access point 2 is located down a farm race, 1.53km down Beach Road off State Highway 6. Please leave the gates how you find them.

properties.Title: 3.Lower Reaches
properties.subtitle: Waitaha River
properties.Description: Access point 3 provides access to the Waitaha River mouth. It's a 700m walk to the river. Anglers can 4WD down, but it is recommended walking to save potentially getting stuck on the beach.

properties.Title: 1.Lake Ianthe Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Ianthe
properties.Description: Access point 1 is the Lake Ianthe Boat Ramp located on State Highway 6.

properties.Title: 1.Petersen Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: La Fontaine Stream
properties.Description: Access point 1 is down Petersen Road. Stream bank access is on private land, so anglers please be respectful.

properties.Title: 2.La Fontaine Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: La Fontaine Stream
properties.Description: Access point 2 is at the La Fontaine Road Bridge. Access is on private land, so anglers please be respectful.

properties.Title: 3.Guy Menzies Memorial
properties.subtitle: La Fontaine Stream
properties.Description: Access point 3 is at the end of River Road.

properties.Title: 1.Okarito Lagoon Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Okarito Lagoon
properties.Description: Access point 1 is the Okarito Lagoon Boat Ramp, located off Wharf Street.

properties.Title: 1.Upper Reaches
properties.subtitle: Okarito River
properties.Description: Access point 1 is located on the edge of State Highway 6. (Franz Josef Highway)

properties.Title: 2.Forks
properties.subtitle: Okarito River
properties.Description: Access point 2 is located off Forks Side Road.

properties.Title: 1.Jetty Bay Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Maporika
properties.Description: Access point 1 is located off State Highway 6 (Franz Josef Highway).

properties.subtitle: Lake Mapourika
properties.Description: Access point 2 is located off State Highway 6 (Franz Josef Highway). Please note this ramp is suitable for large boats. Also, nearby MacDonalds Creek is closed to fishing.

properties.Title: 1.Lake Paringa Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Paringa
properties.Description: Access point 1 is the Lake Paringa Boat Ramp, located off State Highway 6 (Haast Highway).

properties.Title: 1.Lake Moeraki Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Moeraki / Eastern End
properties.Description: Access point 1 is the main Lake Moeraki boat ramp, located off State Highway 6 (Haast Highway).

properties.Title: 2.Lake Moeraki Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Moeraki / Western End
properties.Description: Access point 2 is the second Lake Moeraki boat ramp, located off State Highway 6 (Haast Highway).

properties.Title: 1.Haast River
properties.subtitle: Haast River
properties.Description: Access point 1 is to the Haast River lower reaches, located on Haast-Jackson Bay Road, sign-posted with angler access information.

properties.Title: 1.Benmore Dam Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Benmore
properties.Description: Access Point 1 is to a boat ramp via Loch Laird Road at Benmore Dam. A Limited area of shoreline fishing access is available near the ramp and dam.

properties.Title: 3.Otamatapaio Rec Reserve
properties.subtitle: Lake Benmore
properties.Description: Access point 3 is at Otamatapaio Recreation Reserve accessed via a signposted DOC access track off SH83. Follow the 4WD track some 1.3km to reach the lake edge near the anglers club hut. The A20 cycle trail passes through area and may assist with walking/cycling access for fishing.

properties.Title: 4.Sailors Cutting Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Benmore
properties.Description: Access point 4 is the boat ramp at Sailors Cutting Campground. Shoreline fishing access via walking the Alps to Ocean Cycle to the north.

properties.Title: 5.Pumpkin Point
properties.subtitle: Lake Benmore
properties.Description: Access point 5 is at Pumpkin Point off State Highway 83. Walking access around the point and north and south shoreline access via the A2O cycle trail.OPEN SEASON:All yearFISHING METHODS:Fly, Spin, BaitMIN SIZE LIMIT:Salmon only - 250mmDAILY BAG LIMIT:Sports fish - 4

properties.Title: 7.Glenburn Station farm track
properties.subtitle: Lake Benmore
properties.Description: Access point 7 is a signposted access-way though Glenburn / Otamatapaio Station, giving access along a 4WD farm track to the lake shore.

properties.Title: 8.Ōhau C Campground Boat ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Benmore
properties.Description: Access point 8 is at the boat ramp and nearby shoreline at Ōhau C Campground located on McAughtries Road.

properties.Title: 9.Ōhau C Tailrace-TL
properties.subtitle: Lake Benmore
properties.Description: Access point 9 is via the true left bank of the Ōhau C power station tail race. From this point walking access is possible to fish the lake at the deltas of the Lower Ōhau and Tekapō rivers.

properties.Title: 10.Haldon Arm Campground boat ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Benmore
properties.Description: Access point 10 is at the boat ramp in the Haldon Arm Campground.

properties.Title: 11.Lakeshore access track turnoff
properties.subtitle: Lake Benmore
properties.Description: Access point 11 is the start of a 4WD track off Haldon Arm Road that leads to the shoreline of Lake Benmore.

properties.Title: 1.Waitaki Huts-North Side mouth/lagoon
properties.subtitle: Waitaki River
properties.Description: Access point 1 is at the Waitaki Huts at the end of Fisheries Road. All vehicles to carpark. Access to the river mouth and lagoon. 4WD vehicle access to the boat launching site.

properties.Title: 2.Fisheries Road
properties.subtitle: Waitaki River
properties.Description: Access point 2 is off Fisheries Road. Walking access is from the angler access sign.

properties.Title: 3.Substation Road
properties.subtitle: Waitaki River
properties.Description: Access point 3 is at the end of Substation Road. All vehicles to Angler Access Sign on gate. Walk across paddock to river – private land with cooperative landowner.

properties.Title: 4.State Highway 1
properties.subtitle: Waitaki River
properties.Description: Access point 4 is a picnic area off State Highway 1, adjacent to the bridge. Walk to the river from the carpark.

properties.Title: 5.Te Maiharoa Road
properties.subtitle: Waitaki River
properties.Description: Access point 5 is off Te Maiharoa Road. 4WD or walking access upstream and down. Jet boat launching site at the downstream access - subject to change in channel shifting.

properties.Title: 6.Henstridges Road
properties.subtitle: Waitaki River
properties.Description: Access point 6 is at the end of Henstridges Road. 4WD and walking access via tracks to the river. Access quality is variable subject to flood and river works.

properties.Title: 7(a).Ferry Road Groyne
properties.subtitle: Waitaki River
properties.Description: Access point 7 is off Ross Road via Ferry Road, and is provided by cooperative landowners via a working farm.

properties.Title: 7(b).Ferry Road "paddock"
properties.subtitle: Waitaki River
properties.Description: Access point 7 is off Ross Road via Ferry Road, and is provided by cooperative landowners via a working farm. Fish & Game signs mark the gate. The farm paddock must be crossed. Park vehicle at your own risk as stock may be present.

properties.Title: 8(b).Ross Road / Bells Pond
properties.subtitle: Waitaki River
properties.Description: Access point 8(b) is the Waitaki River jet boat launch site, accessed via Ross Road – Bells Pond. All vehicle accessible. Private land with cooperative landowner.

properties.Title: 9.Ikawai
properties.subtitle: Waitaki River
properties.Description: Access point 9 is off SH82 via Ikawai Road. 4WD track through working farm and creek – flooding can make creek impassable. Follow multiple signs for directions. Access in part is private, with cooperative landowners. Phone Lee Bryant for current access conditions 0273787732.

properties.Title: 10.Stonewall
properties.subtitle: Waitaki River
properties.Description: Access point 10 is off SH82 by Stonewall. Walking only from the signposted carpark. Access is via private land with cooperative landowner.

properties.Title: 11.Brunswick Downs
properties.subtitle: Waitaki River
properties.Description: Access point 11 is off SH82 at Brunswick Downs. Either 4WD or walking from the signposted farm gate on SH82. First, cross the farm paddock (70m) through tape gate then onto the 4WD riverbed track.

properties.Title: 12.Demonstration channel
properties.subtitle: Waitaki River
properties.Description: Access point 12 is off SH82 at Demonstration channel-Brunswick Downs. Walking access is across a working farm from a signposted farm gate to access the channel, next to black water tank.

properties.Title: 13.Station Peak-Dairy Shed
properties.subtitle: Waitaki River
properties.Description: Access point 13 at Station Peak “Dairy Shed”. Access in part is private and is provided for fishing by cooperative landowners. Signposted 4WD access across private working farm to signposted angler’s carpark. Access for any other activity requires permission, phone M Pavletich 0274101088.

properties.Title: 14.Papamoa Farm
properties.subtitle: Waitaki River
properties.Description: Access point 14 at Papamoa Farm. Access is via a private working farm – permission is required, Phone R. Smith 027 6893849. Access is via the farm road that is directly opposite the Little Roderick Road sign.

properties.Title: 15.Station Peak - Pump Shed
properties.subtitle: Waitaki River
properties.Description: Access point 15 is at Station Peak “pump shed”. Signposted 4WD access across a private working farm is provided for fishing by cooperative landowners. Access for any other activity requires permission, Phone M Pavletich 0274101088.

properties.Title: 16.Fettercairn stop bank
properties.subtitle: Waitaki River
properties.Description: 'Access point 16 at Fettercairn stop bank off SH82. Walking access from the gate across a private working farm is provided for fishing by cooperative landowners. Access for any other activity and dogs requires permission, Phone S. Johnston 021 661033.

properties.Title: 17.Hakataramea Bridge
properties.subtitle: Waitaki River
properties.Description: Access point 17 is at the Hakataramea River Bridge. 4WD and walking access 1km down the true-left bank of the Hakataramea River to the junction with the Waitaki River.The track crosses a private working farm with cooperative landowners.

properties.Title: 18.Old Slip Road-Powerlines
properties.subtitle: Waitaki River
properties.Description: Access point 18 off Old Slip Road “Powerlines” provided by the cooperative landowner through a working farm. Walking or 4WD access. No dogs without permission, Phone W. Newlands 0275493604.NOTE: Due to lambing this access is closed for the first 10 days of October.

properties.Title: 19.Old Slip Road-Road End
properties.subtitle: Waitaki River
properties.Description: 'Access point 19 is at the end of Old Slip Road. All vehicles to where the road and river meet. No access to Waitaki Dam. Access provided for fishing by a cooperative landowner through a working farm. Permission is required to carry firearms, Phone J. Abelen 0276 237011.

properties.Title: 20.Awakino River
properties.subtitle: Waitaki River
properties.Description: Access point 20 at Awakino River off SH83. Park at the bridge picnic area. Walk down the Awakino riverbed to the Waitaki River.

properties.Title: 21.Kurow Island Bridges
properties.subtitle: Waitaki River
properties.Description: Access point 21 is at Kurow Island Bridges. All vehicles. Formed Jet boat ramp. Multiple access options.

properties.Title: 22.Kurow Creek
properties.subtitle: Waitaki River
properties.Description: Access point 22 is signposted off SH83. Multiple options for 4WD or walking access via the riverbed and tracks.

properties.Title: 23.Otiake River
properties.subtitle: Waitaki River
properties.Description: Access point 23 Otiake River is signposted off SH83. Multiple options for 4WD or walking access via the riverbed and tracks.

properties.Title: 24.Otekaieke River
properties.subtitle: Waitaki River
properties.Description: Access point 24 is off SH83 for the Otekaieke River down to the Waitaki River. 4WD or walking access via riverbed and tracks.

properties.Title: 25.Priest Road
properties.subtitle: Waitaki River
properties.Description: Access point 25 is directly opposite Priest Road via the gate and farm track. Private property with cooperative landowners. Access is provided for fishing only – no firearms, no hunting.

properties.Title: 26(a).Duntroon
properties.subtitle: Waitaki River
properties.Description: Access point 26 is via Duntroon Access. All vehicles via a signposted gravel track to the jet boat launching area.

properties.Title: 26(b).Duntroon
properties.subtitle: Waitaki River
properties.Description: Access point 26(b) is via Duntroon Domain. Maerewhenua riverbed can be walked to the Waitaki River when flows are suitable.

properties.Title: 27.Dogterom
properties.subtitle: Waitaki River
properties.Description: Access point 27 is via Dogterom Farm. Permission is required, Phone Otto; 0274759941. 4WD or walking access is provided through a private working farm by a cooperative landowner.

properties.Title: 28.Bortons Pond
properties.subtitle: Waitaki River
properties.Description: Access point 28 is off SH83. All vehicle access to Bortons pond and the Waitaki River.

properties.Title: 29.Wilsons Road
properties.subtitle: Waitaki River
properties.Description: Access point 29 is via the end of Wilsons Road. 4WD or walking access from the signposted farm gate.

properties.Title: 30.Jardine Road
properties.subtitle: Waitaki River
properties.Description: Access point 30 is at the end of Jardine Road. 4WD or walking access from the signposted farm gate.

properties.Title: 31.Ferry Road
properties.subtitle: Waitaki River
properties.Description: Access point 31 is at the end of Ferry Road (South). All vehicles / 4WD access to multiple points.

properties.Title: 32.Waitaki Bridge
properties.subtitle: Waitaki River
properties.Description: Access point 32 is off SH1 at Waitaki Bridge. 4WD or walking access from the track below the bridge.

properties.Title: 33.Jacksons Road
properties.subtitle: Waitaki River
properties.Description: Access point 33 is via Jacksons Road. Access is with permission required from Mark Searle, phone: 027 2298150. Park vehicles at the signposted gate and walk via the working farm across the paddock to the river. NOTE: The river access track is subject to overgrown vegetation.

properties.Title: 34(b).Kaik Road
properties.subtitle: Waitaki River
properties.Description: Access point 34(b) is off Kaik Road beside the huts village. Walking access only from Kaik Road via the signposted farm track. Walk to the fenceline on the far edge of the paddock - access is subject to changes in the river channels and willow plantation.

properties.Title: 35.South Side River mouth / lagoon
properties.subtitle: Waitaki River
properties.Description: Access Point 35 is at the South Side River mouth with access via the end of Kaik Road. It's a 10 minute walk or ATV down the beach track from the carpark to the river mouth.

properties.Title: 34(a).Kaik Road
properties.subtitle: Waitaki River
properties.Description: Access point 34(a) is off Kaik Road beside the holiday park. Signposted access is across private land with a cooperative landowner. All vehicle access is via a working farm track to a gate at far edge of the paddock.

properties.Title: 1.Upper Tekapo / Takapō Canal Access Road
properties.subtitle: Hydro Canals
properties.Description: Access Point 1 - A short drive West of the Tekapo / Takapō Township is the turn off onto an access road that leads to the upper section of the Tekapo/ Takapō Canal, including the "Magic Carpet".

properties.Title: 2.Tekapo A Powerhouse area
properties.subtitle: Hydro Canals
properties.Description: Access Point 2 - The canal bank roads offer kilometres of vehicle, walking and cycling access to the Tekapo/Takapō from this point - portaloo available at the Bridge.

properties.Title: 3.Angler's Carpark
properties.subtitle: Hydro Canals
properties.Description: Access Point 3 - A locked gate here is the extent of vehicle access in the upper section of the Tekapo /Takapō. A car park here is used by angler that walk downstream to fish the "Magic Carpet".

properties.Title: 4.The "Magic Carpet"
properties.subtitle: Hydro Canals
properties.Description: Access Point 4 - A popular spot to fish in May and September for spawning run trout. The 'carpet' name refers to the white-coloured plastic liner in the canal.

properties.Title: 5.SH8 Bridge-Upstream
properties.subtitle: Hydro Canals
properties.Description: Access Point 5 - A carpark adjacent to SH8 offers walking or cycling access upstream on the true-left bank.

properties.Title: 6.SH8 Bridge - Downstream
properties.subtitle: Hydro Canals
properties.Description: Access Point 6 - A carpark adjacent to SH8 offers several kilometres of walking access downstream on the true-left canal bank. This access is the upper-stream extent of open water during the months of June - August.

properties.Title: 7.Anglers carpark - Bridge
properties.subtitle: Hydro Canals
properties.Description: Access Point 7 - A locked gate prohibits further upstream vehicle access. Walking and cycling access upstream for several kilometres on the true-left canal bank.

properties.Title: 8.Tekapo Salmon farms - angler's carparks
properties.subtitle: Hydro Canals
properties.Description: Access Point 8 - The designated angler's carpark is marked in four sections adjacent to the salmon farms on the true-left of the canal road. Please use these designated parks when fishing this area.

properties.Title: 9.Angler's carpark - Fish Bowl
properties.subtitle: Hydro Canals
properties.Description: Access Point 9 - This carpark provides walking access to the powerstation intake area and salmon farms.

properties.Title: 10.Tekapo/Takapō Canal Stilling Bason/"Fish Bowl"
properties.subtitle: Hydro Canals
properties.Description: Access Point 10 - A popular fishing spot year-round for salmon and trout fishing. Famous for its spectacular views of Aoraki / Mount Cook.

properties.Title: 11.Lower Tekapo / Takapō Canal access road
properties.subtitle: Hydro Canals
properties.Description: Access Point 11 - Turn off Hayman Road and drive up the hill to reach the Tekapo / Takapō Canal and the "Fish Bowl"

properties.Title: 12.Hayman Road - Lower Tekapo/ Takapō Canal access
properties.subtitle: Hydro Canals
properties.Description: Access Point 12 - Turn off SH8 onto Hayman Road. Drive approximately 5km to reach the Tekapo Canal Road turnoff.

properties.Title: 13.Pūkaki Canal - Upper
properties.subtitle: Hydro Canals
properties.Description: Access Point 13 - SH8 gives access multple options to access the Pukaki Canal Road, including the popular fishing spot around the intake and Lake Wardell.

properties.Title: 14.Pūkaki Canal - Glen Lyon Rd Bridge
properties.subtitle: Hydro Canals
properties.Description: Access Point 14 - A key bridge to cross to access the Pūkaki-Ohau 'A' canals junction.

properties.Title: 15.Ōhau A Canal - Intake
properties.subtitle: Hydro Canals
properties.Description: Access Point 15 - A popular spot accessed from Glen Lyon and Ohau Canal Road.

properties.Title: 17.McAughtries Road-Ōhau B & C Canals
properties.subtitle: Hydro Canals
properties.Description: Access Point 17 - Via McAughtries Road - Ōhau B & C Canals access road.

properties.Title: 18.Ōhau B Canal - SH8 Bridge area
properties.subtitle: Hydro Canals
properties.Description: Access Point 18 - Multiple access options available via SH8. This area features two salmon farms and a NZMCA caravan parkup - a popular fishing spot.

properties.Title: 16.Pūkaki - Ōhau 'A' canals Junction
properties.subtitle: Hydro Canals
properties.Description: Access Point 16 - A popular spot with several places to fish from. The locations of the salmon farm hatchery and single salmon pen raft.

properties.Title: 20.Ōhau C Canal - Angler's car park
properties.subtitle: Hydro Canals
properties.Description: Access Point 20 - A popular spot opposite the salmon farms with an angler's carpark.

properties.Title: 21.Ōhau C Canal - Powerstation Intake Area
properties.subtitle: Hydro Canals
properties.Description: Access Point 21 - A popular fishing spot.

properties.Title: 1a.Lake Heron / Ōtūroto - Harrisons Bight access track
properties.subtitle: Ashburton Lakes / Lake Heron
properties.Description: Access Point 1a from the Car park and locked gate, with walking and vehicle access to Harrisons Bight. Apply for vehicle access permits at the DOC website.

properties.Title: 2.Lake Heron / Ōtūroto - Western Shoreline
properties.subtitle: Ashburton Lakes / Lake Heron
properties.Description: Access Point 2 offers roadside access to the Western shoreline of the Lake from Hakatere-Heron Road.

properties.Title: 3.Lake Emily - Access Track
properties.subtitle: Ashburton Lakes / Lake Emily
properties.Description: Access Point 3 - Turn off Hakatere Heron Road at the sign posted Lake Emily / Te Araroa Trail Road. From the farm gate, walk for approximately 45mins to an 1 hour to reach the lake. 4WD access may be possible but subject to the track conditions.

properties.Title: 4.Ōtūwharekai - Front
properties.subtitle: Ashburton Lakes / Maori Lake
properties.Description: Access Point 4 - Roadside access and parking.

properties.Title: 5.Ōtūwharekai - Back - Access Track
properties.subtitle: Ashburton Lakes / Maori Lake
properties.Description: Access point 5 - A farm gate located near the concrete fertiliser bin gives vehicle access for approximately 1km across private land to reach the lake.

properties.Title: 6.Lake Roundabout
properties.subtitle: Ashburton Lakes / Lake Roundabout
properties.Description: Access Point 6 - Take the signposted road to Lake Emma from Hakatere-Potts Road. The Lake Roundabout access gate is signposted with a Fish & Game access sign.

properties.Title: 7.Lake Emma / Kirihonuhonu
properties.subtitle: Ashburton Lakes / Lake Emma
properties.Description: Access Point 7 - Take the sign-posted road to Lake Emma from Hakatere Potts Road. After reaching the lake, a 4WD track skirts the lake on the Eastern edge - this track is closed outside of the fishing season and also when DOC deem the track to be too wet.

properties.Title: 8.Lake Camp / Ōtautari
properties.subtitle: Ashburton Lakes / Lake Camp
properties.Description: Access Point 8 to Lake Camp is via roadside access with plenty of camping options.

properties.Title: 9.Lake Clearwater / Te Puna-a-Taka
properties.subtitle: Ashburton Lakes / Lake Clearwater
properties.Description: Access Point 9 is via a walking track that skirts the edge of the lake. 4WD access is available for the Eastern part of the lake.

properties.Title: 10.Mystery Lake - walking track
properties.subtitle: Ashburton Lakes / Mystery Lake
properties.Description: Access Point 10 is from the DOC carpark at the Potts River Bridge. A 4-hour hike is required to reach the lake requiring good fitness and good footwear.

properties.Title: 11.Lake Hood
properties.subtitle: Ashburton Lakes / Lake Hood
properties.Description: Access Point 11 is a short drive from Tinwald / Ashburton.

properties.Title: 1.Rangitata Mouth South
properties.subtitle: Rangitata River
properties.Description: Access point 1 is gained by walking or quad biking along the beach from the Rangitata Huts to the mouth, of which the position is subject to change. Walking can be between 5-30mins.

properties.Title: 2.Rangitata Huts
properties.subtitle: Rangitata River
properties.Description: Access point 2 is approximately 90m before reaching the Rangitata Huts. A track leads across the grassy field and connects to a 4WD riverbed track, that reaches the riverbed.

properties.Title: 3.Badham Road
properties.subtitle: Rangitata River
properties.Description: Access Point 3 is from the end of Badham Road. Subject to river channel positions changing, several km's of riverbed can be accessed via the 4WD tracks and by walking.

properties.Title: 4.Dip Road
properties.subtitle: Rangitata River
properties.Description: Access Point 4 is at the end of Dip Road from Rangitata Island Road. Park safely and gain walking access to the riverbed or access with 4WD.

properties.Title: 5.Brodies Road
properties.subtitle: Rangitata River
properties.Description: Access Point 5 is from a signposted farm gate adjacent to the corner of Brodies Road and Rangitata Island Road, providing access of 1km via 4WD farm track to the riverbed.

properties.Title: 6.Old Main South Road-South
properties.subtitle: Rangitata River
properties.Description: Access Point 6 is from a signposted farm gate adjacent to the corner of Old Main South Road and Rangitata Island Road. This provides access 1km via 4WD farm track to the riverbed.

properties.Title: 8.Lewis Road
properties.subtitle: Rangitata River
properties.Description: Access Point 8 is from a signposted farm gate off Arundel Rangitata Road which provides access across a working farm to the river berm. Stock may be present. Park at end of paddock and climb over fence to access riverbed track network.

properties.Title: 9.Arundel Bridge
properties.subtitle: Rangitata River
properties.Description: Access Point 9 is below the bridge that can be gained near the Eastern bridge approach. Easy parking is found on the Western/upstream side via Bridge Street and the Arundel Bridge Reserve.

properties.Title: 10.Ferry Road
properties.subtitle: Rangitata River
properties.Description: Access point 10 via Ferry Road provides access to the riverbed through the river works tracks. This access is subject to change from flooding that has eroded Ferry Road.

properties.Title: 11.Peel Forest Camp Ground
properties.subtitle: Rangitata River
properties.Description: Access Point 11 at the entrance to the camping ground, a track branches to the right. Continue for 0.5km over a cattle stop to a public reserve area. A walking track leads to the river from here.

properties.Title: 13.Lynn Creek
properties.subtitle: Rangitata River
properties.Description: Access Point 13 - Park near the bridge and walk approximately 200m down the Lynn Creek bed to the Rangitata River.

properties.Title: 16.Coal Creek
properties.subtitle: Rangitata River
properties.Description: Access Point 16 is off Rangitata Gorge Road via private land with a cooperative landowner. Please adhere to any landowners access rules that may be signposted on gates and fencing.

properties.Title: 17.Fisherman's Lane
properties.subtitle: Rangitata River
properties.Description: Access Point 17 is is off Rangitata Gorge Road via private land with restrictions. Open from 1st of December to 31st of March. Please adhere to landowners access rules signposted on roadside entry gate.

properties.Title: 18.Turn Again Point
properties.subtitle: Rangitata River
properties.Description: Access Point 18 is is off Rangitata Gorge Road adjacent to the road. This is a popular spot for launching jet boats. Please note the fishing regulations upstream of here (white poles) are restricted.

properties.Title: 19.Rangitata Gorge Road
properties.subtitle: Rangitata River
properties.Description: Access Point 19 is via signposted roadside access upstream of the Turn Again Point Bluff.

properties.Title: 20.Forest Creek
properties.subtitle: Rangitata River
properties.Description: Access Point 20 is off Rangitata Gorge Road via walking or 4WD vehicle access 1.7km down the riverbed via the Western / true-left bank.

properties.Title: 21a.Dr Sinclair's Grave
properties.subtitle: Rangitata River
properties.Description: Access Point 21a is by turning right at the intersection and drive towards trees. Please respect this access easement as it crosses through private land.

properties.Title: 21b.Dr Sinclair's Grave
properties.subtitle: Rangitata River
properties.Description: Access Point 21b - Go through the gate and take left hand track. Access from here may require 4WD vehicle or alternatively walking. Please respect this access easement as it crosses through private land.

properties.Title: 22.4WD/walking-Headwaters
properties.subtitle: Rangitata River
properties.Description: Access Point 22 is either by 4WD vehicle or walking which is required to reach the river's headwaters beyond the Bush Stream bed. The headwaters offer low numbers of sports fish but nevertheless can be accessed by anglers seeking adventure.

properties.Title: 23.Potts River
properties.subtitle: Rangitata River
properties.Description: Access Point 23 via a rough 4WD vehicle track which follows the true right bank of Potts River for approximately 2.8km to reach Deep Creek and the Rangitata River. Be aware that the track can become washed out from floods.

properties.Title: 24.RDR Intake
properties.subtitle: Rangitata River
properties.Description: Access Point 24 near the end of Klondyke Terrace Road and the RDR irrigation race intake, gives you access to the river by climbing down the bank beside the road.

properties.Title: 25.RDR fish screen bypass
properties.subtitle: Rangitata River
properties.Description: Access Point 25 is at the RDR Fish screen structure with a by-wash channel providing a track down to where it flows into the Rangitata River.

properties.Title: 26.RDR sediment sluice
properties.subtitle: Rangitata River
properties.Description: Access Point 25 is an easement which is provided here to get anglers across the paddock to the fence line then down to the riverbed where possible. Farm stock may be encountered so be sure to shut all gates.

properties.Title: 29.Rangitata Terrace Road
properties.subtitle: Rangitata River
properties.Description: Access Point 29 - Travel to the end of Rangitata Terrace Road to reach the river.

properties.Title: 33.Old Main South Road-North
properties.subtitle: Rangitata River
properties.Description: Access Point 33 - Drive to the end of Old Main South Road to reach the river. The final 200m of the track is suitable only for 4WD vehicles or walking. May provide jet boat launching at times.

properties.Title: 34.Irrigation Water Race
properties.subtitle: Rangitata River
properties.Description: Access Point 34 take the 4WD track that leads approximately 600m out to the river.

properties.Title: 35a.River Mouth/Lagoon-North
properties.subtitle: Rangitata River
properties.Description: Access Point 35a - Turn off Wrens Road and park in the carpark at the top of the cliff, which is accessible for all vehicles. An ATV/walking track leads down the terrace and then along the beach to the lagoon and rivermouth.

properties.Title: 35b.River Mouth/Lagoon-North
properties.subtitle: Rangitata River
properties.Description: Access Point 35b - Shortly after passing through the Huts Village, this track leads off to the lagoon. Note: A gravel slipway can be used to launch boats.

properties.Title: 35c.River Mouth/Lagoon-North
properties.subtitle: Rangitata River
properties.Description: Access Point 35c is highly variable due to channel alignment and the rivermouth position however, It can provide both river, lagoon and mouth access here.

properties.Title: 1.River mouth access - South
properties.subtitle: Ōpihi River
properties.Description: Access Point 1 is at the end of Connelly Road. River mouth access is gain from traversing the beach northward for approximately 1km. Regular use creates a 4WD vehicle track - use at your own risk.

properties.Title: 2a.Milford Huts - Davey Road
properties.subtitle: Ōpihi River
properties.Description: 'Access point 2a is via the end of Davey Road carpark with a track that leads out to Ōrakipaoa Creek. When the lagoon and creek water levels are low, this creek can be crossed to reach the beach, which then provides access to the North side of the Ōpihi River mouth.

properties.Title: 3.Wareing Road
properties.subtitle: Ōpihi River
properties.Description: Access point 3 is at the end of Waring Road and provides access from the stop bank to the river.

properties.Title: 4.Omara Road
properties.subtitle: Ōpihi River
properties.Description: Access point 4 is from Omara Road, off the corner of Ōrakipaoa Island Road.

properties.Title: 5.Waipopo Huts - Penny Lane
properties.subtitle: Ōpihi River
properties.Description: Access point 5 is via Penny Lane - a 4WD track within the Waipopo Huts Settlement. Penny Lane leads down to the Lagoon offering multiple access options.

properties.Title: 6.Waipopo Road
properties.subtitle: Ōpihi River
properties.Description: Access point 6 is off Waipopo Road, 400m before reaching Waipopo Huts. A track over the stop bank give access to the river.

properties.Title: 7.Seadown Rd - Grassy Banks
properties.subtitle: Ōpihi River
properties.Description: Access point 7 is known as Grassy Banks. It's at the Northern end of Seadown Road, giving access to the river berm track network.

properties.Title: 8a.State Highway 1
properties.subtitle: Ōpihi River
properties.Description: Access point 8a is on the Northern approach of the SH1 Bridge. A picnic area and 4WD track network gives access to the area between the road and train bridges and further downstream.

properties.Title: 8b.State Highway 1
properties.subtitle: Ōpihi River
properties.Description: Access point 8b provides carparking and access to 4WD tracks that offers multiple options to approach the river bed for the 1.5km reach above SH1.

properties.Title: 9.Arowhenua Rd
properties.subtitle: Ōpihi River
properties.Description: Access point 9 is a walk from the carpark along stop banks to near the bridge and one upstream point.

properties.Title: 10.Roaring Camp Road
properties.subtitle: Ōpihi River
properties.Description: Access point 10 is via the end of Roaring Camp Road.

properties.Title: 11.Waiapi Road
properties.subtitle: Ōpihi River
properties.Description: Access point 11 is at the end of Waiapi Road.

properties.Title: 12.Walker Road
properties.subtitle: Ōpihi River
properties.Description: Access point 12 is at the end of Walker Road.

properties.Title: 13.Kerrytown Road
properties.subtitle: Ōpihi River
properties.Description: Access point 13 is at the end of Kerrytown Road.

properties.Title: 14.Mill Road
properties.subtitle: Ōpihi River
properties.Description: Access point 14 is at the end of Mill Road.

properties.Title: 15. Butlers Huts
properties.subtitle: Ōpihi River
properties.Description: Access point 15 is via the end of Butlers Road at the Huts Settlement. Park at the end of Butlers Road and walk the canal stop bank and river tracks to reach the river. Please do not drive through the village lanes for access.

properties.Title: 16. Cone Road
properties.subtitle: Ōpihi River
properties.Description: Access point 16 is via the 4WD tracks that extend from the end of Cone Road

properties.Title: 17.Stratheona Huts - Saleyards Bridge
properties.subtitle: Ōpihi River
properties.Description: Access point 17 is via the end of Stratheona Road at the Huts settlement. Walk or drive the 4WD track 400m to the Saleyard Bridge area of the Opihi River.

properties.Title: 18.Old Bridge Road
properties.subtitle: Opihi River
properties.Description: Access point 18 is reached by driving to the end of Old Bridge Road.

properties.Title: 19. Beehive Road
properties.subtitle: Ōpihi River
properties.Description: Access point 19 is via the riverbed track network at the end of Beehive Road.

properties.Title: 20.Collett Road
properties.subtitle: Ōpihi River
properties.Description: Access point 20 is a Legal Public Access-way from the end of the road, via a farm track and stop bank track to the river..

properties.Title: 21. River Road
properties.subtitle: Ōpihi River
properties.Description: Access point 21 is via a 4WD track that leads approximately 350m directly out to the river through the willow and poplar plantation.

properties.Title: 22.Skinner Road
properties.subtitle: Ōpihi River
properties.Description: Access point 22 provides Legal Public Access down the farm track, along the fence-line to the stop bank, and out to the river via the track network.

properties.Title: 23.Opihi Road
properties.subtitle: Ōpihi River
properties.Description: Access point 23 is obtained from a sharp bend in Opihi Road. Follow the vehicle track to the river berm.

properties.Title: 24.Bats
properties.subtitle: Ōpihi River
properties.Description: Access point 24 is signposted Fish & Game access off Main Waitohi Road to a 4WD track network. It's about 500m through the trees to the river.

properties.Title: 25a.Hanging Rock Bridge
properties.subtitle: Ōpihi River
properties.Description: Access point 25a is a pull-off /picnic area on the Northern Bridge approach, offering easy access to the river along nearby tracks.

properties.Title: 25b.Hanging Rock Bridge
properties.subtitle: Ōpihi River
properties.Description: Access point 25b is a 4WD riverbed track that leads downstream via the Southern Bridge approach.

properties.Title: 26.Wigley Road-downstream
properties.subtitle: Ōpihi River
properties.Description: Access point 26 is a 4WD riverwork track off Wigley Road, giving access to the riverbed approximately 500m above Hanging Rock Bridge.

properties.Title: 27.Wigley Road - upstream
properties.subtitle: Ōpihi River
properties.Description: Access point 27 is via a 4WD track. After turning off Wigley Road, the track runs parallel with the farm fence for 250m, before a left turn takes you through the river berm trees and out to the river.

properties.Title: 28.Raincliff Bridge
properties.subtitle: Opuha/Ōpūaha River junction
properties.Description: Access point 28 is a pull-over car park area on the Southern approach to the Raincliff Bridge. Direct river access is available at the bridge, and nearby downstream, via a 4WD track.

properties.Title: 29.Spur Road
properties.subtitle: Ōpihi River
properties.Description: Access point 29 is via farm tracks accessible from Spur Road, near Raincliff Camp. Access to the river is via a 4WD river works track.

properties.Title: 30.Rockwood Bridge
properties.subtitle: Ōpihi River
properties.Description: Access point 30 is at Rockwood Bridge. Car parking is by the Northern Bridge approach, with direct access to the river available.

properties.Title: 31.Opihi Gorge Road
properties.subtitle: Opihi River
properties.Description: Access point 31 is at the end of Opihi Gorge Road. River access and the track network gives upstream and downstream angling options.

properties.Title: 32.Talbot Road
properties.subtitle: Ōpihi River
properties.Description: Access point 32 is via Talbot Road. Turn off onto the gravel road and drive the 400m to reach the riverbed.

properties.Title: 33.Fairlie Bridge
properties.subtitle: Ōpihi River
properties.Description: Access point 33 offers various options via numerous tracks at the approaches to Fairlie Bridge.

properties.Title: 34.Opihi Street
properties.subtitle: Ōpihi River
properties.Description: Access point 34 is a short track to the river, at the end of Opihi Street, on the outskirts of Fairlie Township.

properties.Title: 35.Kerrs Road
properties.subtitle: Ōpihi River
properties.Description: Access point 35 is made available on both sides of the river via Kerrs Road / Crossing. Turn off onto Kerrs Road via SH8 on the Western side, or alternatively, Clayton Road on the Eastern side of the river.

properties.Title: 36.Seddons Road
properties.subtitle: Ōpihi River
properties.Description: Access point 36 is made available on both sides of the river via Seddons Road / Crossing. Turn off onto Seddons Road via SH8 on the South-Western side, or alternatively, Hamilton Road on the North-Eastern side of the river.

properties.Title: 37. Stoneleigh Road
properties.subtitle: Ōpihi River
properties.Description: Access point 37 is made available on both sides of the river via Stoneleigh Road / Crossing. Turn off onto Stoneleigh Road via SH8 on the Southern side, or alternatively, Monument Road on the Northern side of the river.

properties.Title: 38.Cloudy Peaks Bridge
properties.subtitle: Ōpihi River
properties.Description: Access point 38 is at the Cloudy Peak Farm Access Bridge. Please be mindful to not block any access-ways when parking.

properties.Title: 39. Dobson Ski field turnoff - SH8
properties.subtitle: Ōpihi River
properties.Description: Access point 39 is a riverside carpark at the Dobson Ski Area turnoff, providing direct river access nearby.

properties.Title: 1. Lake Waitaki-Roadside 1
properties.subtitle: Lake Waitaki
properties.Description: Access point 1 provides roadside access to the lake shoreline and the A2O cycle trail for southbound traffic.

properties.Title: 2.Awahokomo Creek
properties.subtitle: Lake Waitaki
properties.Description: Access Point 2 is utilising the Awahokomo Creek bed to reach the lake shore. You will need to find safe roadside parking off SH83 and walk to the bridge to access the creek bed. Note - surrounding agricultural and residential land is private - including the former angler access track/boat launch on the Kurow side of the Awahokomo Creek Bridge.

properties.Title: 3.Lake Waitaki - Roadside 2
properties.subtitle: Lake Waitaki
properties.Description: Access point 3 gives roadside access to the lake shoreline and the A2O cycle trail for southbound traffic.

properties.Title: 4.Powerboat Club Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Waitaki
properties.Description: Access point 4 gives access to the lake shore and boat launching area via a private farm track. Please adhere to all landowner signage and keep to main access track.OPEN SEASON:All yearFISHING METHODS:Fly, Spin, BaitMIN SIZE LIMIT:Salmon only - 250mmDAILY BAG LIMIT:Sports fish - 4

properties.Title: 5.Below Aviemore Power Station
properties.subtitle: Lake Waitaki
properties.Description: Access point 5 is to an area of shoreline at the upper limit of Lake Waitaki on the true right. Walking access is gained from a carpark at the power station and a walkway, which services the Aviemore Spawning Race.Note - the spawning race is closed for fishing.

properties.Title: 6.Fisherman's Bend Campground turnoff
properties.subtitle: Lake Waitaki
properties.Description: Access point 6 provides several access tracks offering lake shoreline access.

properties.Title: 7a.Fisherman's Bend Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Waitaki
properties.Description: Access point 7a is at the lagoon. Boat launching for Lake Waitaki is available here. Access out to the top the lake may be impeded at low lake levels.

properties.Title: 9.Aviemore Dam Parking area
properties.subtitle: Lake Aviemore
properties.Description: Access point 9 is at the signposted Aviemore Dam Parking area. Access the nearby lake shore and dam wall from here.

properties.Title: 10.Aviemore Dam TL
properties.subtitle: Lake Aviemore
properties.Description: Access point 10 is near the Aviemore Dam on Te Akatarawa Road.

properties.Title: 11.Deep Stream Parking Area
properties.subtitle: Lake Aviemore
properties.Description: Access point 11 provides shoreline access to Lake Aviemore and the Deep Stream Arm of the lake.

properties.Title: 12.Lake Aviemore - roadside
properties.subtitle: Lake Aviemore
properties.Description: Access point 12 offers roadside access via State Highway 83 (Otematata-Kurow Road).

properties.Title: 13.Waitangi campground boat ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Aviemore
properties.Description: Access point 13 provides boat launching facilities at the Waitangi Campground.

properties.Title: 14. Parsons Rock Campground boat ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Aviemore
properties.Description: Access point 14 offers shoreline fishing and boat launching at Parsons Rock Campground boat ramp.

properties.Title: 15. Ōtematata River - mouth access
properties.subtitle: Lake Aviemore
properties.Description: Access point 15 is to the Ōtematata riverbed access track via the Boat Harbour. The riverbed can be walked to gain access to the mouth for fishing the lake when water levels are suitable.

properties.Title: 16. Boat Harbour Campground boat ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Aviemore
properties.Description: Access point 16 provides boat launching at the Boat Harbour Campground. Boat Harbour is signposted on State Highway 83. (Otematata-Kurow Road).

properties.Title: 17.Loch Laird Reserve
properties.subtitle: Lake Aviemore
properties.Description: Access point 17 offers multiple access points via the track network from the Loch Laird Campsite.

properties.Title: 18.Loch Laird Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Aviemore
properties.Description: Access point 18 provides a boat ramp and there is shoreline access at Loch Laird.

properties.Title: 19.TL-Below Dam Area
properties.subtitle: Lake Aviemore
properties.Description: Access point 19 offers shoreline access downstream of the dam and spillway via the track network, which is accessible from Te Akatarawa Road.OPEN SEASON:All yearFISHING METHODS:Fly, Spin, BaitMIN SIZE LIMIT:Salmon only - 250mmDAILY BAG LIMIT:Sports fish - 4

properties.Title: 6.Lake View-Roadside Access
properties.subtitle: Lake Benmore
properties.Description: Access point 6 is via the roadside parking opposite Lake View Road.

properties.Title: 12.Falstone Creek Campground boat ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Benmore
properties.Description: Access point 12 is at the Falstone Creek Campground and offers boat ramp and shoreline access.

properties.Title: 19. Ōhau C Canal-car park and locked gate
properties.subtitle: Hydro Canals
properties.Description: Access Point 19 - Park vehicle away from locked gate and walk downstream to salmon farms.

properties.Title: 1a.Glenburn Station car park
properties.subtitle: Ahuriri River
properties.Description: Access Point 1a provides lake edge access and an approximate 1.5km difficult unmarked walk to the lower Ahuriri River, near its mouth. This walk should only be attempted by fit and able anglers well prepared for a long trip.

properties.Title: 1b.Creek Crossing
properties.subtitle: Ahuriri River
properties.Description: Access Point 1b - 300m from the car parking area a small concrete foot bridge crosses the creek. From this crossing, the unmarked route follows a fence-line across to the corner of the actively farmed paddock where a culvert crosses the drain.

properties.Title: 1c.Drain Crossing
properties.subtitle: Ahuriri River
properties.Description: Access Point 1c - from the drain crossing, continue along the fence line and out to the riverbed. There are several creeks and wetland that may be difficult to traverse in this area.

properties.Title: 2.SH8 Bridge
properties.subtitle: Ahuriri River - Lower River and tributaries
properties.Description: Access Point 2 is a carpark at the bridge abutment. Walking access downstream from this point. The carpark is reached via a signposted track that runs parallel with SH8, accessed from Ben Omar Road.

properties.Title: 3.Ahuriri Bridge campsite
properties.subtitle: Ahuriri River - Lower River and tributaries
properties.Description: Access Point 3 is via the Ahuriri Bridge Conservation Area campsite, accessed from SH8. Walking access upstream is from here.

properties.Title: 4.DOC Easement
properties.subtitle: Ahuriri River - Lower River and tributaries
properties.Description: Access 4 is a signposted DOC walking easement. It's approximately a 2km walk to the river.

properties.Title: 5.Short Cut Road
properties.subtitle: Ahuriri River - Lower River and tributaries
properties.Description: Access Point 5 is a roadside parking area with a short track leading to the riverbed.

properties.Title: 6.Killermont
properties.subtitle: Ahuriri River - Lower River and tributaries
properties.Description: Access Point 6 provides a parking area off the highway that gives walking access to the river berm area.

properties.Title: 7.Longslip
properties.subtitle: Ahuriri River - Upper River and tributaries
properties.Description: Access Point 7 from SH8 turn off onto Birchwood Road,where there is a short 4WD track giving access just upstream of the Longslip Creek confluence with the Ahuriri River. Please adhere to any F&G signage in place.

properties.Title: 8.Ireland Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Ahuriri River - Upper River and tributaries
properties.Description: Access Point 8 provides riverbank access at the Ireland Road Bridge.

properties.Title: 9.Avon Burn
properties.subtitle: Ahuriri River - Upper River and tributaries
properties.Description: Access Point 9 is off Birchwood Road where you'll find a sign-posted DOC access-way near the Avon Burn Bridge.

properties.Title: 10.Te Araroa walkway easement
properties.subtitle: Ahuriri River - Upper River and tributaries
properties.Description: Access Point 10 is off Birchwood Road where you'll find a signposted carpark for the Te Araroa Trail. This then provides a 2km walk via a marked route to the Ahuriri River.

properties.Title: 11.Birch Creek
properties.subtitle: Ahuriri River - Upper River and tributaries
properties.Description: Access Point 11 is off Birchwood Road where you'll find a signposted DOC access track that provides walking or 4WD access approximately 900m to the river.

properties.Title: 12.Picnic table bend
properties.subtitle: Ahuriri River - Upper River and tributaries
properties.Description: Access Point 12 is on a prominent bend of the river and offers a picnic table and long drop toilet facility.

properties.Title: 13.Roadside
properties.subtitle: Ahuriri River - Upper River and tributaries
properties.Description: Access Point 13 - continue along Birchwood Road where you'll discover a 4WD track leading to the river from the main track.

properties.Title: 14.Base Hut river track
properties.subtitle: Ahuriri River - Upper River and tributaries
properties.Description: Access Point 14 - continue along Birchwood Road to the Ahuriri Base Hut, where you'll find a 4WD track opposite that leads down to the river.

properties.Title: 15.Birchwood Road end
properties.subtitle: Ahuriri River - Upper River and tributaries
properties.Description: Access Point 15 is the carpark the end of Birchwood Road. Walking access from here via the Ahuriri Valley Track to the upper most parts of the river.

properties.Title: 16.Ahuriri Lagoon 1
properties.subtitle: Ahuriri Lagoons
properties.Description: Access Point 16 along Birchwood Road, provides roadside parking adjacent to the large lagoon, that is a popular fishing spot.

properties.Title: 17.Ahuriri Lagoon 2
properties.subtitle: Ahuriri Lagoons
properties.Description: Access Point 17 along Birchwood Road, provides a short track to another popular fishing lagoon.

properties.Title: 1.Lake Ōhau Station
properties.subtitle: Lake Ōhau - Mackenzie Basin Lakes
properties.Description: Access Point 1 is at a carpark and kayak / small boat launching area at the head of the Lake off Lake Ohau Road. Anglers can walk the shoreline to reach the Hopkins Delta area from here.

properties.Title: 2.Lakeside track
properties.subtitle: Lake Ōhau - Mackenzie Basin Lakes
properties.Description: Access point 2 off Lake Ohau Road provides various shoreline access as a 4WD track network.

properties.Title: 3.Round Bush Camp
properties.subtitle: Lake Ōhau - Mackenzie Basin Lakes
properties.Description: Access Point 3 offers lake shore and boat ramp access at the Round Bush Campsite off Lake Ohau Road.

properties.Title: 4.Parsons Creek mouth
properties.subtitle: Lake Ōhau - Mackenzie Basin Lakes
properties.Description: Access point 4 off Lake Ohau Road provides walking access to the lake shore at Parsons Creek mouth.

properties.Title: 5.Freehold Creek mouth
properties.subtitle: Lake Ōhau
properties.Description: Access point 5 provides walking access to the lakeshore at Freehold Creek mouth.

properties.Title: 6.Lake Ōhau Track
properties.subtitle: Lake Ōhau - Mackenzie Basin Lakes
properties.Description: Access point 6 is the trail head for Lake Ōhau walking/cycle track off Lake Ohau Road. This track can be used for shoreline access

properties.Title: 7.Outlet boat ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Ōhau - Mackenzie Basin Lakes
properties.Description: Access point 7 is the formed boat ramp at the lakes natural outlet point. This boat ramp is accessed via either Glen Lyon Road / Ohau Canal Road.

properties.Title: 8.Port Bryson boat ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Ōhau - Mackenzie Basin Lakes
properties.Description: Access point 8 is the formed boat ramp off Glen Lyon Road, located near the Ohau Canal intake, at a place known as Port Bryson.

properties.Title: 9.Greta's Stream mouth
properties.subtitle: Lake Ōhau - Mackenzie Basin Lakes
properties.Description: Access point 9 is off Glen Lyon Road, park safely on the roadside for access to the lakeshore at Greta's Stream mouth.

properties.Title: 10.Dorcy Stream mouth
properties.subtitle: Lake Ōhau - Mackenzie Basin Lakes
properties.Description: Access point 10 is roadside access to the lakeshore at Dorcy Stream mouth, off Glen Lyon Road.

properties.Title: 1.Lake Middleton
properties.subtitle: Mackenzie Basin Lakes/Lake Middleton
properties.Description: Access point 1 off Lake Ohau Road providers shoreline access to Lake Middleton and a boat ramp.

properties.Title: 2.Kellands Pond
properties.subtitle: Mackenzie Basin Lakes / Kellands Pond
properties.Description: Access point 2 provides a track network around Kellands Pond that is adjacent to State Highway 8.

properties.Title: 3.Wairepo Arm
properties.subtitle: Mackenzie Basin Lakes/Wairepo Arm
properties.Description: Access point 3 is adjacent to State Highway 8 and provides a track network around the Western Shore of the Wairepo Arm.

properties.Title: 4.Wairepo Arm back road turnoff
properties.subtitle: Mackenzie Basin Lakes/Wairepo Arm
properties.Description: Access point 4 - take the turnoff from State Highway 8 along Wairepo Arm Back Road that skirts the Eastern side of Wairepo Arm. There are multiple shoreline access options here.OPEN SEASON:All yearFISHING METHODS:Fly, Spin, BaitMIN SIZE LIMIT:Salmon only - 250mmDAILY BAG LIMIT:Trout - 2 Salmon - 2 NOTE: An angler may fish from a boat EXCEPT when being propelled by a motor.

properties.Title: 5.Lake Ruataniwha Southern shoreline
properties.subtitle: Mackenzie Basin Lakes / Lake Ruataniwha
properties.Description: Access point 5 is the start of a 4WD track that skirts the Southern shoreline of lake Ruataniwha offering multiple shoreline access options. The track then follows the Ōhau River to the outlet of Lake Ōhau.

properties.Title: 6.Morrison Terrace boat ramp
properties.subtitle: Mackenzie Basin Lakes/Lake Ruataniwha
properties.Description: Access point 6 is at the public boat ramp from Morrison Terrace, off Max Snith Drive, providing access to Lake Ruataniwha.

properties.Title: 7.Shoreline Access Track
properties.subtitle: Mackenzie Basin Lakes / Lake Ruataniwha
properties.Description: Access point 7 begins at the start of a shoreline track that is accessible from Max Smith Drive.

properties.Title: 8.Ōhau A Tailrace
properties.subtitle: Mackenzie Basin Lakes / Lake Ruataniwha
properties.Description: Access point 8 is at the Ōhau A Power Station Tailrace on Max Smith Drive. The Tailrace forms the upper reach of Lake Ruataniwha.

properties.Title: 9.Loch Cameron
properties.subtitle: Mackenzie Basin Lakes / Loch Cameron
properties.Description: Access point 9 is off Glen Lyon Road at Loch Cameron, the venue for the annual Kids Salmon Fishing Day event and is also a popular swimming spot for locals in summer.

properties.Title: 10.Lake Merino
properties.subtitle: Mackenzie Basin Lakes / Lake Merino
properties.Description: Access point 10 provides walking access to Lake Merino. This is provided through private land so please be respectful.

properties.Title: 11.Lake Poaka
properties.subtitle: Mackenzie Basin Lakes / Lake Poaka
properties.Description: Access point 11 turn off Pukaki Canal North Road to the Lake Poaka Campsite area. From here, there are various angling opportunities.

properties.Title: 12.South End Huts
properties.subtitle: Mackenzie Basin Lakes / Lake Alexandrina / Takamana
properties.Description: Access point 12 is the turnoff to access the south end of Lake Alexandrina from Godley Peaks Road. It's a 2km drive to the lake for shoreline access by walking and for small boat launching.

properties.Title: 13.Outlet Huts Lake Alexandrina
properties.subtitle: Mackenzie Basin Lakes / Lake Alexandrina / Takamana
properties.Description: Access Point 13 provides shoreline and small boat launching at the Outlet Huts at Lake Alexandrina, via Lake Alexandrina Road.

properties.Title: 14.Lake McGregor southern shore
properties.subtitle: Mackenzie Basin Lakes / Lake McGregor / Whakarukumoana
properties.Description: Access point 14 provides roadside access [off Lake Alexandrina Road] to the southern shore of Lake McGregor.

properties.Title: 15.Lake McGregor northern shore
properties.subtitle: Mackenzie Basin Lakes / Lake McGregor / Whakarukumoana
properties.Description: Access point 15 is the carpark that provides walking access to the northern shore of Lake McGregor.

properties.Title: 16.Boundary Stream mouth
properties.subtitle: Mackenzie Basin Lakes / Lake Pūkaki
properties.Description: Access point 16 is at Boundary Stream mouth. A short tracks leads from State Highway 80 down to the lake edge, from the northern side of the bridge.

properties.Title: 17.Whale Stream mouth
properties.subtitle: Mackenzie Basin Lakes / Lake Pūkaki
properties.Description: Access point 17 is a 4WD track that leads to the lake edge near the mouth of Whale Stream. Access is via public land, but it is adjacent to Ferrintosh Station.

properties.Title: 18.Head of Lake - Glentanner Aerodrome
properties.subtitle: Mackenzie Basin Lakes / Lake Pūkaki
properties.Description: Access point 18 is at the head of Lake Pūkaki, near the northern end of the Glentanner Aerodrome. The car park is down a short track near the SH80, with walking access beyond. Outside of bird nesting season DOC unlocks the gate and vehicles can drive some 300m down a 4WD track, which can help with launching kayaks and small boats.

properties.Title: 19.Landslip Creek mouth
properties.subtitle: Mackenzie Basin Lakes / Lake Pūkaki
properties.Description: Access point 19 is at the mouth of Landslip Creek. A short 4WD track is accessible from Braemar Mount Cook Station Road.

properties.Title: 20.Boltons Gully Stream mouth
properties.subtitle: Mackenzie Basin Lakes / Lake Pūkaki
properties.Description: Access point 20 is off Hayman Road at Boltons Gully Stream mouth.

properties.Title: 21.Tekapo B Power Station
properties.subtitle: Mackenzie Basin Lakes / Lake Pūkaki
properties.Description: Access point 21 is off Hayman Road, where Tekapo B Power Station discharges into Lake Pūkaki. Walking access from multiple parking options in this area.

properties.Title: 1.Tekapo Power Boat Club boat ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Tekapo / Takapō
properties.Description: Access point 1 is the Power Boat Club boat ramp, accessed from Lakeside Drive.

properties.Title: 2.Shoreline access - Lakeside Drive road end
properties.subtitle: Lake Tekapo / Takapō
properties.Description: Access point 2 is located at the end of Lakeside Drive. Walking access along the shore, or use the walking track from here.

properties.Title: 3.McGregor Outlet
properties.subtitle: Lake Tekapo / Takapō
properties.Description: Access point 3 is via a 4WD track that intersects with Godley Peaks Road at the cattle stop. This provides shoreline access and small boat launching using 4WD vehicles.

properties.Title: 4.Cass River mouth access
properties.subtitle: Lake Tekapo/Takapō
properties.Description: Access point 4 is the Cass River bed, from Godley Peaks Road, near the Cass River Bridge. Walking and 4WD access is possible to Lake Tekapo when the river and track conditions are suitable. Please adhere to formed tracks and avoid all nesting birds.

properties.Title: 5.Lake Outlet
properties.subtitle: Lake Tekapo / Takapō
properties.Description: Access point 5 is the historic outlet channel, now controlled by the dam. It occasionally flows and It can be accessed from Pioneer Drive on its west side and Domain Road on its east side, with the walkway bridge crossing it.

properties.Title: 6.Lilybank Roadside 1
properties.subtitle: Lake Tekapo / Takapō
properties.Description: Access point 6 provides roadside access down a short vehicle track to the lake's edge.

properties.Title: 7.Lilybank Roadside 2
properties.subtitle: Lake Tekapo / Takapō
properties.Description: Access point 7 offers roadside access near a prominent point / headland. Using the walking access to lake edge, please be mindful to avoid disturbing any stock if present.

properties.Title: 8.Boundary Stream mouth
properties.subtitle: Lake Tekapo / Takapō
properties.Description: Access point 8 is off Lilybank Road, down the signposted DOC 4WD track to the end, near the Boundary Creek Bridge. From here, walk 250m along the lake shore to the creek mouth.

properties.Title: 9.Washdyke Stream mouth
properties.subtitle: Lake Tekapo / Takapō
properties.Description: Access point 9 provides shore line access at the Washdyke Creek mouth. A vehicle track must be driven or walked as accessed from Lilybank Road.

properties.Title: 10.Head of Lake Access
properties.subtitle: Lake Tekapo / Takapō
properties.Description: Access point 10 is a sign posted DOC access track off Lilybank Road.

properties.Title: 1.Rain gauge
properties.subtitle: Hakataramea River
properties.Description: Access point 1 is at the rain gauge off Hakataramea Pass Road. A short track to the carparking area. This is private and public land so please keep within the river margins.

properties.Title: 2.Roadside Access / DOC carpark
properties.subtitle: Hakataramea River
properties.Description: Access point 2 is DOC signposted to the river and Hunter Hills Conservation Area. This is private and public land so please stay within river margins.

properties.Title: 3.Hakataramea Downs Rd Bridge
properties.subtitle: Hakataramea River
properties.Description: Access point 3 is at Hakataramea Downs Road Bridge. Park clear of any gateways. This is private and public land so please stay within river margins.

properties.Title: 4.Grampian Stream Confluence
properties.subtitle: Hakataramea River
properties.Description: Access point 4 park roadside safely just to the south of Grampians Stream Bridge. This is private and public land, so please stay within river margins.

properties.Title: 5.Cattle Creek Bridge
properties.subtitle: Hakataramea River
properties.Description: Access point 5 is the bridge close to Cattle Creek, on Scott's Bridge Road. Park away from any gateways. This is private and public land so please keep to river margins.

properties.Title: 6.Mt Florence Rd Bridge
properties.subtitle: Hakataramea River
properties.Description: Access point 6 is at the Mount Florence Rd Bridge. Park on the western side away from tracks and gateways. This is private land so keep to the river margins.

properties.Title: 7.Wrights Crossing
properties.subtitle: Hakataramea River
properties.Description: Access point 7 is at the Wrights Crossing Road Bridge. Park safely on either side, away from any gateways. This is private land so please keep to river margins.

properties.Title: 8.Hatcheries Road
properties.subtitle: Hakataramea River
properties.Description: Access point 8 is near the end of Hatcheries Road. This is private and public land so please keep to river margins.

properties.Title: 9.Roadside access 1
properties.subtitle: Hakataramea River
properties.Description: Access point 9 is a carpark and picnicking area adjacent to McHenry's Road. Private and public land - Keep to river margins.OPEN SEASON:TROUT - First Saturday Nov - 30 April SALMON - First Saturday Nov - 31 MarchFISHING METHODS:Fly, SpinMINIMUM SIZE LIMIT:Salmon - 300mm, Trout - noneDAILY BAG LIMIT: Trout – 2SEASON BAG LIMIT:Salmon - refer to Note 9 of regulation guide.NOTE: All anglers must obtain a sea-run salmon licence to target or keep sea-run salmon.

properties.Title: 10.Roadside access 2
properties.subtitle: Hakataramea River
properties.Description: Access point 10 is a carpark and picnicking area adjacent to McHenry's Road. Follow the formed track to the river margin. This is private and public land, so please keep to river margins.

properties.Title: 11.Roadside Access 3
properties.subtitle: Hakataramea River
properties.Description: Access point 11 is a carpark and picnicking area adjacent to McHenry's Road. This is private and public land so please keep to river margins.

properties.Title: 12.Roadside Access 4
properties.subtitle: Hakataramea River
properties.Description: Access point 12 is a carpark and picnicking area adjacent to McHenry's Road. This is private and public land, so please keep to river margins.

properties.Title: 13.Hakataramea Bridge SH82
properties.subtitle: Hakataramea River
properties.Description: Access point 13 is at the SH82 Bridge at Hakataramea. A short distance up McHenry's Road a track gives access to the river bed. This is private and public land so please keep to the formed track that follows river margins.

properties.Title: 7b.Fishman's Bend boat ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Waitaki
properties.Description: Access point 7b is at the lagoon. Boat launching for Lake Waitaki is available here. Access out to the top of the lake may be impeded at low lake levels.

properties.Title: 1.Skipton's Bridge
properties.subtitle: Ōpuha / Ōpūaha Rivers
properties.Description: Access point 1 is at Skipton's Bridge. Parking is available on the western side of the bridge.

properties.Title: 2.Gudex Road
properties.subtitle: Ōpuha / Ōpūaha River
properties.Description: Access point 2 is a signposted 4WD farm track that leads out to the river.

properties.Title: 3.Junction
properties.subtitle: Ōpuha / Ōpūaha River
properties.Description: Access point 3 is a 4WD track near the Raincliff Bridge. The Ōpihi River can be crossed to access the Ōpuha River above the junction.

properties.Title: 4.SH8 Bridge picnic area
properties.subtitle: Tengawai / Te ana-a-wai River
properties.Description: Access point 4 is at the picnic area beside the SH8 Bridge.

properties.Title: 5.Butterworth Lane, Albury
properties.subtitle: Tengawai / Te ana-a-wai River
properties.Description: Access point 5 is signposted river access in the village of Albury. The river is reached at the end of Butterworth Lane.

properties.Title: 6.Kerr Road, Cave
properties.subtitle: Tengawai / Te ana-a-wai River
properties.Description: Access point 6 is a track to the river, near the Kerr Road Bridge, in the village of Cave.OPEN SEASON:1 Oct - 30 AprilFISHING METHODS:Fly, SpinMINIMUM SIZE LIMIT:Salmon - 300mm, Trout - noneDAILY BAG LIMIT: Trout – 2SEASON BAG LIMIT:SALMON - refer to Note 9 of regulation guide.NOTE: All anglers must obtain a sea-run salmon licence to target or keep sea-run salmon.

properties.Title: 7.O'Neil's Reserve
properties.subtitle: Tengawai / Te ana-a-wai River
properties.Description: Access point 7 is signposted by Fish & Game for access at O'Neil's Reserve.OPEN SEASON:1 Oct- 30 AprilFISHING METHODS:Fly, SpinMINIMUM SIZE LIMIT:Salmon - 300mm, Trout - noneDAILY BAG LIMIT: Trout – 2SEASON BAG LIMIT:SALMON - Refer to Note 9 of regulation guide.NOTE: All anglers must obtain a sea-run salmon licence to target or keep sea-run salmon.

properties.Title: 8.Cleland Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Tengawai / Te ana-a-wai River
properties.Description: Access point 8 is by the Cleland Road Bridge. Parking and river access is available on the Northern side of the bridge.

properties.Title: 9.Ryan's Crossing Road
properties.subtitle: Tengawai / Te ana-a-wai River
properties.Description: Access point 9 - turn off State Highway 8 and park at the end of Ryan's Crossing Road.

properties.Title: 10.Cross Road
properties.subtitle: Tengawai / Te ana-a-wai River
properties.Description: Access point 10 - turn off State Highway 8 and park at the end of Cross Road.

properties.Title: 11.Hammond Road
properties.subtitle: Tengawai / Te ana-a-wai River
properties.Description: Access point 11 - turn off State Highway 8 and park at the end of Hammond Road.

properties.Title: 12.Tengawai Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Tengawai / Te ana-a-wai River
properties.Description: Access point 12 is at the Tengawai Road Bridge. Access to the river is via a track on the southern side of the bridge.

properties.Title: 13.Golf Course
properties.subtitle: Temuka / Te umu kaha River
properties.Description: Access point 13 is via a 4WD track that leads off Domain Avenue at the Temuka Golf Club.

properties.Title: 14.King Street
properties.subtitle: Temuka / Te umu kaha River
properties.Description: Access point 14 is off State Highway 1 at King Street. Park safely near the bridge at the end of King Street.

properties.Title: 15.Manse Bridge
properties.subtitle: Temuka / Te umu kaha River
properties.Description: Access point 15 is the car parking area on the western side of Manse Bridge.

properties.Title: 16.Oxford Crossing
properties.subtitle: Waihī River
properties.Description: Access point 16 is at the end of Oxford Crossing Road via Earl Road. The junction of the Waihī and Haehae te moana rivers forms the Temuka River here.

properties.Title: 18.Winchester Bridge camp site
properties.subtitle: Waihī River
properties.Description: Access point 18 is at the camping ground adjacent to the State Highway 72 (Winchester-Geraldine Road) Bridge, accessed from Ferrier Road.

properties.Title: 19.Beeby Road Ford
properties.subtitle: Waihī River
