properties.Description: Access point 19 is at the Beeby Road Ford.

properties.Title: 20.Kennedy Park Bridge
properties.subtitle: Waihī River
properties.Description: Access point 20 in Geraldine, is at the Kennedy Park Bridge, as provided from Kennedy Park, off Wilson Street.

properties.Title: 1.Opuha Dam Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Opuha / Ōpūaha
properties.Description: Access point 1 is the boat ramp at Opuha Dam. From here, a walking track provides shoreline access around to Bennets Road Boat Ramp.

properties.Title: 2.Bennets Road Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Opuha / Ōpūaha
properties.Description: Access point 2 is the boat ramp at Opuha Dam. From here, a walking track provides shoreline access around to Opuha Dam Boat ramp.

properties.Title: 3.Trentham Road corner
properties.subtitle: Lake Opuha / Ōpūaha
properties.Description: Access point 3 gives roadside access to the lake shoreline beside Trentham Road.

properties.Title: 4.Trentham Road side track
properties.subtitle: Lake Opuha / Ōpūaha
properties.Description: Access point 4 gives lakeshore access at the end of a short vehicle track that leads off Trentham Road.

properties.Title: 5.Opuha Gorge Road
properties.subtitle: Lake Opuha / Ōpūaha
properties.Description: Access point 5 gives lakeshore access at the end of Opuha Gorge Road.

properties.Title: 6.Hays Road Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Opuha / Ōpūaha
properties.Description: Access point 6 is at the Hays Road Boat Ramp. Lakeshore access is available beyond the boat ramp.

properties.Title: 7.Clayton Rd Bridge
properties.subtitle: South Opuha / Ōpūaha River
properties.Description: Access point 7 is at the Clayton Road Bridge. Park on the Northern end, then the lake can be reached by walking down the riverbed.

properties.Title: 8.Clayton Settlement Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: North Opuha / Ōpūaha River
properties.Description: Access point 8 is via roadside access to the North Opuha River at the Clayton Settlement Road Bridge.

properties.Title: 9.Clayton Rd Bridge
properties.subtitle: North Opuha / Ōpūaha River
properties.Description: Access point 9 is via roadside access to the North Opuha River at the Clayton Road Bridge.

properties.Title: 17.Te Awa Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Waihī River
properties.Description: Access point 17 is a car parking area on the western side of the Te Awa Road Bridge.

properties.Title: 2b.Milford Hut-Stop bank Road
properties.subtitle: Ōpihi River
properties.Description: Access point 2b is adjacent to the huts and provides easy walking access to the lagoon and lower river area.

properties.Title: 1.Cobblestone Road
properties.subtitle: Kakanui River mouth
properties.Description: Access Point 1 is at the beach, Kakanui River mouth and the lagoon at the end of Cobblestone Road.

properties.Title: 2.Boat Sheds
properties.subtitle: Kakanui River
properties.Description: Access point 2 is at the Esplanade Playground and toilets on Harbour Terrace, opposite Stirling Street. A vehicle track leads down to the lagoon and boat launching area at the boat sheds.

properties.Title: 3.River Road
properties.subtitle: Kakanui River
properties.Description: Access point 3 is at the sharp bend of River Road. A walkway provides some riverbank access options upstream to the bridge.

properties.Title: 4.Waianakarua Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Kakanui River
properties.Description: Access point 4 is at the Waianakarua Road Bridge. Park safely at the Western end, where a walking track provides upstream access.

properties.Title: 5.SH1 Bridge
properties.subtitle: Kakanui River
properties.Description: Access 5 is at the South Western End of the State Highway 1 Bridge, adjacent to the Gull service station. Fit and able anglers can walk out to the river beside the bridge. Note; Island Stream must be crossed at a shallow riffle.

properties.Title: 6.Clark's Mill
properties.subtitle: Kakanui River
properties.Description: Access point 6 is down the end of a short vehicle track to be found opposite Clarke's Mill, on State Highway 1.

properties.Title: 7.Gemmell's Crossing Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Kakanui River
properties.Description: Access point 7 is at Gemmell's Crossing Road Bridge. Park at the picnic area on the western side of the bridge.

properties.Title: 8.Robb's Crossing Road
properties.subtitle: Kakanui River
properties.Description: Access point 8 is near the end of Robb's Crossing Road.

properties.Title: 9.Swimming Hole
properties.subtitle: Kakanui River
properties.Description: Access point 9 is a popular swimming hole downstream of the Fuchsia Creek Road Bridge.

properties.Title: 10.Dunrobin Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Kaikanui River
properties.Description: Access point 10 is at the Dunrobin Road Bridge. Anglers can scramble down to the river at the bridge or follow the 4WD track upstream to find access.

properties.Title: 5.Orari River Road
properties.subtitle: Ōrāri River
properties.Description: Access point 5 is a walking track that leads down to the river, at the end of Ōrāri River Road.

properties.Title: 4.Andrew Stream Road
properties.subtitle: Ōrāri River- roadside access
properties.Description: Access point 4 is adjacent to Andrew's Stream Road where a gap in the trees provides access to the riverbed.

properties.Title: 3.Milford Clandeboye Rd Bridge
properties.subtitle: Ōrāri River
properties.Description: Access point 3 is a the Milford Clandeboye Road Bridge. Park on the north side.

properties.Title: 2.Parke Road
properties.subtitle: Ōrāri River
properties.Description: Access point 2 is at the corner of Parke Road, where it meets the river's stopbank.

properties.Title: 1.Ōrāri River mouth
properties.subtitle: Ōrāri River
properties.Description: Access point 1 is at the mouth of the Orari River, via the end of Parke Road.

properties.Title: 1.SH1 South
properties.subtitle: Pareora River / Pureora
properties.Description: Access Point 1 is at the southern approach to the State Highway 1 Bridge. A vehicle track leads to a parking area, adjacent to the river. Then a 4WD track leads down river as far as the train bridge. Lagoon access can be gained by walking downstream from the train bridge.

properties.Title: 2.SH1 North
properties.subtitle: Pareora River / Pureora
properties.Description: Access Point 2 is at the northern approach to the State Highway 1 [Waimate Highway] Bridge. A vehicle track leads to a parking area adjacent to the river.

properties.Title: 3.Brassell Rd Bridge
properties.subtitle: Pareora River / Pureora
properties.Description: Access point 3 is on the southern side of Brassell Road Bridge. A short vehicle track offers parking options, then access to the riverbed.

properties.Title: 4.Jeff Coates Rd
properties.subtitle: Pareora River / Pureora
properties.Description: Access point 4 is at the end of Jeff Coates Road. This road, and the track from the end of the road to the riverbed, are only suitable for 4WD vehicles.

properties.Title: 5.Holme Station Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Pareora River / Pureora
properties.Description: Access point 5 is at Holme Station Road Bridge. Short vehicle tracks provide parking to riverbed access on the southern side of the bridge.

properties.Title: 6.Purves Road corner
properties.subtitle: Pareora River / Pureora
properties.Description: Access point 6 is on a prominent bend on Purves Road. Park your car safely near Purves Road, or drive down onto the riverbed.

properties.Title: 7.Evans Crossing
properties.subtitle: Pareora River / Pureora
properties.Description: Access point 7 is at the ford on Evans Crossing Road (Pareora Ford Road). Park safely either side of the ford then follow a signposted walkway along the true-left bank of the river up to the historic dam.

properties.Title: 1.Glen Lyon Road Ford
properties.subtitle: Fraser Stream
properties.Description: Access point 1 is at Glen Lyon Road Ford. Park either side of the ford. Keep to the river margins to stay on public land.

properties.Title: 2.Rhoboro Downs Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Twizel River / Whakatipu
properties.Description: Access point 2 is at the Rhoboro Downs Road Bridge.

properties.Title: 3.Twizel River Trail carpark-upper section
properties.subtitle: Twizel River / Whakatipu
properties.Description: Access point 3 is the DOC signposted river trail carpark on Glen Lyon Road.

properties.Title: 4.State Highway 8 Bridge
properties.subtitle: Twizel River / Whakatipu
properties.Description: Access point 4 is the anglers carpark at the State Highway 8 Bridge.

properties.Title: 5.Twizel River Trail-lower section
properties.subtitle: Twizel River / Whakatipu
properties.Description: Access point 5 is a DOC signposted access point for the lower section of the Twizel River Trail, adjacent to State Highway 8. Park on the berm out of the way of driveways and gates, or walk from the bridge carpark to the river.

properties.Title: 6.Twizel River Ford
properties.subtitle: Twizel River / Whakatipu
properties.Description: Access point 6 is where the 4WD track that follows the true-left of the Lower Ōhau River fords the Twizel River. This 4WD track is accessed from Old Bridge Road. Ford the river at your own risk, as the ford condition and river levels are subject to change!

properties.Title: 7.Lower Ōhau Ford
properties.subtitle: Ōhau River - lower reaches
properties.Description: Access point 7 is where the 4WD track fords the Lower Ōhau River. Ford the river at your own risk, as the ford condition and river levels are subject to change!

properties.Title: 8.Pūkaki River Ford
properties.subtitle: Pūkaki River
properties.Description: Access point 8 is where the 4WD track fords the Pūkaki River. Displayed for access information only - fishing in adjacent Tekapo River. Ford the river at your own risk, as the ford condition and river levels are subject to change!

properties.Title: 9.Iron Bridge
properties.subtitle: Tekapo River / Takapō
properties.Description: Access point 9 is at the Iron Bridge.

properties.Title: 10.Powerlines
properties.subtitle: Tekapo River / Takapō
properties.Description: Access point 19 is where the Haldon Camp 4WD track meets the Tekapo river and the powerlines cross the river.

properties.Title: 11.Grays River ford
properties.subtitle: Grays River
properties.Description: Access point 10 is at the Grays River Ford. Ford river at your own risk! Ford the river at your own risk, as the ford condition and river levels are subject to change!

properties.Title: 12.Mary Burn ford
properties.subtitle: Mary Burn / Te Kōhai
properties.Description: Access point 11 is at the Mary Burn ford. Ford the river at your own risk, as the ford condition and river levels are subject to change!

properties.Title: 13.Mary Burn track carpark
properties.subtitle: Mary Burn / Te Kōhai
properties.Description: Access point 12 is a signposted DOC carpark at the trailhead for the Mary Burn walking track.

properties.Title: 14.Grays River
properties.subtitle: Grays River
properties.Description: Access point 14 is a Fish & Game signposted access track that leads to Grays River, as accessed from Haldon Road. The farm track starts 280m north of the Mackenzie Pass intersection. Access is private and public land - So please keep to river margins.

properties.Title: 15.Grays River
properties.subtitle: Grays River
properties.Description: Access point 15 is a Fish & Game signposted access track that leads to Grays River, as accessed from Haldon Road. The farm track starts 240m north of the major powerlines that cross Haldon Road. Access is private and public land - So please keep to river margins.

properties.Title: 16.Tekapo River 4WD track northern end
properties.subtitle: Tekapo River / Takapō
properties.Description: Access point 16 is the start of the Tekapo River 4WD track on the true right of the river as accessed from the Tekapo Canal Road via Tekapo Powerhouse Road.

properties.Title: 17.Patersons Ponds
properties.subtitle: Tekapo River / Takapō
properties.Description: Access point 17 is at the Patersons Ponds carpark and toilet, where river access is easily gained.

properties.Title: 18.Upper Ōhau River TL-lower reaches
properties.subtitle: Upper Ōhau River
properties.Description: Access point 18 is near the mouth of the Upper Ōhau River. A 4WD track near Ōhau A Power station follows the true right bank of the tailrace to reach this access point.

properties.Title: 19.Upper Ōhau TR - lower reaches
properties.subtitle: Upper Ōhau River
properties.Description: Access point 19 is a spot to park and walk down to the riverbed on the true right of the river. This access utilises the 4WD river track that starts at SH8 and travels through to the Ōhau Weir. The track can be rough in places.

properties.Title: 20.Top end of TR Ōhau River
properties.subtitle: Upper Ōhau River - Lake Ruataniwha 4WD track
properties.Description: Access point 20 is the start of the Ōhau River 4WD track, that follows the true right of the river, then continues along Lake Ruataniwha to State Highway 8. Please note that the track can be rough in places.

properties.Title: 21.Top end of TL Ōhau River
properties.subtitle: Upper Ōhau River - 4WD track
properties.Description: Access point 21 is the turnoff at the top end of the 4WD track, that follows the true left of the Ōhau River for approximately half its length. Please note, the track is becoming overgrown by wilding pines in the middle section possibly providing limited access.

properties.Title: 22.Bottom end of TL Ōhau River 4WD track
properties.subtitle: Upper Ōhau River - 4WD track
properties.Description: Access point 22 is the turnoff at the lower end of the 4WD track that follows the true left of the Ōhau River for approximately half its length. Please note, the track is becoming overgrown by wilding pines in the middle section possibly providing limited access.

properties.Title: 1.Lower Beach Road
properties.subtitle: Ashburton River / Hakatere
properties.Description: Access point 1 is at the beach near the south side of the river mouth and lagoon as accessed from the end of Lower Beach Road. Walk along the beach to reach the mouth and lagoon. A track network also provides 4WD and walking access across to the lagoon and upstream to the river.

properties.Title: 2.Hakatere Huts
properties.subtitle: Ashburton River / Hakatere
properties.Description: Access point 2 is the carpark overlooking the lagoon at the end of River Road at Hakatere Huts Settlement. A walking track traverses from the carpark down to the river / lagoon.

properties.Title: 3.Croys Road - South
properties.subtitle: Ashburton River / Hakatere
properties.Description: Access point 3 is at the end of Croys Road on the South side of the river. A 4WD track must be driven or walked for approximately 500m to reach the river bank.

properties.Title: 4.Croys Rd - North
properties.subtitle: Ashburton River / Hakatere
properties.Description: Access point 4 is at the end of Croys Road on the North bank of the river. The Ashburton walkway may provide access options upstream and down.

properties.Title: 5.Gibsons Road
properties.subtitle: Ashburton River / Hakatere
properties.Description: Access point 5 is at the end of Gibson Road.

properties.Title: 6.Smalls Road
properties.subtitle: Ashburton River / Hakatere
properties.Description: Access point 6 is at the end of Smalls Road.

properties.Title: 7.Wakanui School Road
properties.subtitle: Ashburton River / Hakatere
properties.Description: Access point 7 is at the end of Wakanui School Road. A 500m long 4WD track provides access to the river bed from the end of the road.

properties.Title: 8.Perimeter Road
properties.subtitle: Ashburton River / Hakatere
properties.Description: Access point 8 is from a car parking area, near the paintball venue, via access from Perimeter Road, Lake Hood. A track leads out to the river from here.

properties.Title: 9.Lake Hood Intake
properties.subtitle: Ashburton River / Hakatere
properties.Description: Access point 9 is at the carpark where the intake channel enters Lake Hood. Walk the intake channel bank track 800m to reach the river.

properties.Title: 10.Roadside Access - River Road
properties.subtitle: Ashburton River / Hakatere
properties.Description: Access point 10 is adjacent to River Road, where a gap in the riparian vegetation provides access directly to the riverbed. Park safely on the roadside.

properties.Title: 11.Cochranes Road
properties.subtitle: Ashburton River / Hakatere
properties.Description: Access point 11 is at the end of Cochranes Road.

properties.Title: 12.Boundary Road
properties.subtitle: Ashburton River / Hakatere
properties.Description: Access point 12 is at the end of Boundary Road. To reach the river, take the left hand / upstream vehicle track. 2WD vehicles can park about 50m from the river bed, with walking or 4WD required for final part of track.

properties.Title: 13.Milton Road South
properties.subtitle: Ashburton River / Hakatere
properties.Description: Access point 13 is at the end of Milton Road South.

properties.Title: 15.Trevors Road
properties.subtitle: Ashburton River / Hakatere
properties.Description: Access point 15 is at the end of Trevors Road.

properties.Title: 16.Robilliard Park car park
properties.subtitle: Ashburton River / Hakatere
properties.Description: Access point 16 is from the Robilliard Park car park with a approximately 200m walk from the car park out to the river.

properties.Title: 17.SH1 Bridge - north
properties.subtitle: Ashburton River / Hakatere
properties.Description: Access point 17 is a carpark area at the northern side of the State Highway 1 Bridge, as accessed by Northbound traffic.

properties.Title: 18.SH1 Bridge - River walkway carpark
properties.subtitle: Ashburton River / Hakatere
properties.Description: Access point 18 is at the riverwalk car park on the southern side of the State Highway 1 Bridge. Access to the riverbed at the bridge, with walkways providing further angling options.

properties.Title: 19.Melrose Road
properties.subtitle: Ashburton River / Hakatere
properties.Description: Access point 19 is at the end of Melrose Road. The junction of the North and South branches of the river meet just upstream of this point.

properties.Title: 20.Smyths Road
properties.subtitle: Ashburton River / Hakatere - North Branch
properties.Description: Access point 20 is at the end of Smyths Road.

properties.Title: 21.Hills Road
properties.subtitle: Ashburton River / Hakatere
properties.Description: Access point 21 is at the end of Hills Road.

properties.Title: 22.Blacks Road
properties.subtitle: Ashburton River / Hakatere - South Branch
properties.Description: Access point 22 is at the end of Blacks Road. A 4WD track around the back of the quarry leads out to the riverbed.

properties.Title: 23.Sheates Road
properties.subtitle: Ashburton River / Hakatere - South Branch
properties.Description: Access point 23 is at the end of Sheates Road.

properties.Title: 24.Olivers Road
properties.subtitle: Ashburton River / Hakatere - South Branch
properties.Description: Access point 24 is at the end of Olivers Road.

properties.Title: 25.Walkhams Road
properties.subtitle: Ashburton River / Hakatere - South Branch
properties.Description: Access point 25 is at the end of Walkhams Road.

properties.Title: 26.Mayfield Valetta Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Ashburton River / Hakatere - South Branch
properties.Description: Access point 26 is at Mayfield Valetta Road Bridge. A 4WD track with parking provides access on the northern side of the bridge.

properties.Title: 27.RDR Canal
properties.subtitle: Ashburton River / Hakatere - South Branch
properties.Description: Access point 27 is at the RDR canal. Park on the roadside and walk north along the canal bank 1km to reach the river.

properties.Title: 28.Mt Somers
properties.subtitle: Ashburton River / Hakatere - South Branch
properties.Description: Access point 28 is at the intersection of State Highway 72 and Hoods Road at Mt Somers Village. Park on the roadside and walk down to the river to access the riverbed adjacent to the bridge.

properties.Title: 30.Stour Reserve
properties.subtitle: Ashburton River / Hakatere - South Branch
properties.Description: Access point 30 is at the Western End of the Stour Bridge providing a track leads down 400m to the confluence of the Stour River and South Branch of the Ashburton River.

properties.Title: 31.Ashburton Gorge Bridge / Blowing Point
properties.subtitle: Ashburton River / Hakatere - South Branch
properties.Description: Access point 31 is at the Blowing Point Bridge. Park safely and walk to the river from the eastern side of the bridge.

properties.Title: 32.Tramway Road
properties.subtitle: Taylors Stream
properties.Description: Access point 32 is roadside parking on Tramway Road, 200m from the intersection with Mayfield Valetta Road. A short 4WD track leads to the riverbank. The confluence of Bowyers and Taylors streams can be reached by walking upstream from here.

properties.Title: 33.Ashburton Staveley Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Taylors Stream
properties.Description: Access point 33 is at the Ashburton-Staveley Road Bridge. A short track down the bridge's southern side provides safe parking.

properties.Title: 34.Taylors Stream Reserve
properties.subtitle: Taylors Stream
properties.Description: Access point 34 is at the Taylors Stream Reserve beside the State Highway 72 bridge. Camping is available and public toilets are provided.

properties.Title: 35.Bowyers Stream picnic area
properties.subtitle: Bowyers Stream
properties.Description: Access point 35 is at the Bowyers Stream picnic area beside the State Highway 72 bridge. Public toilets are provided.

properties.Title: 28.Shepherds Bush Rd
properties.subtitle: Rangitata River
properties.Description: Access Point 28 is a farm track through a pine forest. The track takes approximately 25 minutes to walk, as it zig-zags down hill towards the river.

properties.Title: 31.Jones Road
properties.subtitle: Rangitata River
properties.Description: Access Point 31 is a gravel road, opposite Jones Road, that leads 1.3km to a braid of the Rangitata River at the major powerlines.

properties.Title: 1b.Lake Heron / Ōtūroto -Harrisons Bight 4WD access track car park
properties.subtitle: Lake Heron
properties.Description: Access Point 1b is the designated car park for the 4WD access track. Apply for vehicle access permits on the DOC website.

properties.Title: 1c.Lake Heron / Ōtūroto -Harrisons Bight
properties.subtitle: Ashburton Lakes / Lake Heron
properties.Description: Access point 1c is the end of the unmarked walking track that starts at the Harrison Bight carpark - traverse the slope down to the waters edge where safe to do so.

properties.Title: 8(a).Ross Road / Bells Pond
properties.subtitle: Waitaki River
properties.Description: Access point 8(a) to reach Bells Pond is via Ross Road. All vehicle accessible. Private land with cooperative landowner.

properties.Title: 2.Kelvin Heights Boat Ramp

properties.Title: 4.Twelve Mile Creek Delta
properties.subtitle: Lake Wakatipu
properties.Description: Access Point 4 is at the end of 12 Mile Delta Road, with a short walk to the Twelve Mile Creek Delta. Angler access information sign.OPEN SEASON:All Year*SIZE LIMIT: N/AFISHING METHODS:Fly, Spin, BaitDAILY BAG LIMIT:Trout: 2, Salmon: 4

properties.Title: 7.Glenorchy Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Wakatipu
properties.Description: Access Point 7 is at the Glenorchy Boat Ramp off Benmore Place. Angler access information sign.OPEN SEASON:All Year*SIZE LIMIT: N/AFISHING METHODS:Fly, Spin, BaitDAILY BAG LIMIT:Trout: 2, Salmon: 4

properties.Title: 8.Dart Delta
properties.subtitle: Lake Wakatipu
properties.Description: Access Point 8 is at Kinlock, off Kinloch Road. Camping available, with access to the Dart River Delta. Angler access information sign.OPEN SEASON:All Year*SIZE LIMIT: N/AFISHING METHODS:Fly, Spin, BaitDAILY BAG LIMIT:Trout: 2, Salmon: 4

properties.Title: 1.Wanaka Marina Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Wanaka
properties.Description: Access Point 1 is the boat ramp in Wanaka Marina off Lakeside Road. Angler access information sign.OPEN SEASON:All Year*SIZE LIMIT: N/AFISHING METHODS:Fly, Spin, BaitDAILY BAG LIMIT:Trout: 2, Salmon: 4

properties.Title: 2.Outlet Camp Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Wanaka
properties.Description: Access Point 2 is at Outlet Camp off Outlet Road. Toilet facilities and ample parking. Angler access information sign.OPEN SEASON: All Year*SIZE LIMIT: N/AFISHING METHODS:Fly, Spin, BaitDAILY BAG LIMIT:Trout: 2, Salmon: 4

properties.Title: 3.Rotary Park Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Wanaka
properties.Description: Access Point 3 is at the Rotary Park Boat ramp off Wanaka-Mt Aspiring Road. Toilet facilities and ample parking. Angler access information sign.OPEN SEASON: All Year*SIZE LIMIT: N/AFISHING METHODS:Fly, Spin, BaitDAILY BAG LIMIT:Trout: 2, Salmon: 4

properties.Title: 4.Waterfall Creek Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Wanaka
properties.Description: Access Point 4 is at the end of Ruby Island Road at the Waterfall Creek Boat ramp - launch off the beach. Angler access information sign.OPEN SEASON:All Year*SIZE LIMIT: N/AFISHING METHODS:Fly, Spin, BaitDAILY BAG LIMIT:Trout: 2, Salmon: 4

properties.Title: 5.Camp Creek Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Wanaka
properties.Description: Access Point 5 is off Haast Pass-Makarora Road (SH6) at the Camp Creek Boat ramp - launch off the beach.OPEN SEASON:All Year*SIZE LIMIT: N/AFISHING METHODS:Fly, Spin, BaitDAILY BAG LIMIT:Trout: 2, Salmon: 4

properties.Title: 6.Boundary Creek
properties.subtitle: Lake Wanaka
properties.Description: Access Point 6 is off Hasst Pass-Makarora Road (SH6) at Boundary Creek angler access.OPEN SEASON:All Year*SIZE LIMIT: N/AFISHING METHODS:Fly, Spin, BaitDAILY BAG LIMIT:Trout: 2, Salmon: 4

properties.Title: 7.Wharf Creek Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Wanaka
properties.Description: Access Point 7 is off Haast Pass-Makarora Road (SH6) at Wharf Creek Boat ramp - launch off the beach. Angler access information sign.OPEN SEASON:All Year*SIZE LIMIT: N/AFISHING METHODS:Fly, Spin, BaitDAILY BAG LIMIT:Trout: 2, Salmon: 4

properties.Title: 8.Paddock Bay
properties.subtitle: Lake Wanaka
properties.Description: Access Point 8 is at Paddock Bay -Off Buchanan Rise, access is across the fields.OPEN SEASON:All Year*SIZE LIMIT: N/AFISHING METHODS:Fly, Spin, BaitDAILY BAG LIMIT:Trout: 2, Salmon: 4

properties.Title: 9.Cattle Flat
properties.subtitle: Lake Wanaka
properties.Description: Access Point 9 is at Cattle Flat with angler access to the Matukituki River Delta.OPEN SEASON:All Year*SIZE LIMIT: N/AFISHING METHODS:Fly, Spin, BaitDAILY BAG LIMIT:Trout: 2, Salmon: 4

properties.Title: 1.Lake Hawea Holiday Park Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Hawea
properties.Description: Access Point 1 is off Haast Pass-Makarora Road (SH6) at the boat ramp in the Lake Hawea Holiday Park. Angler access information sign.OPEN SEASON:All YearSIZE LIMIT: N/AFISHING METHODS:Fly, Spin, BaitDAILY BAG LIMIT:Trout: 2, Salmon: 4

properties.Title: 2.Craig Burn Delta
properties.subtitle: Lake Hawea
properties.Description: Access Point 2 is off Haast Pass-Makarora Road (SH6) at Craig Burn to the Craig Burn Delta.OPEN SEASON:All YearSIZE LIMIT: N/AFISHING METHODS:Fly, Spin, BaitDAILY BAG LIMIT:Trout: 2, Salmon: 4

properties.Title: 3.The Neck Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Hawea
properties.Description: Access point 3 turn off Haast Pass-Makarora Road (SH6) onto Meads Road and find the Neck Boat ramp - launch off the beach. Angler access information sign.OPEN SEASON:All YearSIZE LIMIT: N/AFISHING METHODS:Fly, Spin, BaitDAILY BAG LIMIT:Trout: 2, Salmon: 4

properties.Title: 4.Kidds Bush
properties.subtitle: Lake Hawea

properties.Title: 5.Timaru River Delta
properties.subtitle: Lake Hawea
properties.Description: Access Point 5 offers access to the Timaru River Delta via Timaru Creek Road, with a formed track to the delta.

properties.Description: Access Point 1 is at the West Dam boat ramp, off Fruitgrowers Road.OPEN SEASON:All YearSIZE LIMIT: N/AFISHING METHODS:Fly, Spin, BaitDAILY BAG LIMIT:Trout: 2, Salmon: 4

properties.Title: 3.Champagne Gully Boat Ramp

properties.Title: 5.Bendigo Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Dunstan
properties.Description: Access Point 5 is at the Bendigo Boat ramp, off Cromwell Clyde Road (SH8). Toilet facilities available. Angler access information sign.OPEN SEASON:All YearSIZE LIMIT: N/AFISHING METHODS:Fly, Spin, BaitDAILY BAG LIMIT:Trout: 2, Salmon: 4

properties.Description: Access Point 8 is at the Bannockburn Inlet Boat ramp off Cairnmuir Road.OPEN SEASON:All YearFISHING METHODS:Fly, Spin, BaitDAILY BAG LIMIT:Trout: 2, Salmon: 4

properties.Title: 1.Dam Wall Boat Ramp
properties.subtitle: Lake Roxburgh

properties.Title: Lake Johnson
properties.subtitle: Wakatipu Basin Gems
properties.Description: Lake Johnson - Only a few minutes drive north from Frankton, this small lake holds trout and perch. It contains no natural spawning grounds so is stocked with rainbow trout from the Macraes Hatchery. Park at the end of Hansen Road and walk to the Lake (Look for Fish & Game sign).OPEN SEASON:1st Oct - 30 SeptSIZE LIMIT: NoneFISHING METHODS:Fly, Spin, BaitDAILY BAG LIMIT:Trout - 1

properties.Title: Diamond Lake
properties.subtitle: Central Otago
properties.Description: 'Diamond Lake - Is also located in the Management Reserveand is an excellent fishery, especially later in the season when water temperatures rise and snow melt from the Earnslaw Burn clears. Turn off Glenorchy-Paradise Road where there's ample parking.OPEN SEASON:1st Oct - 30 SeptSIZE LIMIT: NoneFISHING METHODS:Fly, SpinDAILY BAG LIMIT:Trout - 2

properties.Title: Von Lake
properties.subtitle: Wakatipu Basin Gems
properties.Description: Von Lake - Is small high country tarn in the head of the Von Valley is entirely land-locked, there are no spawning streams. At the end off Von Road, run holder permission is required for access. 4WD only.OPEN SEASON:1st Nov - 31st MaySIZE LIMIT: NoneFISHING METHODS:Fly onlyDAILY BAG LIMIT:Trout - 1

properties.Title: Lake Rere
properties.subtitle: Wakatipu Basin Gems
properties.Description: Lake Rere - Is a small bush clad backcountry tarn situated in a saddle between the Greenstone River and Lake Wakatipu. Access is along a tramping track which starts at the Greenstone Car Park.OPEN SEASON:1st Nov - 31st MaySIZE LIMIT: NoneFISHING METHODS:Fly, SpinDAILY BAG LIMIT:Trout - 1

properties.Title: Lake McKellar
properties.subtitle: Wakatipu Basin Gems
properties.Description: Lake McKellar - Is the source of the Greenstone River and is surrounded by beech forest Please note: that spin or bait fishing is not permitted in the nearby Greenstone or Caples Rivers. Access is along a tramping track which starts at the Greenstone Car Park and finishes at the Routeburn Track carpark off State Highway 94.OPEN SEASON:1st Nov - 31st MaySIZE LIMIT: NoneFISHING METHODS:Fly, SpinDAILY BAG LIMIT:Trout - 1

properties.Title: Lake Sylvan
properties.subtitle: Wakatipu Basin Gems
properties.Description: Lake Sylvan - Is a small beech forest clad lake situated in a basin just north of the Lower Routeburn River and is approximately 1 km long. Access is along a tramping track which starts at the Lake Sylvan DoC Campground.OPEN SEASON:1st Oct - 30th SeptSIZE LIMIT: NoneFISHING METHODS:Fly, Spin, BaitDAILY BAG LIMIT:Trout - 6

properties.Title: The Glenorchy Lagoons
properties.subtitle: Wakatipu Basin Gems
properties.Description: The Glenorchy Lagoons - Is located just north of the Glenorchy Township and these shallow productive waterways can produce some exciting fishing. Park at the end of Oban Street and walk the trail around the Lagoon shore.OPEN SEASON:1st Oct - 30th SeptSIZE LIMIT: NoneFISHING METHODS:Fy, SpinDAILY BAG LIMIT:Trout - 1

properties.Title: Lake Dispute

properties.Title: Lake Hayes

Alternatively, park at the Lake Hayes Lookout carpark at the northern end.OPEN SEASON:1st Oct - 30 SeptSIZE LIMIT: NoneFISHING METHODS:Fly, Spin, BaitDAILY BAG LIMIT:Trout - 2

properties.Title: Reid’s Lake
properties.subtitle: Wakatipu Basin Gems

Park off Priory Road and take the Diamond Creek Track about 2kms to the Lake.OPEN SEASON:1st Oct - 30 SeptSIZE LIMIT: NoneFISHING METHODS:Fly, SpinDAILY BAG LIMIT:Trout - 1

properties.Description: Travel to the end of Greenstone Station Road, access downstream from the Greenstone Station car park swing bridge.

properties.Title: Greenstone River
properties.subtitle: Designated Water
properties.Description: Upstream from the Greenstone Station car park swing bridge. NOTE: The Greenstone River between the SlyBurn confluence & McKellar Hut swing bridge is a Controlled Fishery from February 1st to March 31st.

properties.Title: Camp Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Hawea River
properties.Description: Access at the bridge on Camp Hill Road with plenty of safe parking either side. Easy track along the river up and downstream.

properties.Title: Hunter River
properties.subtitle: Designated Water
properties.Description: To get to the Hunter River follow Meads Road until it turns into Hunter Station Road and travel to the end. This is a private road and permission must be obtained from the landowner.

properties.Title: Kahiku Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Kaihiku Stream
properties.Description: From SH1, turn off at either Moa Hill Road or Mill Road to connect to Kahiku Road. Park safely near the bridge for upstream and downstream access.

properties.Title: Brighton Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Kaikorai Stream
properties.Description: From SH1, turn off onto Main South Road to connect to Brighton Road. Park safely near the Brighton Road bridge for upstream and downstream access.

properties.Title: Queenstown Trail
properties.subtitle: Kawarau River
properties.Description: Access is via the Twin Rivers/Queenstown Trail from the Shotover Delta Road. Park safely, as near as possible and make your way to the river.

properties.Title: Wairewa River Bridge
properties.subtitle: Kuriwao stream
properties.Description: Along the Clinton Highway [SH1] turn off onto Hillfoot Road and travel along until you reach the 1 way bridge over the Kuirwao Stream. Park safely either side for up and downstream access.

properties.Title: Kye Burn
properties.subtitle: Kye Burn
properties.Description: Access is off State Highway 85/ Kyeburn- Ranfurly Road just before the Kyeburn Bridge. Park safely either side and look for the easiest walking access to the Burn. Leave gates as you find them.

properties.Title: Lakeside Road
properties.subtitle: Lake Tuakitoto
properties.Description: Turn off Lakeside Road at any of the signposted gates. Shut gates behind you. A gravel trail follows the lakeshore for some distance with easy access to various water. There is also the Te Awa ahi Turua stream along the roadside to try your luck on. Trial suitable for mountain bikes.

properties.Title: Waihola Domain
properties.subtitle: Lake Waihola
properties.Description: Access it next to Wahiola Domain down Waihola place off State Highway 1 in the middle of Waihola Township. Public toilets and camping/campervan facilities nearby. Boat ramp also available. Plenty of angling opportunities around the lakeshore.

properties.Title: Lee Stream
properties.subtitle: Lee Stream
properties.Description: Turn off Mahinerangi Road onto Lee Stream Road and park in the clearing area just next to the small bridge. The road follows the Stream for a few kilometres upstream.

properties.Title: Lindis Crossing
properties.subtitle: Lindis River
properties.Description: Follow the Tarras-Cromwell Road (SHW8) from north or south until you reach Ardgour Road before the bridge, where you park opposite over in the clearing down by the large trees. Plenty of angling opportunities both up and downstream from here.Access to the Clutha River here is also available via 4WD tracks.

properties.Title: Lochy River
properties.subtitle: Lochy River
properties.Description: Lochy River flows into Halfway Bay on Lake Wakatipu. Walking or 4WD Access only with the lower reaches running through Halfway Bay Station

properties.Title: Lochy River
properties.subtitle: Disputed Creek confluence
properties.Description: Access begins at the confluence of the Lochy River and Disputed Creek. The upstream beat progresses through the gorge to the next farm clearing. This is Designated Water fishing, with fly only and a no take area.

properties.Title: Maclennan River Bridge
properties.subtitle: Maclennan River
properties.Description: Follow the Papatowai Highway Southern Scenic Route). Near Moutats Saddle Road is the Maclennan River Bridge. Park safely in the gravel area on the side of the road without blocking the gates, then walk down to the riverbank.

properties.Title: Wilkin Road
properties.subtitle: Makarora River
properties.Description: Turn off Makarora Lake Hawea Road down Wilkin Road at the Makarora Country Cafe. Park at the end and walk to the river, or if 4WD drive in closer to the river and park safely. Plenty of angling opportunities.

properties.Title: Makarora River
properties.subtitle: Wilkin River Confluence
properties.Description: Turn off Makarora Lake Hawea Road down Wilkin Road at the Makarora Country Cafe. Drive down to the confluence of the Wilkin River and park safely. Fish downstream of this point.

properties.Title: Galloway Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Manuherekia River
properties.Description: Turn off Highway 85 down Galloway Road until you reach the bridge.Plenty of safe parking beside the bridge for up and downstream angling opportunities.

properties.Title: Kerry Street
properties.subtitle: Manuherekia River
properties.Description: For access to the Manuherekia River below Shaky Bridge, Park at the end of Kerry Street, then and use the track to Shaky Bridge. Alternatively you can access from Graveyard Gully Road on the opposite side of the bridge.

properties.Title: Matukituki Valley Tracks
properties.subtitle: Matukituki River
properties.Description: Along the Wanaka-Mt Aspiring Road you will reach a carpark for the Matukituki Valley Tracks. Cross the suspension bridge to access various parts of the river both up and downstream.

properties.Title: Matukituki River Confluence
properties.subtitle: Downstream of the Motatapu River confluence
properties.Description: Along the Wanaka Mt Aspiring Road you will reach a turnoff into a working farm. Cross the paddocks to the small stream then follow the stream to the Motatapu River which in turn leads down to the confluence.

properties.Title: Berwick Road
properties.subtitle: Meggat Burn
properties.Description: From State Highway 1 turn off at Henley-Berwick Road over the Waipori River Bridge until you arrive at Maungatua Road. Turn left and follow the Road as it becomes Berwick Road. Past Waipori River Road you will come to the small bridge over the Burn. Park safely and access both up and downstream from here.

properties.Title: Speargrass Flat Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Mill Creek
properties.Description: A short distance from Arrowtown along the Arrowtown-Lake Hayes Road, Turn off at Speargrass Flat Road opposite to Hogans Gully Road. Park at the Mill Creek Reserve and access downstream of the bridge.

properties.Title: Streamside Lane
properties.subtitle: Mill Creek
properties.Description: Above Waterfall Park there are numerous ways to access Mill Creek. Streamside Lane follows the creeks meandering nature right up to Malaghans Road. Various angling opportunities and easy parking.

properties.Title: Riverside Recreation Reserve
properties.subtitle: Motatapu River
properties.Description: Access is along the Wanaka Mt Aspiring Road, either at the DOC Motutapa River Picnic Area, or opposite which is the Riverside Recreation Reserve. Plenty of safe parking and shut any gates behind you.

properties.Title: Nenthorn Stream
properties.subtitle: Nenthorn Stream
properties.Description: From Mt Stocker Road, turn into Shinglea Road and travel along until you find Bald Hill Road on your left. Drive straight ahead onto Hummock Runs Road until a sharp left bend appears where you go straight ahead onto the formed track. Through the gate follow the track until you reach the stream bridge.

properties.Title: Nevis River
properties.subtitle: Designated Water
properties.Description: Follow the Bannockburn Road south from Bannochburn, or the Nevis Road turnoff from State Highway 6 at Garston. Access is beside the Nevis Road Bridge over the river. Please note this is Designated Water.

properties.Title: Forsyth Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Owaka River
properties.Description: Take the Owaka Valley Road from Owaka, or from Clinton, Travel along State Highway 93 (Old Coach Road) turning into Owaka Valley Road. Turn into Forsyth Road and park near the bridge for upstream access.

properties.Title: Owaka River
properties.subtitle: (downstream of the Southern Scenic Route bridge)
properties.Description: Travel north from Owaka township on the Southern Scenic Route (Owaka Highway) and park at the first bridge. Access here, or follow Duttons Road which follows the river on to Newhaven Road which tracks to the confluence with the Catlins River.

properties.Title: Goodwood Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Pleasant River
properties.Description: Turn off State Highway 1 (Palmerston-Waikouaiti Road) onto Goodwood Road and follow until you get to the first bridge over the Pleasant River. Park safely off the side of the road on either side.

properties.Title: Puerua River Bridge
properties.subtitle: Puerua River
properties.Description: Travel along the Owaka Highway until you come across the Puerua River Bridge. Park at either end safely, with easy river access downstream.

properties.Title: Mercer Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Puerua River
properties.Description: From Owaka Highway, turn off at Cheetwood Road and follow until you find Mercer Road and then the bridge. Park at either end of the bridge safely, with easy access.

properties.Title: Rees-Dart Track
properties.subtitle: Rees River
properties.Description: Access to Rees River is along the Rees-Dart Track. Park at the end of Rees Valley Road (muddy Creek Carpark) and walk to Rees River. Or 4WD access over Muddy Creek is possible at low flow.

properties.Title: Rees River Bridge
properties.subtitle: Rees River
properties.Description: Travel the Glenorchy-Paradise Road until you reach the Rees River Bridge Viewpoint. Ample parking with good access to angling opportunities in the braids.

properties.Title: 1.Route Burn
properties.subtitle: Sylvan Campsite
properties.Description: From Routeburn Road, turn off onto the Sylvan Campsite Road. The Sylvan campsite has ample parking with easy river access. Note: This is a catch and release fishery.OPEN SEASON:1st Nov - 31st MayFISHING METHODS:Fly onlyDAILY BAG LIMIT:0

properties.Title: Queenstown Trail
properties.subtitle: Shotover River
properties.Description: Turn off State Highway 6 (Frankton-Ladies Mile Hwy) onto Tucker Beach Road. Drive down and park near to the bridge where the Queenstown Trail runs both ways along the river for up and downstream access.

properties.Title: Silver Stream Bridge
properties.subtitle: Silver Stream
properties.Description: Approach the Silver Stream Bridge from either Stedman Road or Wingatui Road. Park near the bridge for easy access up and downstream.

properties.Title: Sutton Stream Bridge
properties.subtitle: Sutton Stream
properties.Description: State Highway 87 (Sutton Clarks Junction Road) crosses over the Sutton Stream. Park next to the bridge park safely with access either up or downstream.

properties.Title: Tahakopa Valley Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Tahakopa River
properties.Description: From Harrington Mill Road turn onto Tahakopa Valley Road. At the Historic Railway Bridge, park off the road beside the track, with up and downstream access. Here, the river is very tree-lined.

properties.Title: Tahakopa River Confluence
properties.subtitle: Tahakopa River/Catlins
properties.Description: Travel along the Southern Scenic Route (Papatowai Hwy) and park safely off the side of the road at the confluence of the Tahakopa and Maclennan Rivers. Access is downstream towards the rivermouth.

properties.Title: Bridge Huts Road
properties.subtitle: Teviot River
properties.Description: From Lake Onslow Road, turn onto Bridge Huts Road and follow until the Teviot River Bridge. Park at the bridge safely and access up and downstream.

properties.Title: Three O'Clock Stream
properties.subtitle: Three O'Clock Stream
properties.Description: Follow Hindon Road, passing over the Hindon Road-Rail Bridge, until you arrive at a sharp turn into Hindon Station North Road. Follow this road along the Taieri River until you reach the small bridge over the Three O'Clock Stream. Park near the bridge for access upstream.

properties.Title: Peter Muir Bridge
properties.subtitle: Timaru River
properties.Description: Travel along Dingle Burn Station Road until you reach the Peter Muir Bridge. Ample parking and good access via the Timaru River Track to the upstream reaches.

properties.Title: Timaru Rivermouth
properties.subtitle: Timaru River
properties.Description: Travel along Dingle Burn Station Road and before you reach the Peter Muir Bridge turn right down a formed gravel road to the Timaru Rivermouth into Lake Hayes. Ample parking with access up to the bridge.

properties.Title: Mt Stuart Reserve
properties.subtitle: Tokomairiro River
properties.Description: Travel along State Highway 8 (Manuka Gorge Hwy) until you reach Mt Stuart Reserve at the Falla Burn Road turnoff. Park in the reserve or beside the bridge.

properties.Title: Coal Gully Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Tokomairiro River
properties.Description: Tokomairiro River (downstream of Coal Gully Road bridge).

properties.Title: Tuapeka West Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Tuapeka River
properties.Description: From State Highway 8 near Lawrence, turn off into Tuapeka West Road and travel along until the first bridge just after Tuapeka Flat Road. Access via a gated track to the riverbank. If gate locked park safely nearby and walk to the river. Tuapeka Creek confluence just upstream.

properties.Title: Von Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Von River
properties.Description: Take the Mt Nicholas Road until you reach Von Road where there is a small bridge. Park safely nearby and access up and downstream.

properties.Title: West Otago Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Waipahi River
properties.Description: From State Highway 1 (Waipahi Hwy), turn off onto West Otago Road where you will approach a bridge that crosses the Waipahi River. Park safely on the roadside with access down beside the bridge.

properties.Title: Waipori Falls Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Waipori River - upstream
properties.Description: Take the Waipori Falls Road from Maungatua Road in Berwick. Travel until you approach the Waipori River Bridge. Near the bridge is a safe area for parking by the gate (do not block). Access up and downstream from here. Note; there are more carparks further down the Waipori Falls Road.

properties.Title: Henley-Berwick Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Waipori River - downstream
properties.Description: From State Highway 1 (Allanton-Waihola Road), Travel along Henley-Berwick Road, past O'Connor Road and stop at the small carpark beside the bridge where you will see the Contour Chanel confluence. Access downstream to the Taieri River Confluence.

properties.Title: Waitahuna River Bridge
properties.subtitle: Waitahuna River
properties.Description: In the middle of Waitahuna State Highway 8 (Lawrence-Waitahuna Hwy) crosses the river. Park safely either side of the bridge and gain access near the picnic table.

properties.Title: Waitati River - upstream
properties.subtitle: Waitati River
properties.Description: From Doctors Point Road, turn down either Erne Street or Foyle Street to get to Killarney Street. At the end is a gravel road that leads over a field to the riverside.

properties.Title: Waitati River - downstream
properties.subtitle: Waitati River
properties.Description: Access beside Doctors Point Road Bridge. Park to the side of the bridge in the car bay and follow the track to the riverside.

properties.Title: Waiwera River
properties.subtitle: Clinton Hwy Bridge
properties.Description: Access off State Highway 1 (Clinton Hwy) where the bridge crosses the river. Park safely either side of the bridge to gain access.OPEN SEASON:1st Oct - 30th AprilMIN SIZE LIMIT:NoneFISHING METHODS:Fly, Spin, BaitDAILY BAG LIMIT:2 Trout

properties.Title: Young River
properties.subtitle: Designated Water
properties.Description: Access via the Gillespie Pass Circuit Track.

properties.Title: Routeburn River [a] Fly only
properties.subtitle: Route Burn Car Park
properties.Description: Travel past the Routeburn Shelter to the end of Routeburn Road. Fish upstream and downstream from the carpark.

properties.Title: Styx Weir Pond
properties.subtitle: Central Otago
properties.Description: The Styx Wier Pond is part of the Taieri River system.OPEN SEASON:1st Oct - 30th SeptMIN SIZE LIMIT: NoneFISHING METHODS:Fly, Spin, BaitDAILY BAG LIMIT:4 Trout

properties.Title: State Highway 1 Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Waikouaiti River/Dunedin
properties.Description: Downstream of State Highway 1 road bridge.OPEN SEASON:1st Oct - 30th SeptMIN SIZE LIMIT: NoneFISHING METHODS:Fly, Spin, BaitDAILY BAG LIMIT:2 Trout

properties.Title: Waters of Leith ©
properties.subtitle: Waters of Leith ©/Dunedin
properties.Description: Access downstream from the Lindsay Creek confluence to the Leith Street foot bridge.OPEN SEASON:1st Oct - 30th AprilMIN SIZE LIMIT:Trout: none, Salmon: greater than 45cmFISHING METHODS:Fly, Spin, BaitDAILY BAG LIMIT:2 Trout, 1 Salmon

properties.Title: 1.State Highway 1 (Downstream)
properties.subtitle: Shag River
properties.Description: Access point 1a - Park under the State Highway 1 bridge, there's good fishing downstream from here.

properties.Title: 1b.State Highway 1 (Upstream)
properties.subtitle: Shag River
properties.Description: Access point 1b - Ppark under the State Highway 1 bridge, there's good fishing upstream from here.

properties.Title: 2.Horse Range Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Shag River
properties.Description: Access point 2 - Park by the Horse Range Road bridge with access upstream and downstream of bridge.

properties.Title: 3.Switchback Road
properties.subtitle: Shag Rive
properties.Description: Access point 3 - Turn off State Highway 85 onto Switchback Road. Park safely near the bridge, access upstream and downstream of bridge.

properties.Title: 4.Munro Road West
properties.subtitle: Shag River
properties.Description: Access point 4 is at the end of Munro Road West.

properties.Title: 5.Pilbrow Road
properties.subtitle: Shag River
properties.Description: Access point 5 - Travel down Pillbrow Road to the end at the edge of the river. For the opposite side of the river access, travel down Jones Road to the end.

properties.Title: 6.Craig Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Shag River
properties.Description: Access point 6 offers access to both sides of the river. Park near Craig Road Bridge safely.

properties.Title: 7.McLew Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Shag River
properties.Description: Access point 7 offers various choices up the side of the river. Park near the bridge or use the track to find your own access.

properties.Title: 8.Grange Hill Road
properties.subtitle: Shag River
properties.Description: Access point 8 provides various locations along Grange Hill Road as it follows the river side. Find your own safe access.

properties.Title: 9.Domain Road
properties.subtitle: Shag River
properties.Description: Access point 9 turn off Grange Hill Road onto Dominon Road and park near the small bridge. Just below is a small tributary feeding the river with the historic Bowkers stone bridge crossing it.

properties.Title: 10.Dunback
properties.subtitle: Shag River
properties.Description: Access point 10 is where several points around Dunback offer good access. Parking is at Murphy Street near the river. Access from the foot bridge.

properties.Title: 11.The Grange
properties.subtitle: Shag River
properties.Description: Access point 11 travel down Dunback Street to the end at the edge of the river. For the opposite river side access, travel down Grange Hill Road to the end.

properties.Title: 12.McDonald Road
properties.subtitle: Shag River
properties.Description: Access point 12 turn off Dunback-Morrisons Road onto McDonald Road and drive to the bridge and park. There are a few pools here to try.

properties.Title: 13.Loop Road
properties.subtitle: Shag River
properties.Description: Access point 13 turn off State Highway 85 onto Loop Road and travel to the first bridge that crosses the river. Park safely near the bridge and make your way down to the river.

properties.Title: 14.Shag Valley Back Road
properties.subtitle: Shag River
properties.Description: Access point 14 - Turn off Dunback-Morrisons Road, along Loop Road to the second bridge that crosses the river next to Shag Valley Back Road. Park safely near the bridge and make your way down to the river.

properties.Title: 1.Little Valley Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Manuherekia River
properties.Description: Access point 1 - cross the bridge heading to the lookout and turn left down a gravel road. Walk to the river.

properties.Title: 2.Galloway Road Bridge
properties.subtitle: Manuherekia River
properties.Description: Access point 2 - Cross the bridge and turn left down a gravel road. Access upstream and downstream of this point.

properties.Title: 3.Fisher Lane
properties.subtitle: Manuherekia River
properties.Description: Access point 3 travel down Fisher Lane to the end at the edge of the river. For the opposite river side access, travel down Keddell Road to the end.

properties.Title: 4.Keddell Road
properties.subtitle: Manuherekia River
properties.Description: Access point 4 travel down Keddell Road to the end at the edge of the river. For the opposite river side access, travel down Fisher Lane to the end.

properties.Title: 5.Rail Trail Bridge 1
properties.subtitle: Manuherekia River
properties.Description: Access point 5 is to the river from the Rail Trail. There is 800m of good fishing upstream of the bridge before a 12km gorge section to the Historical Ophir Bridge.

properties.Title: 6.Ophir Bridge Road
properties.subtitle: Manuherekia River
properties.Description: Access point 6 - Park at carpark near bridge. There is good fishing upstream. There is a gorge section downstream for 12km.

properties.Title: 7.Ida Valley-Omakau Road
properties.subtitle: Manuherekia River
properties.Description: Access point 7 offers good access and fishing upstream and downstream of the bridge.

properties.Title: 8.Booth Road
properties.subtitle: Manuherekia River
properties.Description: Access point 8 - Travel to the end of Booth Road and park safely. There is good fishing upstream and downstream from this point.

properties.Title: 9.Rail Trail Bridge 2
properties.subtitle: Manuherekia River
properties.Description: Access point 9 provides access to the river from the Otago Central Rail Trail.

properties.Title: 10.SH85 Bridge 1
properties.subtitle: Manuherekia River
properties.Description: Access point 10 park under the SH85 bridge, with good access to river. There is also access to the lower reaches of Dunstan Creek from this point.

properties.Title: 11.St Bathans Downs Road
properties.subtitle: Manuherekia River
properties.Description: Access point 11 provides upstream and down stream fishing of the bridge.

properties.Title: 12.Wedderburn-Becks Road
properties.subtitle: Manuherekia River
properties.Description: Access point 12 is off Wedderburn-Becks Road. Drive onto the gravel beach to access the river.

properties.Title: 13.St Bathans Loop Road
properties.subtitle: Manuherekia River
properties.Description: Access point 13 provides good access upstream and downstream of the bridge.

properties.Title: 14.Fiddlers Flat Road
properties.subtitle: Manuherekia River
properties.Description: Access point 14 to the Manuherekia River below the dam (care is to be taken on this reach of the river). There is also access to Falls Dam. NOTE: There are different regulations for Falls Dam).

properties.subtitle: Awakino River
properties.Description: Nice moderate sized stream with rainbow trout fishing

properties.subtitle: Awakino River
properties.Description: Nice moderate sized stream with rainbow trout fishing

properties.subtitle: Hikutaia River
properties.Description: Small rainbows in the pools along with larger spawning fish during May/June

properties.subtitle: Hikutaia River
properties.Description: Small rainbows in the pools along with larger spawning fish during May/June

properties.subtitle: Hikutaia River
properties.Description: Small rainbows in the pools along with larger spawning fish during May/June

properties.subtitle: Hikutaia River
properties.Description: Small rainbows in the pools along with larger spawning fish during May/June

properties.subtitle: Hikutaia River
properties.Description: Access via paper road to upstream fishing

properties.subtitle: Kaimarama River
properties.Description: Small stream with full public access upstream

properties.subtitle: Kaimarama River
properties.Description: Small stream with full public access upstream

properties.subtitle: Kakahu Stream
properties.Description: Small stream, good public access but overgrown in parts.  Often high fish numbers in autumn.

properties.subtitle: Kaniwhaniwha Stream
properties.Description: Excellent access upstream along public walkway upstream and 0.9 km downstream

properties.subtitle: Kaniwhaniwha Stream
properties.Description: Parking past bridge with access to upstream fishing nice pool behind milking shed

properties.subtitle: Kaniwhaniwha Stream
properties.Description: parking near bridge (do not block gates) up and downstream trout fishing

properties.subtitle: Kaniwhaniwha Stream
properties.Description: Parking for walkway with access to downstream fishing for trout

properties.subtitle: Kapowai River
properties.Description: Low flows can make pools difficult to fish but good for spinners

properties.subtitle: Komata River
properties.Description: Small rainbows in the pools along Komata Road with larger spawning fish during May/June

properties.subtitle: Lakae Waahi
properties.Description: Perch fishing around clear water coming out of Lake Puketirini

properties.subtitle: Lake Arapuni
properties.Description: Trout fishing from bridge is very productive using a smelt fly behind a sinker, a dip net is required

properties.subtitle: Lake Arapuni
properties.Description: Trout and rudd fishing at Jones Landing great rudd fishing spot for kids

properties.subtitle: Lake Arapuni
properties.Description: Trout and rudd Bulmer Landing great rudd fishing spot for kids

properties.subtitle: Lake Arapuni
properties.Description: Trout and rudd fishing from bank

properties.subtitle: Lake Arapuni
properties.Description: Trout and rudd fishing from park suitable for fly or spin fishing

properties.subtitle: Lake Arapuni
properties.Description: Trout fishing from platform at bottom of stairs under dam in very swift water

properties.subtitle: Lake Arapuni
properties.Description: Trout release site suitable for spin fishing

properties.subtitle: Lake Arapuni
properties.Description: Mangawhio Stream Falls accessible by boat or a long hike trout fishing with fly or spinner

properties.subtitle: Lake Arapuni
properties.Description: Lake Arapuni offers good trolling and is stocked annually

properties.subtitle: Lake Moanna-nui
properties.Description: Ample access on public walkway stocked annually with rainbow trout

properties.subtitle: Lake Ngaroto
properties.Description: Good rudd fishing and ideal for kids with pull up access use small floats and corn

properties.subtitle: Lake Parkinson
properties.Description: Stocked annually with rainbow trout please shut gate

properties.subtitle: Lake Pupuke
properties.Description: Trout, perch, tench fishing

properties.subtitle: Lake Rotoroa
properties.Description: Perch, rudd and tench fishing

properties.subtitle: Lake Rotoroa
properties.Description: Perch, rudd and tench fishing

properties.subtitle: Lake Rotoroa
properties.Description: Perch, rudd and tench fishing

properties.subtitle: Lake Rotoroa
properties.Description: Perch, rudd and tench fishing

properties.subtitle: Lake Waipapa
properties.Description: A quiet location to troll for trout along weed beds and near stream inlets in summer months

properties.subtitle: Lake Whatihua
properties.Description: Stocked annually with rainbow trout park by gate or on upper road

properties.subtitle: Little Waipa Stream
properties.Description: Classic spring-fed river with a considerable length of fishable water

properties.subtitle: Lower Waihou River
properties.Description: Fishes well with spinners during October/November or near river mouths during warmer months

properties.subtitle: Mahakirau
properties.Description: Small stream with full public access upstream

properties.subtitle: Mangaohae
properties.Description: Spectacular scenery along the DoC track to Speedies Road with reasonable numbers of rainbow trout

properties.subtitle: Mangaokewa Stream
properties.Description: Reserve track offers easy access to stream and free camping

properties.subtitle: Mangatangi Dam
properties.Description: Fishing for rainbow trout from dam only no bait allowed

properties.subtitle: Mangatutu
properties.Description: Up and downstream access to good trout fishing

properties.subtitle: Mangatutu
properties.Description: Parking area is now on Wharepuhunga Raod

properties.subtitle: Mangatutu
properties.Description: Access to river on road reserve

properties.subtitle: Mangatutu
properties.Description: Private property but access to downstream can by gained by asking property owner

properties.subtitle: Mangawhio Stream
properties.Description: Large waterfall pool boat access only from Lake Arapuni

properties.subtitle: Marokopa
properties.Description: Speedies Road offers good access for fishing in pools upstream to the falls

properties.subtitle: Moakurarua Stream
properties.Description: Access via paper road, downstream access must be gained by asking land owner

properties.subtitle: Moakurarua Stream
properties.Description: Limited public access please ask land owners

properties.subtitle: Moakurarua Stream
properties.Description: Access on true right bank for 4.4 km upstream

properties.subtitle: Moakurarua Stream
properties.Description: Access on true right bank for 4.4 km downstream

properties.subtitle: Ngakoaohia Stream
properties.Description: Excellent summer fishing for trout but very limited public access pleas ask permission to fish on private land

properties.subtitle: Ohinemuri River
properties.Description: Access up and downstream via Rail Trail track

properties.subtitle: Ohinemuri River
properties.Description: Access up and downstream via Rail Trail track

properties.subtitle: Ohinemuri River
properties.Description: Access up and downstream via Rail Trail track

properties.subtitle: Omahine Stream
properties.Description: Small stream with good access, often holds large browns in autumn.

properties.subtitle: Ongarue Stream
properties.Description: Jones Road access up and downstream good trout fishing

properties.subtitle: Ongarue Stream
properties.Description: Wool shed access paper road, good trout fishing

properties.subtitle: Oparau River
properties.Description: Small stream with easy access mostly on private farm land (requiring permission from landowners) but accessible via paper roads

properties.subtitle: Oparau River
properties.Description: Small stream with easy access mostly on private farm land (requiring permission from landowners) but accessible via paper roads

properties.subtitle: Oraka River

If accessing the property outside of open hours park on Ongarue Waimiha Road. No dogs allowed on property. Stay on farm track and follow orange trail makers to the river entry point (4 Km). Land between the track and river is private until you reach the entry point.
